review_contents: Basically made to be a multiplayer game. Way to many micro transactions. I feel like the game offer nothing new for a single player like myself. After about 30 hrs Im still not enjoying the game. The only mode I feel like playing is Offline GM mode (not MyGM). The MyGM is stripe down to nothing with some new features trying to make it feel fresh.
titles: Really tried to like this game..

review_contents:
This game is the same as the others, pay for play. They tried to change the archetype platforms but it essentially the same. Nothing new, more garbage badges that won't mean much. Centers still blocked at the rim by Point Guards.

How long until they nerf your archetype and force you buy VC to get the new archetype to be competitive? How long until they break your Jumpshot again?

How long until the defensive button spamming gets corrected? Never! The button spamming has ruined the game.

My opinion, save your money as this is the black hole of sports games! Big MONEY GRAB!

This game series caters to the You Tubers and not to anyone who has played basketball. Defense is on roller skates as the on ball defender, but the pass stealing is way OVER POWERED as always.

SAVE YOUR MONEY!
titles: Never again, Same old Garbage.  Wish I could give it 0.

review_contents: NBA 2K20 wants you to spend more money than one should, and it‚Äôs more than willing to constantly frustrate you with poor game balances that force your hand in making you pay your way through it. If I had to say anything good, there are noticeable graphical improvement done to the series. The lighting, renders, tattoos, hairstyles, neighborhood and MyCareer cutscenes are delivered with more quality and style than previous versions. This "casino gambling" system is what is going to kill it for everyone, as even governments are looking to pass laws that limit its abusive tactics. I do not recommend this product.

The slot and roulette experiences are great. The visual and sound effects really pull you in and help recreate the feel of being in a real casino at home. However, it's plagued with these annoying basketball minigames and the prizes can only be redeemed toward these minigames, not cash. These two issues ruin what is otherwise an addicting casino experience for me. Disappointed.
titles: Would be a great casino simulator but...

review_contents: Garbage. Servers suck. It‚Äôs a casino.

They messed up the one game mode I played‚Äî MyGM. Supposed to be the best NBA simulation out, but there‚Äôs nothing realistic about these Action Points, which limit the number of interactions/transactions you can make each day. Just couldn‚Äôt leave well enough alone, huh 2K.
titles: We had a good thing going

review_contents: When I bought this, I thought it would be better than NBA 2K17. But when I got it, it was literally the worst game I‚Äôve played in a long time. Believe me! Do not buy it!

review_contents: Game is a mess, glitches , no commentary, i cant get it to work. Players move good then slow, i tried every thing!! Not worth buying.

review_contents: El codigo ya esta redimido y lo compre el juego antes con la pormo,

Dumpster Fire

I can see why players who are accustomed to the gamey version of the physics in previous years' offerings might be frustrated, but I don't think it's fair to rate down a basketball game for being more like basketball.

Took a star off purely for the excessive microtransactions.

The preorder is supposed to come with 5,000vc with a code, which i inputted but can't seem to see on my 2k account...however, i do think that's an issue with 2k more so than with amazon. The game came in good packaging, no issue with the way that the game made it to my house

As for the game itself, i don't think i like it more than nba 2k19. The animations and the way that the characters move looks top notch this year. Defense is just incredibly hard to perform this year, you can't stay infront of anybody. maybe i'll get used to it after a while
I got for gift my son loves it

Ok, so you buy the cartridge version? Why bother, as soon as you put in game it forces you (yes exits game if don't have update) to download 30+GB update, so Nintendo's server took 3hr to get that. [Never mind the force you to have a SD card as well, even thou you bought the cartridge version]. So 3hr later game finally starts, oh wait, another forced in game update [pro 2K servers] that took another hour or so. Honestly! Why bother with a cartridge version then, if you must get a SD Card for it, and then wait 4hr to download the game anyway. How do you think a 9yr old kid enjoys the wait???????? Good job 2K. On top of that Switch version runs so bad, low frame rate, choppy video, and slow in game load times. And lets not forget that somehow 2K found a way to add a card-collecting game in there with micro-transaction. Worst Switch game ever, 2K should be ashamed of the lazy programing as they did not want to bother making a game that loads data from cartridge when needed, and then found a way to try to milk more money from an all-ready bad game with micro-transaction for a basketball game. Avoid this game at all cost, and maybe even consider avoiding 2K games as well.
titles: Be ready to wait, and wait, and wait. Perfect game for impatient kids.

review_contents: Only this I liked about this is it‚Äôs portability. Everything else is mediocre. Almost the same as last year. Just download the NBA2k20 rosters on your 2k19 and you‚Äôll save some money.
not optimized for switch lite

Amazing how a game that has a new version each year consistently has same basic issues. I play mostly single-player offline. There are several issues with this game, but the motion detection and the God-mode computer AI is the most obvious. Many times while playing defense I get in perfect position, only to have the ball morph through the hands and body of my defensive player and appear in the computer players hands for an easy layup. Double-teaming in the post against the computer is impossible. The computer has magnets in their hands while playing defense and some passes on offense are a gamble regardless of how well you position the receiving player to receive it. The computer, no matter how well you make defensive adjustments, go on God-like runs where they steal simple passes and you miss layups regardless of the offense player's rating. The computer AI forces some games to become competitive and it takes away from the realism. Still can't use alternate uniforms even though they added a 4th uniform option.

Also, its kinda strange how Amazon changes prices. I originally ordered this for around $45. Had a payment error, re-ordered and the price 'conveniently' increased $5 bucks overnight. Reordered and checked site a few days later and noticed price-drop of $10.......all in a matter of days. I should be able to price match within site and get discount since I ended up paying $10 more than whats listed. Go figure.
titles: Still same issues with motion detection and Amazon price fluctuation

review_contents: It is what we ordered and what our Granson wanted. Unfortunately it requires so much memory we will need at get him some sort of gadget so he can play it. Fortunately our tech-savvy kids, his parents, knew exactly what to get. So just a heads up. But there was no problem on your end. Timely and what he wanted. Thank you.

review_contents:
Literally a miserable game to play for anyone that plays these games casually. My career mode requires you play on pro difficulty or higher... aka is an absolute nightmare.. you can‚Äôt dribble past anyone. You can‚Äôt shoot. You can‚Äôt steal. You can‚Äôt play defense. I bought it expecting to have a little fun playing 1-2 hours a week casually. I don‚Äôt have time to devote to being a professional at the game. I won‚Äôt be buying anymore 2k NBA games.

As an aside by the seller fast shipping and great service in that regard.

DO NOT BUY unless you're only interested in MyGm or MyLeague on the go as those modes are the ONLY reason worth buying the Switch version.

MyTeam/MyCareer is POINTLESS as the FPS is terrible and only works when you're online. Most teammates you play with in MyPark play like garbage, can't defend, hog the ball and destroy your record (A.k.A. sellouts) and there's no verbal communication available.

If you want to play MyCareer or MyTeam, you're better off getting the Xbox or PS4 version.

The game would've had a 4 star rating if MyCareer/MyTeam worked OFFLINE.
titles: PARTIAL limited features sold to you at FULL price

review_contents: Nothing special this year and everything feels like it took a step back. Myplayer feels sluggish. MyGM is horrible, cant start in the offseason and you cant even sub in when you play unless you get the coaches trust up to a certain level. I went a whole game where the coach wouldnt sub my players out and I didnt have the option to, by halftime all my players were exhausted. Unless things get fixed I would recommend playing 19 and waiting to see reviews on 21.
Awesome game.

So far I like this game. I play the WNBA series and the layout is not the same and more awkward than the NBA series. The game is fun and realistic. As an over 50 female I find it challenging to learn all the moves needed to be successful but my nephews who are under 21 have no problems mastering the skills. basketball lovers will definitely enjoy this game!

Definitely better than 2K19! I've played this game series since the beginning, and while I still hate pushy in-game purchase or Playstation+ requirements for portions of it, I don't feel as if I need to buy virtual currency in order to make good progress. 2K19 was an insane bear to get anywhere in MyCareer, but I've only played 2K20 for a few days and have already progressed quite a bit further than last year at this time. The prelude story is crazy short, which was disappointing, and while I expect a few elements to pop-up in my first season in the NBA (MyCareer), a lot of the presentation looks/feels like 2K19 with the exception of some interface tweaks. Overall, good improvement from 2K19.
titles: In many ways, much better than 2K19, but still has issues

review_contents: Smooth nice graphics pretty fun.

Good for casual play in quick play mode. The career mode is frustrating because your player sucks starting out, and to upgrade his skills takes a form of game currency slowly earned over time. Unless you pay real money to do the upgrades, it will take forever to advance your player and you‚Äôll keep missing open layups. But if you just play in quick mode your game play is better and you can make shots. Good graphics and good soundtrack.

This game is a love / hate thing for me. I purchased it when it first came out but then quickly traded it in because there were so many micro transactions üò≥. However I missed this game because all my friends had it and would eat at me that I didn‚Äôt have it. I repurchased it to play worth my friends. Even though I have to grind like crazy it is okay. I truly love the game but wish everything was not a upsell. The game arrived within two days using Amazon prime and was in excellent condition. If this review helped you say so below and thank you.

Of course as with all Nintendo Switch ports I expect a little less content and pixel count, however this port goes beyond that in limiting the playability this game. No effort was made to make this game more portable. Additionally I do not see much improvement over 2K19 and for whatever reason they decided NOT to include a KD era Warriors in their historical team roster, you know the most winningest team since the MJ Bulls.

MyCareer, for example, is a single player mode that can ONLY be played while online. If you take a pause mid-game the Switch will go into sleep mode and you lose your connection and game session. When I first started this mode downloading my face scan took so long that I had to keep touching my Switch to prevent it from going into sleep mode and starting over.

Compare this to Blizzard‚Äôs Diablo 3 port. D3 was previously exclusively only an online game, but when brought to the Switch they took the time to ensure the game was portable and could handle not being connected 24/7.

When I first got this title I had to restart the initial update patch several times due to the game not being able to handle losing connectivity while in sleep mode. Unfortunately the interface did not indicate it was resuming where it left off so it was unclear to me if I needed to literally sit there and watch my Switch and move it to prevent sleep mode.

I like NBA 2K. Last year I got NBA 2K19 on the Switch after having owned and played it on the Xbox. However this year I went exclusively with the Switch and the glaring omissions and lazy approach to this port really highlight this versions‚Äôs short comings.
titles: NBA 2K20 Lazy port for the Switch

review_contents: Parents, please do not buy your kids this game. It is filled with real gambling mechanics. This game should not be rated E for Everyone but AO for Adults Only based on the ESRB's own guidelines on their website. Game companies are getting more greedier and coming up with new ways to try and get more money from their customers, people with gambling addictions, and unsuspecting parents. I'm just trying to help and warn those those people. The ESRB should be warning you, not me but someone's gotta tell you what is really going on. If you already knew all this, please disregard this review and I apologize for wasting your time. Thank you.

But, he enjoys the different play modes (blacktop is his current fav). He had the prior version so has a decent amount of hours on the game. What is more fun for me.....playing the "OLD school" players.

I'm a 2K fan since day one and this game is the looks like a Day One product like it did when it first came out. It's incomplete, looks cheap, and has a few new bells and whistles.

let's start with the good- the music and the NBA Combine and Skills Test, and the WNBA plays nice. The MyPlayer looks pretty much the same and while I like all the options to make him an elite player, he still misses wide open 3s and easy layups.

The bad is everything else that I play, namely My career mode. The storyline is a complete yawn. I literally fell asleep. It's too somber and serious for a game and unrealistic. The gameplay feels like something is missing, especially when dribbling. MyPlayer looks pasted in scenes so his hair looks phony. I have VC coins that came with the game but I can only buy Gatorade and not upgrade my player. The background in the settings look cheesey. The scenes break oddly, as if there was supposed to be another scene afterward with the anticipation of something happening, but it never does. The worse part is the game uploads extremely SLOW, even between transition of one selection to the next. I literally went to bed. The next day, same slowness. I made a sandwich, came back, and the game still hadn't uploaded.

The worse of all, is MyPlayer has NO NAME. No name on jersey or stats. It's awful!

All I can say is, don't delete 2K19. Wait until 2K does a major patch update for this game or skip it for this year.
game bad

Please Read Update/Advice 9/9/19:
A disclaimer that in the current form the online modes are broken and unplayable so I would say do not buy the game until these are fixed. If I could right now I would ask for my money back until it works correctly. If you read below you will see that MyTeam and it‚Äôs ridiculous amount of microtransactions was already a mode I decreasingly enjoyed. I had some
Issues but a lot of friends were complaining to me that I would not believe this years problems so
I checked it out more. There are some graphical
Issues with pop in and clipping and getting stuck on a backboard(yes that really happened) but somehow the microtransactions are worse because the virtual currency you buy is not even working. If you spend it to increase attributes it appears to do absolutely nothing and some people have said their attributes actually decreased. Your VC surely goes down so you literally just spent your money on nothing. Please Wait until everything is fixed and it goes on sale later this year and enjoy all the other great games that just came out like Gears 5, Borderlands 3 and Astral Chain.

The NBA 2K series is a purchase every year for me and this year was no different however the continued increase of reliance on virtual currency through micro transactions still remains a massive disappointment. Every year it feels like the grind to do missions and complete tasks to earn currency for more player packs to open is more daunting. I know a lot of people spend money to buy packs but I just can‚Äôt get over how necessary it now seems to spend your own money. As a result the My Team mode for me becomes something I enjoy less and less each year. One great addition this year is an engaging and fun story line in the story mode with some actual A list acting talent. The story definitely has its tropes and some stiff acting moments but I actually find these story modes to be a nice break and change up from my constant full season grind. Luckily one thing the series continues to nail is the NBA gameplay so playing a season continues to remain a joy. The graphics look great but there are definitely still some players who seem to look pretty different from their real life counterparts. The switch version looks better than last year in my opinion but I still love it for my nba 2K fix while traveling despite the difference with the lower frame rate on the switch edition. Unfortunately there is still a massive download for the switch version because they use a smaller cartridge which always feels like a penalty for those of us who prefer a physical copy
The game as always though runs smooth although I have to admit it will take me some time to avoid using the sprint button as frequently since they throttled it this year causing players to get tired very quickly. It slows the game up some but it‚Äôs not as unfair as you might think. Overall it‚Äôs a good game and what you would expect, the best NBA game on the market with far too many micro transactions.

Honestly in my opinion if you get it every year and enjoy it buy it. But if you can wait because of the length of an NBA season I say wait for sales which may happen quickly and if not there will be a large price cut around Black Friday sale time in November.
titles: Updated!!! Great basketball on the go despite too many microtransactions

review_contents: 2k gets worse and worse each year and just when I thought it couldn‚Äôt get any more bad 2k20 came out. It‚Äôs laggy and filled with bugs and crashes. It‚Äôs been 3 days and I haven‚Äôt been able to complete anything because of error CE-34878-0 and error CE-30005-8. It‚Äôs amazing how they release the same game every year but never fix the problems. Considering 95% of the game is the same you would think a year is plenty of time to fix the game, if not maybe they need to start doing releases every 2 years instead of every year because its trash and been trash for awhile.

2K you are unbelievably greedy. Every year it's the same thing, no work or effort put into making a game and all of the focus on how to nickel and dime your customers. You should be ashamed of the product you put out. $60 for the game should be all that your customers are paying, instead the game is almost unplayable without paying extra every step of the way.

Parents, please do not buy your kids this game. It is filled with real gambling mechanics. This game should not be rated E for Everyone but AO for Adults Only based on the ESRB's own guidelines on their website. Game companies are getting more greedier and coming up with new ways to try and get more money from their customers, people with gambling addictions, and unsuspecting parents. I'm just trying to help and warn those those people. The ESRB should be warning you, not me but someone's gotta tell you what is really going on. If you already knew all this, please disregard this review and I apologize for wasting your time. Thank you.

The game available on the disc is a bug fest, with no commentary, out of focus scenes, etc.. Additionally, the MyGM mode no longer allows players to import rosters or change settings, and forces the user to choose between playing games and utilizing the limited options set available.

MyGM 2.0 is a disaster and should have been, at best, a separate mode. The game literally runs Express ads and forces casino/gambling mechanics on players. Take 2 games should go back to the drawing board and think about how releasing buggy and incomplete games on disc, while stripping out beloved features will eventually impact sales.
titles: Buggy, in-game-ads, casino/gambling mechanics that use real money, MyGM 2.0 is awful

review_contents:
This game does not appear ready for release. The gameplay needs major work and the servers do not work. I have been lagging out regularly when attempting to play. When attempting to upgrade myplayer, upgrades do not even go through. Even worse, when a practice is completed (attempting to earn upgrade) you sometimes get points taken away as opposed to given, even when the drill was completed successfully. These are clear signs that the game was released without the proper testing.

2k: if your game is not ready for release, dont charge people for it and make your money from microtransactions as you already do.... charging for a product that does not work is unacceptable. Imagine buying a new car or appliance that does not work or only works some of the time, what would you do?
This is literally 2k19 with updates. Insulting similar to last year and equally as horrid. Servers are terrible, online gameplay is broken, archetypes are awful
titles: It's the same as last year, all the same issues

review_contents:
This is an offline review so keep this in mind when reading. I'm not an online gamer, so I'm just interested in playing basketball with my friends. I do play a little online, but not so much other than the quick matches, mostly with friends. The gameplay is amazing this year. Silky smooth, much better than 19. The AI seems very smart. The shooting feels perfect. I feel like the AI is smart, but doesn't need to cheat or cheese to win. They added some legendary classic teams this year, I believe 5 new ones. Mind you, we still have missing players. Just to name a few, Chris Bosh, Jason Terry, Rasheed Wallace, Moses Malone, etc... The band aid for this, you can download community rosters to fill up the gaps of the missing players. They have a pretty deep create a player this year, and the faces look better than ever. I saw a guy make chris Bosh on 20 and it looks nearly like him. The commentators will call out their names too, so that makes it more awesome.

The graphics look probalby as good as they did on the spectacular looking nba 2k14. Which most fans considered to be the best looking basketball game ever. The courts are shiny, the lighting is perfect, and the models are on point. Commentary is still good. The WNBA even has their own commentators, so that's nice fresh addition.

I did play a little bit of my career. The grind is real. If you don't like grind, don't be tempted to buy VC. Haven't explored MY TEAM or franchise yet, but I do hear VC is still a problem. But if you only care about playing basketball with a friend or just want to have fun, you can't go wrong with nba 2k20. I love it.
titles: Best the game has played since 2k11

review_contents: Didn't know I had to get a SD card for this game and also its installing and downloading updates very very slowly it'll probably take a day. Finally it took 2 weeks for the game to make it here in the mail ordered a switch case a few days ago and it's almost here already

I have 2k19 and was not excited at all about 2k20. It‚Äôs the same thing year after year.... each new game just ask you to spent more money and put more time into it. Grinding and grinding to get to a proper level. I‚Äôm not even saying reasonable grinding. Outrageous grinding. You can‚Äôt imagine how much hours I have put into my player to get him to level 91. Also, you can‚Äôt even imagine how much hours it will take me to take him up to level 99. I don‚Äôt even spent actual money, my player at level 91 is only by grinding on every game in my career mode. This game is very very dangerous. It‚Äôs pretty much pushing you to spent real money in order to get to these high level quicker. Constantly pushing you to buy VC. Did I mention the ads too? Oh yeah, before you start a game, they slip an add that you have to watch. Garbage. The only reason they do this, it is because they have the majority of the market for this type of game. Outrageous. Do not buy. Save your money and buy 2k19 for a lot cheaper because 2k20 does not deserve your 60 dollars. Trust me.
titles: Do Not Buy. Save yourself some time and money. Just get 2k19.

review_contents:
This is an offline review so keep this in mind when reading. I'm not an online gamer, so I'm just interested in playing basketball with my friends. I do play a little online, but not so much other than the quick matches, mostly with friends.

The gameplay is amazing this year and that's what I look at when playing nba 2k every year. 2K19 had serious flaws on the court, in the AI, glitches and just didn't seem on point. But NBA 2k20 is 19 on caffeine.. It's Silky smooth, much better than 19. The AI seems very smart. The shooting feels perfect. I feel like the AI is smart, but doesn't need to cheat or cheese to win. They added some legendary classic teams this year, I believe 5 new ones. Mind you, we still have missing players. Just to name a few, Chris Bosh, Jason Terry, Rasheed Wallace, Moses Malone, etc... The band aid for this, you can download community rosters to fill up the gaps of the missing players. They have a pretty deep create a player this year, and the faces look better than ever. I saw a guy make chris Bosh on 20 and it looks nearly like him. The commentators will call out their names too, so that makes it more awesome.

The graphics look probalby as good as they did on the spectacular looking nba 2k14. Which most fans considered to be the best looking basketball game ever. The courts are shiny, the lighting is perfect, and the models are on point. Commentary is still good. The WNBA even has their own commentators, so that's nice fresh addition.

I did play a little bit of my team and I was hooked. I think you will enjoy it too. You can gain XP and unlock many things and no real currency is required and while the option to spend real money is there they dont push it. I unlocked Michael jordan card after a few games and I‚Äôm making a ton of virtual currency and having a blast doing it . This mode in my opinion is worth buying this game. Think of it as ultimate team for basketball . If you don't like grind, don't be tempted to buy VC on my career. That‚Äôs the mode where you might be tempted to spend more real money.

But if you only care about playing basketball with a friend or just want to have fun, you can't go wrong with nba 2k20. I love it.

Online I had trouble connecting, a lot, mind you this was at launch, I hope they patch it up soon for you online fans. Peace to all.

It's an unfinished remake of 2k19. The loading screens take so long and the games core mechanics dont even work. The only thing that works in the game is the microtransactions. The casino part of the game works well and I can see it tricking many kids out of their money.
titles: Broken and tries to squeeze every dime you have!

review_contents: I agree - same game different picture on cover. They should just let people download updated rosters/career mode.

God awful. It is a $100 dollar investment because if you want a chance to win you need to buy VC and then dump endless hours into the most boring single player mode of all time to get your badges. And without badges you can‚Äôt make a shot. Would give it a 0 off possible. If you are thinking about buying the game I suggest not to.

I miss the MyGM saga. Gameplay is an incremental upgrade, but nice. I can finally play as Elena Delle Donne, so that's rad. :). The MyPlayer story mode just didn't do it for me, and I've played literally every one of these they've released. Really, it's the WNBA modes that save this one for me.

I don't play online or play the card game, so I can't comment on the microtransactions. I'm sure they suck.
titles: Core gameplay is still quite good

review_contents: This is not a game for children. It is a virtual casino.

Enjoy staring at the auction house waiting for someone who drops $5000+ on this game per year to post some cards for us free-to-players.

If you don't pay up, have fun never being close to top tier in any of the modes, through no fault of your own. Despite the game costing $60 up front, it's grind and pay (even more) to have fun. No thanks, not again.
Game is always freezing. Game feels super slow and once again, shooting is never consistent.
There‚Äôs a casino in my basketball game... enough said.

I am loving the game a lot this year for NBA 2K20. The gameplay is a bit smoother and there are some glitches here and there but they will eventually get patched like most games. The main complaint that people have seemed to be having were all of the costly microtransactions. If people have to complain about that then maybe they should grind in the game and not complain when they can earn VC tokens like how most games should be played and by grinding and not having to buy coins. I really love the MyCareer campaign this season and this is coming from somebody that never touches MyCareer and always jumps into MyLeague/Season mode or whatever it's called. I ordered my copy 2 weeks ago and have not been able to put it down. Don't listen to other reviewers that bash this game because this game has been nothing but fun for me.
titles: Fun game I have no complaints.

review_contents:
The 2k series as a franchise is one that has its runs. Over the years Visual Concepts has had the best sports game on the market. But recently they have become lazy barely improving their game. As one of the best selling games, it is actually surprising how they keep getting away with putting the same game on the market every year.
Gameplay has been a major advantage for 2k sports. It is seriously the best gameplay you can get on any sports game on the market. But when I first played NBA 2k20, I noticed something that has seemed very similar to the previous three games. It seemed like I was in a trance. I quickly went back to 2k18 and 2k19 and it was the same.
Every year it's the same animations and it gets boring. The 2k team has not removed any of the animations that the gaming community constantly complains about. Driving baseline, shooting a layup and not being able to pull out of it, hip steals, and finally microtransactions. Even when I use the best ball handler in the NBA, Kyrie Irving who has a 96 ball handle, I still find myself losing the ball to scrub defenders. I myself have fallen victim to microtransactions. It always looks like a good deal until after it‚Äôs purchased. In the long, run you always spend more on them then the actual game does ($60.00). This has been a problem ever since the introduction of MyTeam in 2k13. Just when you think it would improve, it doesn‚Äôt.
I will give credit to 2k where they deserve. They offer a variety of game modes. But the one thing that has remained in these modes. The commentators. It has been the same voices since the TNT crew was added to the game. Lately, they have added other voices as special guests but there still has not been an overhaul of the commentators. When the new season comes around, a lot of the talk between them stays the same. They add simple lines to talk about the new players. Which really just shows me that the game is very repetitive.
Even with the poor gameplay improvements over the last few years, 2k remains one of the best selling games. IGN‚Äôs review said it best, a lot of these modes are too dependent on microtransactions. Sound familiar? If you love the sport of basketball and are a die-hard basketball fan then it‚Äôs very simple. This is the game for you. However, if your only a casual fan or vaguely intrigued then steer away from this product. If you still need some basketball gameplay in your life you can turn to NBA 2k Playgrounds, NBA Jam, or NBA Live. They may not be quite as exciting but they aren‚Äôt nearly expensive.
titles: NBA 2k20: A Whole Lot of the Same

review_contents:
I wrote a review for NBA 2K19 which for some reason did not get submitted no matter how many times I tried, so here's hoping this one actually goes through.

Last year's MyCareer on-court gameplay was pretty bad, but this year takes the cake. In general, the gameplay is absolute trash. My player won't accelerate quickly, if at all, when he gets the ball, in any mode, which sucks because it's nearly impossible to score fastbreak points. It doesn't even matter how fast or how much faster my player is, he runs too slowly that even opponent's big men can catch up.

The movement has gotten even clunkier, it looks like they're trying to make it harder for players to move or do much. Heck, even when I'm defending, my player moves slower than the opponent ball handler, who shouldn't be able to outrun my player on sprint. This makes absolutely no sense! This game makes it clear that they're biased towards opponent AI, as if previous games didn't make that clear.

Teammate AI is also probably at its worst. Where's the defense from my teammates? All they do is keep their hands when defending under the basket, but opponent AI will block me or do whatever they can to prevent me from scoring. 2K really needs to hire people who actually watches NBA to work on this game, because it's clear the current employees have no idea what they're doing. I would not recommend this game, it's probably the worst of the series, and that's saying a lot.

Update: After weeks of playing MyTeam, I can confirm that the gameplay for the mode is even worse. For some reason, your players are more likely to miss somewhat contested layups and shots while your opponents are very likely to make heavily contested layups. Whoever made this game definitely did not want to give us a basketball game. Not only that, but players like Kobe move too slowly, and in general the players start moving slowly for two seconds or so before moving faster, which makes fast break more impossible. The people who worked on this game definitely don't watch sports to keep screwing up this game year after year.

Also, I don't believe this game getting 4 stars, they must have used bots or some means of getting high ratings because 2K20 is a three-star game, at most.
titles: AVOID BUYING, SAVE YOUR MONEY! Gameplay is even worse, and MyCareer suffers the most.

review_contents:
I've been a 2K fan since 2012 and my son got into basketball playing this game. It was our father \ son time together and our passion

How times change. I'm frankly amazed at the ratings on Amazon as the Metacritic rating (average across all gaming sites is only 78%) and review on Reddit and other sites are appaling. This game is so fundamentally broken on so many levels that frankly it takes much out of the game.

for example: -

1. In Mycareer the AI of the fellow players can be horrible in terms of defense. Players don't switch. Shooters get left widen open even when play 3-2 zone

2. Shooting whether youre using the stick or X button feels off and random. You can have over 80% 3 point shooting and still often miss wide open three's.

3. Coaches AI will call time outs literally 1-2 minutes after I've called one wasting valuable time outs for no reason

4. Coach AI won't respect minute allocation or coverage allocation in Mycareer. For example, I'll have Lebron switch to PG to cover the opponent PG and all of sudden I'll find myself playing point again which defeats the purpose.

5. MyTeam is a massive MASSIVE money suck. The only way to get Galaxy Opal and most Pink Diamond level players is either a ridiculous grind to get TM's or spend money. 2K is furiously introducing high level Diamond and Pink Diamond players in an effort to get people to play this mode and you realize that being any good in MyTeam requires you to spend money to open packs and get top players

6. Tons of time and effort wasted in pointless videos and 2K TV videos which add little entertainment or practical value. Seriously, most of us don't really care about 2k Fashion or the interview of WnBA players (no offense). We just want to play the game.

7. Tons of bugs - for example my halftime report stats will be blocked out my banner which won't allow me to see my stats. Tonight in the Playoff stats I couldn't even see the opposing team stat strengths - there was simply an empty space next to their weaknesses

NBA2k20 is a classic example of what happens when a company has been too dominant and made too much money off a product with little competition. The producers should have spent more dev resources improving the game play \ shooting and fixing bugs then expensive cut seens and useless videos

2k20 is a shadow of what was once a great franchise and as someone who worked a long time in games, the company and its executives should be embarrassed by quality of the product they have put out. Frankly I'm even more shocked that Microsoft and Playstation would allow a product with so many flaws to even grace their platform.

A sad, sad example of capitalism and rampant marketing at its worst. Save your money and wait a few seasons for a better team to be given ENOUGH time to make a decent game.

P.
titles: Horrific.  So broken on so many levels.  Badly flawed

review_contents: What were they thinking? Casino??? Gameplay is so choppy compared to previous 2K19. All focused on multiplayer come on now.
The gameplay this year is absolutely horrible. MyCareer is trash. NBA Live needs to hurry up and take over because this is garbage. Ronnie2k please retire.
titles: And I thought Madden was terrible...

review_contents:
2K needs to have lawsuits out for them as their games may cause people to become violent. 2k20 is a game that will cause you to lose your mind. Turning mild-mannered guys into belligerently angry mouth-foamers. 2k has given us rabies.

Whichever game system makes a great basketball game for their system I will buy that game and that system. But 2k is on my boycott list.

But I will not buy from 2k ever again. This company don't know what they're doing. I had NBA 2k8 and NCAA 2k8 for 11 years until my Xbox 360 died and I loved those games. I really do miss them. They weren't perfect but far better than this junk 2k is making these days.

I don't even want to turn on my Xbox 1 anymore. Every time I play 2k19 or even worse 2k20 I almost want to cry and after 5 minutes I go idiotically mad. Biting off the heads of the people around me when I am a laid back person.

The controls are like the players are on ice skates.

The computer hits off balance 3 pointers from 5 feet behind the 3 point line while I struggle to hit a wide open lay-up.

It's just not fun and 100% makes you want to beat everything in your path: your alexa, your tv, your xbox. For the love of my sanity I have to put this game down.

Absolute trash. I hate you 2k sports. I won't buy anymore of your games.
Not enough difference from 2k19 feature wise. The monetization is so in your face that it feels like a mobile game. Mobile games are usually free to play though, while this is $60. Not worth it.

Reviews for this game are subjective to everyone who plays it and while I have been playing this game for many years, it is hard for me to do this and actually have to come on here to say something about it. My favorite aspect of NBA 2K series is the online head to head play. Literally buy the game every year to do that, MyGM, and maybe a little MyTeam and MyCareer here and there but multiplayer is my forte. I just love versing other people online. Only issue is... it is nearly unplayable. You will find yourself pulling your hairs out wondering why you can't hit a jump shot that's literally 10 feet from the basket or why they decided to do a last minute reverse layup and hit under the hoop and out of bounds. It literally has an input lag and I feel in past games there was this issue but more frequently in recent years and this game is easily one of the worst. It's to the point where I strategize playing but driving to the basket because the shooting is so awful and delayed. Also the fact that you can verse the same exact time is by far the most annoying thing and there is no option to friendly concede. You will also notice the frame lagging.

The graphics for this game are great, some character models extensively detailed more than others. The commentary has added commentators to the roster but they are still repeating lines from like 2k14 and with playing a team more than 2 times you'll already start to notice.

TakeTwo has plenty of money to be able to fix these server issues and improve the gameplay. There needs to be a stress on adding more to the game with better live updates within the real NBA. As a fan for many years if I am to buy a future game I will be purchasing it used to not directly give the company money. I think it's time we take a step back from consistently giving them money year after year and force them to invest that money into fixing simple day to day errors within the game.

Beyond the horrible VC monetization, slow grind for badges and level-ups, and jokes about this being a gambling game with mini-basketball game built in, there are other complaints that I have.

As a lifelong bball video game player (since Jordan vs Bird on PC through every single NBA Live and every single 2k title (except 2k19), I feel I am qualified to rate this game.

First the positives: the grind is indeed less onerous than in the past and I found that you get a lot more VC during games, through endorsements, through daily goals, (which regularly drop 2-4k of VC for something simple like getting a triple double or winning 5 games, etc.), and yes, even through the daily gambling wheel, which gives you free stuff. Badge grinding is also made easier as there are many after game practices each targeting a specific category of badge (finishing, shooting, playmaking, defense). Also, the badge system and new build system allow for a ton of new and different builds, unlike in the past, where you were either a slasher, shooter, or defender.

Now the bad and there's aplenty. The new badge system really messes up competition in mypark. The flexibility is good in a way but also bad. You can have centers with Gold dimer badges or finishers with shooting badges. It is incredibly confusing. You have no idea how to guard your guy until his "slasher" nails a half court 3 and you realize he has 5 gold shooting badges. What's more, almost everyone has interception and pickpocket badges which completely nerfs my archetype pass-first playmaker. Passing is completely destroyed in park with tons of interceptions. The game has removed almost every single advantage for a high-iq player. For instance you can pump fake someone into the air but your gather is so slow, he'll be able to block you on his second jump. Ditto with my hesitations to mistime the defender. He'll bite and jump as you near the rim but it won't matter cause you cannot get your shot off before he's ready to jump again or his mere presence makes you miss the wide open layup. You can't backdoor cut anymore as they've moved the inbounds to half court. Everyone is now practically 99 speed with gatorade exercise boosts. As someone who relies completely on IQ and reading the defender and who stinks at spamming crossovers and step backs and shooting, I am completely useless in park. The game is so sluggish compared to 2k18. (I had a 0.780 win record in 2k18 park across 5000 games.)

Other complaints: 1) the park courts are hideous and hard to navigate 2) you cannot join other friend's games unless they invite you. 3) it is really difficult to know who is a good player or bad (need to click 8 buttons to get to their park record) 4) there seems to be a lot of players with "glitched" players. Whereas I only have one category of stats in the 90's, I see guys with 90 finishing, 86 shooting, and 99 playmaking. There's no way you can create this type of player with the build system unless they exploited an early glitch. 5) parks are too spread out with too few players active 6) there is no fair matchmaking system. 99 dudes with .900 records team up with other 99 dudes with .850 records and destroy random teams. This is the norm.

All in all, multiplayer is complete garbage this year.
it‚Äôs basically 2k19.5. why am i looking at the same park from last year lol. WORST 2K OF ALL TIME

2k is a joke. You have to pay money to win online. And most of the best players know glitches for badges and VC. Unbalanced and unfair online games. Most people quit because of this.

The game is way slower this year. You have to spent TONS of time to get badges in order to hit a shot or play defense. So Awful. The park neighborhood is the exact same. The menus are the same . It's just slow and worse. Most 2k fans spend 100 plus dollars on this game. Every year. They're getting ripped off. 2k only cares about money.

Wow the gameplay is slow, like REALLY slow. At first I thought it was my unit or the servers but I watched people playing the game on YouTube and they experienced the same. It's like a 1.5 second delay from the time you move the controller to the time the player reacts. Its almost like they built a lag time into the game. Oh and did I mention that you dont have a name in mycareer? The mycareer cut scenes were pretty decent but that's the only positive thing I have to say. Came back here to write a review and discovered the game rating is 2 stars out of 5. Sad, this is what happens when a company has no competition they start to lower their standards
titles: First time I preordered a game, wont do it again

review_contents:
I don't know how this game has a near 5 Star rating when almost every review I've seen from the 2K community has been mostly negative. Across social media platforms.

I held off on updating from 2K17 as long as I could. I even switched over to Live 18 for a short period of time. I finally gave in as there are too many roster updates and rookies to continue to manually update the rosters and create the rookie players. First impression, the animations and graphics seemed to have regressed from 2K17. The player motions are off and 2K seemingly has adopted the NBA Live controls and shot meter. I've been playing 2K since 09 and I loved the shot stick controls so I'm not sure when the control changes were made but so far I'm not liking them.
I'm not much of an online gamer. I generally stick to what was formally The Association mode. I haven't tried the MyGM/My League feature yet as I've spent most of my time in 2KU learning the new controls.

Bottom line: I'm highly disappointed in the latest release and I have strong doubt that 2K developers will listen to the demands of the fans in 2K21.

Edit: The cut scenes with player interviews and the halftime show with Ernie, Kenny and Shaq are arguably the greatest features in the game. The social media aspect in MyLeague is pretty cool too.
Glitchy
titles: Not worth the $60 at this moment

review_contents: 1st day of playing tried purchasing VC and it said error - failed. So I tried purchasing again and it went through but I got double charged. The 2nd day playing in career mode at the end of a game it dashboarded me and every time I load back in it took me to the same game and always at the end it would dashboard me. Anything I did to try and leave the game would result in getting dashboarded. Then my player file got corrupted and couldn't even load in. 8 days of dealing with support got me nowhere. So I had spent $100 on a game I only intended to spend $80 and I couldn't even play. Tech support never reads the back notes on my issue and apparently only reads the most recent update to my support issue so was an endless circle of going nowhere. They are the worse tech support I have ever dealt with and there have been bad ones. Don't buy this game. It is a ripoff. 2k should be embarrassed.
titles: Too many defects and game double charged me.  Worst tech support ever

review_contents: Same game as last year. wont support a company like them.

I can't believe people who give this game one star. What the hell are they thinking? There's no real need for jaded people in America. They're expecting this company to add something remarkable every year...some want bells and whistles galore, or to play General Manager...what have you. I buy this every year to play a complete NBA season with the current teams...me against the CPU. Is there something better? Isn't that basketball? The gameplay and graphics are spectacular. The moves and facial likenesses are fabulous. You can set it to be as difficult as you wish. You can play again friends on-line. Good lord! What in hell do these people want!!!!!

Its better than the xbox and ps4 version. The graphics are out of this world you would think Nintendo would have cartoonish graphics with kiddy detail by all of the trash consoles they came out with over the years but im here to tell you the switch is the console that u can say that its no joke here everything is nice clear framrate at 60fps 1080p while docked just like xbox but honestly way better just the game and enjoy with friends and family trust me its not 2ks fault but if Nintendo had a better way with connecting with friends other than friend codes this would be good all around with communication

I will never buy 2K again. The players run like they are physically disabled, especially when they begin jogging. The acceleration is poor and unrealistic and immensely frustrating. The physics are off and not realistic especially with the passing. Fast breaks are nonexistent I expect players to perform as they do in real life, but they simply don't. Klay is not automatic from catch and shoot 3's. Steph isn't 50% from 30 ft out. 3's in transition have a 0% chance of going in unless you slow down the play completely and wait for the D to return. Anthony Davis can't dunk over another player. Passing is incredibly slow. Players on your team foul the guy driving to the rim even if you're not controlling them. It does not feel like basketball and a single regularly moving player would destroy everyone. For some reason, Trae Young is overpowered and is a better shooter than everyone else.

I have uninstalled the game after purchase. A waste of time, energy, emotion, and money. DO NOT BUY.
titles: DO NOT BUY, layups are impossible and the pros dont dunk unless the lane is perfectly clear

review_contents: How in the world this got 4.5 stars rating is beyond me, 2K must be paying for reviews. It seems nearly impossible to make a simple layup, AI defenders stick to you like glue regardless of your dribble moves, the numerous versions of a player card is ridiculous, the auction house is a mess and very unorganized and requires great patience to get a card regardless of how much MT or VC you have on hand. As much as I am not a fan of MLB The Show as of recent releases (19 & 20) I wish sports games would take note of MLB The Show's Community Market. MLB The Show does a fantastic job auctioning off cards in their Community Market. You constantly lose MT renewing contracts in the game in the My Team mode. I bought the Legendary game through a PSN sale for for $30 and totally regret doing so. The game is worth about $5 if that and had I bought the physical copy the disc would be used as a drink coaster. Do yourself a favor and pass this game up. Don't make the same mistake I made being duped by a sale.

My son used his Xbox Live Gift Card he got for Christmas to get this game. I should have read the reviews first. Nowhere do they say that the date of birth has to be a certain age or else the kid can't play 60% of the game. I understand not allowing them to play online (or at least giving parents the option to mute other players), but ONLY allowing them to play "Play Now" ...COME ON! My son has WWE 2K and can play their story mode with zero issues. You are saying it's okay to fight, but not okay to play basketball? Seriously?!?! Thank goodness Microsoft gave us a refund on this piece of garbage!

2k is just money hungry. Been playing for a long time and over time they just get worse and worse about it. Plus this year it is extremely hard to even make a three on some courts. It's like the timing is off or soemthing. Really sad I paid all that money for the game plus had to pay tons of money in game just to get a character ranked to maby play in the neighborhood. I think this is my last year buying 2k. I love basketball games but not ones like this where all they care about is money and charging people to make there character maby a little decent. Very bad experience from someone who has a lvl 99 character and has played this game alot. Just time to smartin up and be done with 2k so they don't think they can treat people like that
titles: Very terrible experience especially for all the money you have to pay

review_contents: Another year, another broken game

This has to be one of the worst games of 2019.
If you have 2k19, dont buy this game, its literally a clone with an official roster change.
if you don't have 2k19, still dont buy this game. It's one of the worst game I have ever played. period.

My career is nothing special, same exact storyline, and outcome with some new characters.
2k servers are still awful and will continue to be awful for years to come.
The amount of input lag is embarrassing and won't be fixed because they only care about money.
The game mechanics are somehow getting worse every year, idk how this is possible but it amazes me they ignore it and continue to produce garbage.

tl:dr Don't buy this trash. It's an embarrassment to anything sports-related and I guarantee you NBA pros don't even play this trash, which is there marketing tool. They have updates that are 30+ gbs but don't fix anything so that's cool.
titles: Broken servers, Input lag infested, nothing new

review_contents:
Being required to be online for myplayer is stupid.
I've had to replay entire games because the connection was lost somehow.
The constant updates indicates the game was not ready on release yet again.
Update; lowered to one star.
This will be the last game in this series I will purchase.
Being forced to be online for mycareer/player mode in addition to actual commercials in the game. I'm not talking about the name brands on everything in the game actual converse shoe commercial, there was another but I don't recall.
I currently don't have the best internet, and it's really disappointed when I have time to play just to download more updates just to play, this seems to be multiple times weekly.
titles: Don't buy unless you can be online at a good speed whenever you want to play.

review_contents: If you want a expensive game that makes you purchase in game credits to be successful than this is the game for you! 2K games should be ashamed of what this series has become.

2k is a lazy company they charge for a 25% game they make my career trash barley any game modes they lied to us about features. Neighborhood is the same and can barely play it 2k plz never ever do this again

Not only has Myplayer turned into almost solely pay to play as if 63 bucks on release wasn‚Äôt enough. The WNBA I was so excited for, is a shell of what it should be. Despite the fact it updates (an update renders all but tutorial unplayable) an average of twice a week. And the updates take an incredible 5-8 hours!!! The WNBA might as well not even exist. review_contents: Terrible experience trying the career mode. Every time I played I just ended up in a bad mood. Your player sucks, like you can't do anything remotely fun or interesting on the court. As other's have said, they are clearly forcing you to have to spend real world money to level up to a point to actually be able to play, but I purchased the "Legends" edition that came with 100k of the VC (75k runs $20) you can buy, and I was still absolutely horrible. If you're a casual gamer in this genre, you won't have a good time.

This is a poorly made game. It will pick and choose when you lose. I was playing a game where I was up by 9 with two minutes left and it forced me to come out, only to put me back in with 3 seconds down by 1. Eh our teammates will intentionally take layups when you‚Äôre down by three at the end. It‚Äôs rare that I get upset playing video games but this game makes me angry. I rarely feel like I lost due to poor decisions making, but rather the random number generator decided I can‚Äôt make any shots and the other team is going to shoot 70% from contested 3‚Äôs. Save your money

I have to admit that I wasn't sold on this version of Kratos and his ongoing story as it just felt so different compared to the other 3 games. Once I bought and played it... I honestly understand why it got Game Of The Year because it is such an emotional yet wonderful experience. I found myself going back into the world even after completing everything because I love the detail and graphics that instantly transported me into Kratos' world. Another point that I want to make is that it was pretty hard for me to get into it because the dynamic between Kratos and Atreus felt harsh and empty, I felt no connection to the characters nor did I feel like rooting for them. I'm glad that I pushed on because it opens up much more that makes me see it differently and appreciate the dynamic even more by the end. If you decide to play it and feel like I did, for sure you should play till the end as it gets so much better.
titles: Such an amazing game. It deserved GOTY.

review_contents:
I'd never really been much of a 'God of War' Fan,
I played the previous entries, and they were fine, but I never really cared for the story or characters,
and the action, while 'bombastic' felt kinda limited. (maybe I should have played further?)

This new game is a complete overhaul in just about every single way!
-Better story,
-Better Gameplay
-Interesting characters .

And it ties everything together perfectly!

I actually bought the launch version of the game, that's why this is not showing up as a 'verified purchase'
But the 'PlayStation Hits' Version, is the same game, but now as an even better price!

The only thing I don't like are these bright red boxes, they really stand out when you own a bunch of older games..
titles: Great game, now at a great price!

review_contents: I played 5 previous God of War games. They all are decent games, but GOW4 is absolute masterpiece. Story is exceptionally well written, voice acting is amazing; movement choreography, graphics, sounds is best I have ever seen in any computer game. it is not just the best GOW game - it is truly the best game you can play on PS4. Considering that this game is PS4 exclusive - I would actually consider buying PS4 just to experiance this game. The game is unmistakably GOW, but adds exploration dynamics - quests and things to do after finishing the game. All previous GOW games were linear - go from one room to another to fight monsters and solve puzzles. This game allows you to explore at your own pace. Puzzles are somewhat easier compared to previous games. But fighting challenges can be very difficult, more so than in previous games. Auto save works very well, and you don't have to start the long boss fight from the very beginning if you miss one critical blow (a common frustration in previous games of this series).
titles: Best game in GOW series: True Masterpiece

review_contents: Disregard the 1 star review that guy previously posted. If you've ever played a god of war game you know what they looked like and can obviously tell which one of the games it is. There is nothing difficult about reading the way the description is worded. Wish I could give dumb comments a 1 star review. Great game.

There's no doubt about it. This is a five star game. Quite frankly, it's beautiful.
You may have noticed some poor reviews. Allow me to explain. God of War has developed a fan base over the last decade. Ever since God of War released on the ps2. It was a game that forever changed the landscape because it was so breathtaking and also so ruthless. Yes, there was tons of action but over the next few years, with the release of the brilliant God of War 2 and eventually on the PS3, God of War 3, the series had become known for its uncompromising protagonist and it's brilliant and bloody gore. If you haven't played those games yet then go do it, but suffice it to say that you probably don't quite understand how gory some moments in those games are. Now, with the release of God of War on the ps4, we have a different Kratos and a different flighting system. There's some blood in this game but not nearly as much as the fans expect. Gone is the brutality and gore and in it's place we have bigger themes and bigger landscapes and broader characters. Which is awesome. But, man, Santa Monica studios, some of us out there are itching for more of the same and miss the insane Kratos chopping creatures up and down with his blades of choas, while we mindlessly and ruthlessly button mash the square button and roll away with the right stick and then button mash the circle button until Kratos pulls something's head off while it's still breathing and it's heart is still beating.
That being said, this is the best game on the ps4. And if I had to choose one game to play on the PS4, it would be this one. Hands down

The latest God of War is an absolute masterpiece. I loved the story, the gorgeous world that had surprises around every corner, and the combat was something that even someone like me could make me feel like I had mastery over it. It made me feel like a God of War. Different upgrades allow you to really customize your style of play and you can experiment with what fits you best. The boy is super useful in combat and you never feel like he hinders or takes away from the overall amazing experience. This is up there with the best games Sony has ever made and should be played by anyone who owns a Playstation 4.
titles: An absolute masterpiece and one of the all time greats

review_contents: Great game

God of War transformed a previously mediocre franchise with one of the best games to come out of this generation of games. It has reset the bar of expectations for the quality of writing, storytelling, and art direction. It‚Äôs a beautiful game that tells an incredible story.

The game is a third person action game with a semi-open world.

There are several large, interconnected areas that you can explore, but are kept from traversing except along a defined path or loop. If you‚Äôve ever played Dark Souls or Bloodborne, you‚Äôre familiar with the level design of playing through an area and opening up a new path.

As the game progresses the world opens up more (literally).

The fighting-action is extremely satisfying, making use of the Leviathan Axe, an ace that you can throw and it boomerangs back to you. It is absolutely fantastic and easily to get the hang of.

The story is told largely through high quality in-game cinematics rather than cutscenes. The acting and dialogue is excellent and some of the best we‚Äôve ever had. The story arc itself will stick with you and there‚Äôs a very cool reveal at the end that still gives me chills.

Can‚Äôt wait for the next chapter!
titles: One of the top games of this generation.

All I can say it is most definitely a work of art, from story line to visual, graphics, sound, and history.If you are a fan of God of war what so ever, this video game will have you geeking out and send chills up your spine.... and by the way just like any God of War video game.... IT AINT EASY!
titles: Greatest Game I have ever played

review_contents: review_contents

Correct me if I'm wrong but the only "censorship" that I'm aware of that happened was them changing dialogue in two scenes that isnt important to the story whatsoever, people are making this into such a big stupid deal, the original scenes were gross so good on them for making these changes, would have preferred for them to cut the scenes entirely.

This game is Persona 5. It's everything you loved about it, all the stories, all the people, the wonderful story crafting, and more. The game is basically their final version of the game, with all the additives you could honestly want it what was already a very massive game.

Persona 5 took on average about 70-90 hours to complete everything, and this game adds about 30 more hours on that. It gives you all the previous DLC for FREE... yes, completely free. And all the new DLC is cosmetic or some battle items. So no missing out on the story or chunks of game here

This is the definitive edition of an already great game. You will fall into it's story, it's characters, and it's ups and downs all over again, or for the first time. The new character shows up early and remains prevalent, with the addition of new substories and plots. Even a new entire Palace! A whole new dungeon, even when they added more to the other palaces, like Will Seeds and even a new movement feature, attack move, and ammo replenishment. They didn't just add of all it in either, they made it story prevalent. They wrote new dialogues for this and more.

If you are on the fence, pick it up. $60 for over 100 hours of play, more with NewGame+ and completionists. Imagine playing Persona 5, all over again, eagerly awaiting the new stories, whole new city they added, and every new cut scene. There is always something there saying, play more.

Don't support these new shills who censor games based on their own personal beliefs.

They literally change parts of the story and game to fall into lines with their terrible views. When a game developer cannot properly localize the game without putting their own personal opinions or beliefs into it, it becomes not worth the money or even play.

Do not buy this. Atlus Games US needs to shut down and the localization people who do this kind of crap need to lose their jobs and never work in the gaming industry again.
titles: Game is a victim of "Western Censorship"

review_contents: Censorship don‚Äôt support it never well

When Persona 5 was released back in 2016 I bought it immediately and it became one of my favorite games of all time. Now they released royal and added so much new content it makes it 100% worth it. If you are on the fence go for it, it's an amazing story and the characters are the best best part. The "censorship" they did was purely business and only changed two little scenes that showed stereotypical gay men and changed it to better appeal to western audience's. I love this game and atlas made it so much better now with Royal
titles: Amazing game with even more now

review_contents:
Great game, I don‚Äôt like the fact that it got censored, but at least the censorship was small and not game changing. However it was a funny scene.

Game overall looks really great, plays the same and adds to the story. I don‚Äôt support censorship, but I‚Äôm not going to go out and boycott the game because the game studio caved to a few people in the west(who probably don‚Äôt even play games) got offended by a comical scene.

If you want a good jrpg or just want to play Persona5 again but with added content then I highly recommend this.
titles: Great Game, but don‚Äôt let the small censorship keep you away.

review_contents: i know it will be fun 3 and 4 were fun to play 5 is even better

Very childish storytelling and gameplay. Yes, there‚Äôs some ‚Äúedgy‚Äù swearing but it‚Äôs just so silly. Very little gameplay. Just lots of pressing X and watching. Your choices in dialogue have no consequence in the story whatsoever. Pointless.
The ‚Äúbattles‚Äù are too simple and easy and not strategic like they pretend it is.
It also has that classic Japanese storytelling structure with inconsistent pacing, overly emotional reactions to everything ‚Äúhuh!? Ohhhh!! Ahh! Ehhh!? GASP!!‚Äù.
It spells everything out multiple times, like a kids TV show, all the time, the situations, the surroundings, just in case you‚Äôre blind or can‚Äôt keep up with the simplistic and predictable story:
‚ÄúEh! Look! We broke into a castle and the king sent guards to stop us! OHH!‚Äù ‚ÄùArgh! We are the guards and our king sent us to stop you! Gaaa!‚Äù ‚ÄúOHH! The guards will try to stop us because we broke into the king‚Äôs castle! Ah!! Gasp!‚Äù ‚ÄúYou will now be stopped for breaking into the castle!!‚Äù
The amount of empty dialogue is exhausting. You could fast forward through so much without missing anything from the story.
The most frustrating part for me was after watching hours of dialogue, the game would let me play and move the character in his room and literally ONLY thing that the character can do is walk 2 meters to his bed and press X to sleep. Nothing else. This happens at the end of every "school day‚Äù. It‚Äôs such a pointless tease of gameplay.
The animated sequences are really pretty but there‚Äôs minimal animation. Like old school Speed Racer. Static drawings with lips moving. The budget must‚Äôve been low.
I‚Äôm really shocked it has such high ratings. It must be a very young audience.
titles: IT‚ÄôS BASICALLY A KIDS TV SHOW

For the people that like jrpgs and don't mind lengthy cut-scenes Persona 5 Royal is a MUST.Story may be cliche good vs evil but the way it is given becomes interesting and touching from start to finish.The amazing cast of characters help in that matter and show that you don't need badass protagonists to create a good game,just characters that feel/talk/act like real people and make you "the gamer" sympathize with them and feel part of their crew.
Combat is turn-based with a pokemon-esque touch(collect them all) but unlike anything you ever played,fast/fluid/stylish and groovy.
Side-quests if you can call them that also aren't anything you ever experienced,no more "take item-deliver it there" "beat 10 of these enemies" "gather 10 blue frogs" and "rescue the kitty from the tree".Side-quests are the daily life of a high-school student and are really important to develop your character and proceed with the main story.
Visuals are not latest technology but that doesn't mean they're bad in any case.Many other videogames are better in this section but besides that they're totally hollow(FFVII Remake-Death Stranding etc.).
Music section is like I said above,GROOVY with a variety that never makes you bored and its theme matches the current situation.Voice acting is top notch even if the protagonist is the silent type everyone else feels the gap.
Last but not least,the "Royal" edition of Persona offers a considerable amount of content and a variety of helpful additions that make your life easier compared to the original release.I own both the original and the Royal edition and I won't complain for paying the full price for it,totally worth it.150 hours of content if you take it easy as I do.
For me 5/5 doesn't cut it,if I could I would give this game 10/5.In my opinion best game of the decade along with Dark Souls and Witcher 3 and I dare say better than the original(and only true) FFVII.A real masterpiece from a company that appreciates/honors its consumers and not only its pockets.Hail Atlus!
Despite all the people downplaying the censorship, all they're doing is encouraging this kind of toxic culture; remember, give them an inch and they'll take a mile. Don't buy it.

There are a lot of people crying about two changed scenes that mean nothing to the story other than minor gags, but don't let that fool you in the least! The phantom thieves we all know in love are back with even more polish and style! Atlus has come back with another redux that fixed quite a bit of the few issues of the original and added in a great amount of new content.

Quick warning though, You'll be playing tycoon a lot. One hour turns into five.
titles: A gorgeous game gets a gorgeous upgrade!

review_contents: Loved it bought it from Walmart. Now I bought fully knowing what was removed in the localization (the gay men). Now after taking everything in to considering that was added new social links, will seeds, thieves den and countless others it is a very good game. I do see myself spending another 80 plus hrs again. I would strongly recommend it.

If I had to say someone bought this as an upgrade I would give Persona 5 Royal 2 or 3 stars at the price point of $50 or $60. Royal gave me maybe an extra 20-30 extra hours of gameplay, but when the vanilla version gave me 80 hours then that is a huge price point difference when it comes to time played. If you have not played the vanilla version then this is the one to get because Atlus removed some annoying mechanics from the original version and goes without saying all the additional content. The main I problem I had with Royal was repeated from Persona 5, I did not like how some characters were not playable till late in the game and it was also done in Royal. Just to be clear I don't count the text interactions of characters as "playable".
titles: In my opinion if you played vanilla Persona 5 then it's not worth the price of upgrade

review_contents: Persona 5 already is a great game but Royal made it better. They changed a lot from the original and added new mechanics. The new content adds 30 plus hours of gameplay. The dungeons have been reworked even the bosses are changed as well. For the people who say western censorship kills this game, don't listen to them they are just haters and probably play crappy games like call of duty. Its only one scene and its not even significant to the story. All the voice actors did an amazing job. If your looking for a good game to pass the time during this lockdown, this game is great. I'm very happy with my purchase.
Persona 5 Royal is a enjoyable experience with lots of new elements added in. Even if you‚Äôve played through Persona 5 prior it still feels like a fresh new experience.

I bought the steelbook edition and it's a great game. People are only mad about the "censorship" because they changed two homophobic scenes that are completely irrelevant to the story. People like to complain over trivial things sometimes
titles: DONT LISTEN TO THE CENSORSHIP PEOPLE

product_name: The Last of Us Remastered Hits - PlayStation 4
review_contents:
I heard the hype of this game for years and years. Obviously it is regarded highly in the community, but by the time I bought a PS4 it was a bit old. I can only say that this game aged exceptionally well. It still looks great, the gameplay is fun and engaging, but why I came to write this review is the story.

HANDS DOWN, the BEST story to any game I've ever played. The characters and their personalities are just perfect. The voice acting, the mannerisms of the characters during gameplay depending on the mood, the cut scenes. They are all just brilliantly done.

If for no other reason, buy this game just for the story. For the price it's at now, it's a steal. This is a game you HAVE to experience. I've never felt so strongly toward the characters of a game. It was more along the lines of reading a book or watching a movie. I urge you to give this game a play through, you won't regret it.

product_name: The Last of Us Remastered Hits - PlayStation 4
review_contents:
Overall, great game, great story, impossible to go wrong for $20 or less. You'll remember this for a long time.

There's just a list of minor annoyances that exist:
-The 'realistic audio' is cool and all, meaning voices are muffled if you aren't within a decent line of sight from a character, but this means you'll be plowing ahead of Ellie and she'll be talking behind a rock, and you won't understand a word she's saying. This requires subtitles. Subtitles ruin the experience for me because I read far faster than most games talk. You could also walk really slowly to stay next to Ellie at all times. But who wants to do that?
-The combat is the usual Naughty Dog style where it varies from extremely trivial to incredibly hard, and in some cases a fight that was hard for you on the first playthrough is easy on the second time, and the other way around
-Speaking of the combat, you can skip past most of the encounters by sneaking
-...until the game suddenly decides sneaking doesn't work and you have to fight 8 enemies at once
-So many enemies 1 hit KO you on any difficulty
-The hardest difficulty isn't very hard when you realize the game will always provide you with resources when you run low
-Why is Summer longer than Fall/Winter combined?
-The Playstation trophies are garbage

I've told many people I truly think this game is best experienced on the easiest difficulty and pretend it's a very long interactive book, and they've largely agreed. There isn't quite an experience like this game that I can think of, maybe God of War gets close but for slightly different reasons, so it's impossible to say this game isn't great and near a masterpiece. I just wish it didn't have the usual Naughty Dog flavor of frustrations and odd combat design

product_name: The Last of Us Remastered Hits - PlayStation 4
review_contents:
Really pisses me off! I just purchased this game for $17.99 on Jun 6 and the price has already dropped to $12.59, talk about dirty. Also, the game case was cracked in the corner and the case won't completely close! Amazon should really ship games better!!
The biggest disappointment with this remaster is the graphics! There is absolutely no reason graphics of this caliber couldn't run at full 4K. This game is locked at 1800p and it looks so bad on my $2000+ 4K monitor. the graphics aren't sharp at all and there is lots of aliasing. This is a PS3 game, there is nothing spectacular and demanding about the graphics for the PS4 PRO not being able to run it at 4K. The textures aren't even higher resolution, it looks so PS3 like. The developers could have at least added higher resolution textures but they were lazy to do so. Just like they were too lazy to convert the game from its complex PS3 code to the PS4. As I said, this is a PS3 game and the graphics really show it. There is absolutely no reason for the PS4 PRO not being able to run this game at 4K other than the improper code conversion from the PS3 to PS4 as a result of laziness from the developers. Lastly, one would expect a remaster to include every single game item and DLC for free, but instead, this game is still loaded with transactions on the PSN store such as weapons for single player and multiplayer. The best way to play "The Last Of Us" in the future will be on RPCS3 emulator unless the developers release a patch for this game to run at 4K on the PS5 when that system releases.

product_name: The Last of Us Remastered Hits - PlayStation 4
review_contents:
Absolutely a masterpiece of storytelling. If you haven't had the chance to play this, do so before the sequel comes out.

Pros:
- One of the greatest story-telling every done in a video game.
- Works beautifully without lag or hiccups on PS4.
- Plays at 60FPS without any issues, or set the resolution/graphics settings higher and still get 30FPS locked.
- Cheap price for such a good game.

Cons:
- 100% linear gameplay. This is not an open-world game. You're going from one set-piece to the next.
titles: One of the all-time best story-driven games
