There are expected features to be updated through the coming months, but for the gameplay itself, it's pretty similar to past Pokemon but slightly easier.
titles: Overall fun game, but not anything significantly better than past games

review_contents: This game is definitely not as bad as many people are making it out to be. I‚Äôd say from my experience you do notice a lot of wasted potential and I do believe it could have been much better, but it is still a Pok√©mon game at the end of the day. I mean, I would be lying to you if I told you that I haven‚Äôt been playing this game for hours a day. If you‚Äôre a long term Pok√©mon fan, a returning fan, or new to Pok√©mon, and you‚Äôre on the fence whether or not you should buy it, I say just get the game.
titles: If you still like Pok√©mon, it‚Äôs worth playing.

review_contents: Game box was completely empty when deliverd.

The animation look great and the story mode is very long. You can catch Pok√©mon‚Äôs you would normally have to trade to obtain.
Highly recommend to anyone looking for a fun new Pok√©mon game. I haven‚Äôt had any regrets since I purchased this game.

An excellent addition to the Pokemon series! Gorgeous graphics, great story, and the newest Pok√©mon designs are just a delight. I‚Äôm incredibly impressed with the game as a whole. The open world approach to catching Pok√©mon is refreshing and inspired. The people who keep complaining need to relax and give these installments a chance.

It's a great game. The story is good. My biggest complaint is that the game is FAR too easy. In 5 hours and before I began the first gym, I was already in possession of two level 90 Pokemon. It kinda killed the nerveracking battles from previous games.
Wtf my kid just opened a brand new game and it had no game inside the case! Way to go! Wtf!!!!!!

Ordered the game through Amazon instead of Best Buy because of the $10 credit promo. I never received the credit. Also, the game wasn't as interesting as previous. The villainous Team Yell doesn't hold any character development compared to previous antagonist. The game mechanics are good, but the plot is lacking. Also, the lack of of a legendary trio and national dex makes the game boring compared the older generations. I beat the story mode, and now I wish I would've rented the game instead. If only Blockbuster was still around.
Worst pokemon game yet....

5 hours in and my first impressions are very positive. I like that you get a lot more options of pokemon To start. Your party composition early can really anything and that's freedom few of the games have

This Pokemon game had so much potential, but it lacks post game, an immersive story line, and worse, it excludes a fair amount of Pokemon from previous generations.

The only hope this game has is with the upcoming DLC's (expansion pass), however, those will be at an added cost when a console Pokemon game should have already had this included to begin with.
titles: It's good, but could have been a lot better.

review_contents: Going into this game fully aware of the controversy surrounding it, I did not expect much from the newest Pokemon games. Despite what you might hear, these games are not at all bad. In fact, the new gameplay elements, enhanced visuals and new designs are all up to par with what you'd expect from a Pokemon game. The biggest drawbacks are probably the story and difficulty. For the most part, battles are abnormally easy and you may only have a challenge if you don't know type advantages. EXP share is constantly on so your mons reap the benefits of battle without actually participating. All in all, not the garbage heap many make it out to be. Honestly, I haven't had this much fun with a Pokemon game since Gen V.

I really enjoyed this game! It's getting allot of hate but for me as long as it wasn't boring since I haven't really played pokemon in quite sometime. I do believe they shouldn't have taken away the national pokedex and the graphics on the buildings looked a bit weird but other than that I really enjoyed this game which is why I gave it 5 stars.

Some praise, some criticism.
Main story is rather lackluster compared to other games in the series.
The wild area is great, it's a massive wilderness with varying ecosystems.
Raids are 4 v 1 of a dynamax pokemon, and if you win you get exp candies, berries, and TR's (which are one-use TM's of certain moves).
Amazon shipped a broken cartridge. They claim it was used in very good condition, but it looked like part of it had been melted and it wouldn't slide into the Switch.

Not a complete terrible game. It's very Short and not a very big storyline. The creators left a lot of Pokemon out to supposedly redo each Pokemon Sprite. The giagantimax is a bad idea. They should have brought back mega evolution. They neglected and left out a lot of necessary stuff in the game. It was not worth 60 dollars.

The graphics from walking around the Pok√©mon world is amazing much more detailed and beautiful than the older versions of the game. My 6 year old has improved his reading skills from following the storyline and my 28 year old made a separate account and enjoyed binge playing the whole game through. Get this game!

Honestly, it is a bit of a bummer that a lot of Pokemon were cut. But I really don't care. The game feels complete. Even if your favorites don't make it, there's a lot of new guys in here to make it so I don't even miss some of my old faves because I'm too busy enjoying what's actually there. And them making spawns for every single previous Pokemon seems like it would make the game too crowded with the overworld spawns.
There's more complaints about Pokemon missing from this than there were about Let's Go, which only had Pokemon from one generation. Most of these one star reviews just #bringbacknationaldex peeps complaining that they have less than 800 Pokemon to choose from.
The best Pok√©mon game to date. I‚Äôm only ~4 hours in and I‚Äôm having a blast.
Haven't played Pok√©mon in a while, I bought this one because a couple of friends recommended me this game, so far I've spent like 35 hours and still playing to "catch them all"
Best Pokemon game ever released. Beautiful animations. You'll be entertained for hours just by looking at the beautiful art and new Pokemon. I highly recommend this game to everyone.

Pretty short and not all Pokemon.

It's a serviceable Pokemon game, but it's not a Breath of the Wild, Odyssey, or Three Houses of Next Gen, Next Gen innovation

Just another copy and paste with another gimick added to attract and fool the fan base into thinking this is a "new" pokemon game... Shame on you Gamefreak. Shame on me for my stupidity for falling into another trap like a sheep. "Behh"

(Shied Mainer here but own this as well) Grinding and Farming gygantamax Pok√©mon as we speak (and I HATE grinding and farming in any game def not a IV/EV perfectionist if anything I‚Äôm a genwunner lol.) 100 hours in just unlocked battle tower (post story)on shield, but it‚Äôs gonna take me just as long as it‚Äôs taken me to beat the copy of sword that finally arrived(I got send a copy of the wrong game the first time it‚Äôs ok my copy of shield was ok!). You don‚Äôt need to wait, get this great motherf***ing game ASAP because I cannot recomend enough!!!! Shield>sword btw ! <3
P.s. not just cause it arrived on time hop deserved his reward in shied more than sword no spoilers!
titles: Best alt form of a Pok√©mon I‚Äôm a while! 5/5

review_contents: I loved this game as a person who has played Pok√©mon since the release of red and blue. The new Pok√©mon are well designed and the wild area is cool to explore. All the people who are complaining about the removal of the national need to understand that change is good and you need to evolve your strategies and not use the same team for 20 years.

I've been playing this game every day since the day I got, I mean what else can I say it's a pokemon game. I'm sure if you have any questions or doubts you'll will just check out the internet for the answers.

This is one of the two games my son really wanted with his Nintendo Switch. I ordered it at the same time as the console and was worried that the console would show up and I wouldn't have any games for him to play. This game actually showed up two days before the console. It worked out great!!

Amazing and so much nostalgia but the game is way to easy. Like annoyingly easy. There wasnt a single time where I thought I would lose a pokemon battle. If nintendo is reading.....I understand that this is technically a childs game but give the users an ability to choose difficulty.
titles: Amazing and so much nostalgia but the game is way to easy

review_contents: Nintendo, Game Freak and The Pokemon Company have outdone themselves. This is an amazing entry to the main series, and many new features have been added to address issues fan of the series have been bringing up forever (using heart scales to relearn moves, really??). Don't let all the hate surround the lack of a full national Dex dissuade you. there's more than enough to 'mons to catch and keep the game lively. Bravo!

The game is great, but I am giving 1 star because I preordered the game and was supposed to receive $10 credit for preorder. I have waited nearly a month since release and still nothing has been added to account. I will correct the review once I receive an update
Games great. Worth the wait!
Love this game! Gave to my son and both he and I enjoyed playing it over Christmas! Graphics are great and cute story line.
Basically an uprezzed 3DS game. Very little challenge for vets, and only sligjt improvements with the jump to home console/hyrbrid.

I like the game and barely notice the missing Pokemon due to the expansiveness of the game. The mechanics and options make it more pleasurable of an experience, such as the sound and skip movie options.

What I don't like is the fly features and the abundance of anthropomorphic final evolutions added to the game, as it makes it seem more like people fighting in costumes rather than Pokemon fighting.
titles: It's good but has very minor flaws

review_contents:
UPDATE: Amazon replaced the game immediately. Excellent customer service!

Game is missing from package. I received an empty box. Amazon suggested I call Nintendo and Nintendo said since I purchased it from Amazon they cannot replace the missing game but said Amazon should replace it. 1 star because I can‚Äôt give zero stars

Wasn‚Äôt sure how I was going to feel about this game since it‚Äôs so different from previous ones. They somehow kept the feel of older Pok√©mon games while completely reworking the way to play. Not sure how they did it, but I love it!

I usually never leave reviews on products l, however I‚Äôm not going to sit back and continue to see this game get ‚Äúreview bombed‚Äù by unverified buyers. This game is very good and a step in the right direction for the series. I‚Äôm enjoying it and have several friends who are as well.

Fun, a little more guided than the pokemon games I've played before. Less free roaming, more storyline. It's well done and I like the character customization. I don't like that the game limits the level of pokemon you can catch. You have to gather badges to be able to catch higher level pokemon. Overall it's cute, easy, and entertaining.
titles: Pretty good game, entertaining for adults and easy enough for kids.

review_contents: Bought this for my 12 year old son for Christmas. He already finished it and said it was ok, but really no different from his old 3DS version, not even the graphics are updated. He said he would have asked for a different game for Xmas in hindsight.
titles: Not much different than previous older versions

review_contents: I was super disappointed with them removing half the national dex... But honestly after playing this game I feel like its not too big of a deal. The game is super fun and I really enjoy the raids. Even with the dex gone I think people should give it a chance.
Game Freak dropped the ball with this one.

Really disappointing. The quality of the animations really takes me out of the experience constantly. I played the entire game and there is no variety in the gameplay. It's so linear with no interesting dungeony areas like in older games. Not worth more than $40.

Game was kind of easy to beat, as far as storyline goes. However, I enjoy the training and battling dynamics. Can‚Äôt wait until I‚Äôm able to transfer my pokemon from Sun and Moon to this game. If this is a game for a first time pokemon player, they‚Äôll be fine.

Its amazing to see how far Pokemon has come from GBA to now and how much extra activities and story they put into the game to make it more enjoyable for anyone who plays. This one is a strong recommend from me. A must for any Pokemon collection.
titles: Its amazing to see the advancement!

review_contents: Very fun game I knew it would beat Sun and Moon, the game just feels large and alive overall and most of my favorite Pok√©mon are in this game as well, EV training is so much easier and the wild area is cool, my favorite activity is the max raid battles.

Feels like a very natural evolution to the Pokemon franchise. I bought sword for my nephew and shield for myself. Nothing to complain about except that I haven't caught a Lucario and that was the 3rd Pokemon my nephew caught and he refuses to trade or breed one for me.
titles: It's Pokemon but updated and I like it a lot.

review_contents: Pre-load with the per-order was great and made playing the game right when it came out possible. Also, the game is so well done. Despite people freaking out about the National dex, there isn‚Äôt anything to complain about. This is the most fun I‚Äôve had playing a Pokemon game since Heart-Gold.
titles: Worth the wait and definitely worth the buy!

review_contents: Switch/Amazon needs to do pre-load games for more of their games. It‚Äôs very convenient and easy for many buyer on amazon, thanks

I have been a Pok√©mon fan for 20+ years and my 11 year old has been a fan since he was 4. We get the games every year and this one has new little things that my son has loved. I've yet to start it myself because he hasn't put it down lol
It‚Äôs fun. I play it when I get home from work. I use games to relax. And this game is very relaxing to me.
Works. Fun game. Not a 5 star review because of the occasional glitches, dexit, and the sounds aren‚Äôt harmonious.

My first main-line pokemon game! Very impressed by it. I know many people are disappointed by the lack of a national dex, but I think the game is fine without it. I still am not even close to catching them all. I preordered and the game came mid-afternoon the day of release. Hoping to recieve my preorder credit soon...
Game arrived and was not plastic sealed. Opened the case and game cartridge was not in case.

This is by far the best pokemon game I have played, graphics are better than before and there are a couple of new features that I like , for example the fact that you can camp and interact with your pokemons or the dinamax battles

This is without a doubt the worst Pokemon game to date. I found myself just smashing A to get through the game because I was just so sick of the horrible story and how it played. Mega evolution was a decent mechanic. Dynamax was incredibly uninventive and displayed a complete lack of interest in the game designers.

Some people ask, well maybe it's still worth playing? I was in that same boat. It is not worth it, do not buy it.
titles: Want to play it? Don't bother, waste of time.

review_contents: Fun game. Many of the route puzzles have been replaced by gym puzzles. Only a 400 Pokemon Pokedex, but that's fine, I can't remember them all anyway. I have over 50 in the game and I'm still going strong, trying to complete various goals.
So bad lol so so so so bad. Have more fun playing Pok√©mon yellow or Pok√©mon ruby and those games are 20+ years outdated.

Nothing wrong with the packaging or actual physical game, I just don‚Äôt think this Pok√©mon installment is that great. The graphics on the first game made the Pok√©mon look cool and believable despite being obviously fantasy. The graphics are boring and unimaginative IMO, and the Pok√©mon boring. Pok√©mon X & Y were much more fun.

I have never really played any of the past Pok√©mon games (besides Pok√©mon go) but I have to say this game is amazing. I have already beat the game and am working on completing my Pokedex. I‚Äôve put almost 80 hours into the game and am still finding things to do to keep the game fresh and interesting! Highly recommend this game if you‚Äôre new to Pok√©mon or a returning Pok√©mon fan!

Great game title to play. Wouldve loved this more if I were probably 13. But still loving this game at 32. Can't hardly play it now because of work and life but nonetheless an epic adventure right out of the digital downloaded metaphorical box.

Great game for fans of Pokemon. Very addictive. Good graphics and easy gameplay. The only annoying thing is that there are some pokemon that you can only get by trading with other players (very frustrating for a completionist).
titles: Great game- hours of fun for all ages!

review_contents: Hadn‚Äôt played a Pokemon game since Nintendo gameboy SP ruby and sapphire. I‚Äôve had a blast with the game, bought a switch lite just to play it. The wild area was such a cool addition, just wish it was easier to ‚Äúplay online.‚Äù
titles: Nostalgic but much more in depth

review_contents:
One of the best examples of a very dusty and worn out formula. Some modern design sensibilities creep in and the game respects your time, but at its core it‚Äôs still the same game you‚Äôve played 20 times over.

Having said that, I still enjoyed myself enough to complete the full story.

This game is really good! I experienced slight frame drops while playing online mode but thats all. The soundtrack, I can‚Äôt say how good it is! Its all there! The music is so good.
Unlike Pokemon Lets Go Eevee/Pikachu you can play with pro controllers/other universal controllers with the Collective Minds Switch Up.

By a 13yr olds perspective,

Thank you Gamefreak!

My 11 year old is obsessed with this game. He's never been into Pokemon but since getting this he's played countless hours and is always excited to show me what he's unlocked and collected! It seems to be very relaxing for him and has made him a HUGE fan of the franchise.
Wild area is a complete game changer, addicting!

Pok√©mon is still Pok√©mon regardless of the infamous Pok√©dex conflict. Easier to catch em all. However I did not expect this game to have an awesome soundtrack, next to Pok√©mon ORAS, that relates to sporting events which and most characters having their own song too.

My review title is my adult's take on this. Rather a disappointment My six year old grandson, whom the game was purchased for, is not nearly so critical so I'll give it 3 stars (implying "okay") for the fun value for him.
Almost twice the price for half the content. Wouldn't recommend.

Bare bones game, skip it
Edit: after playing it a bit more, it's worse than my first impression. There's only a few hours of content and the online play doesn't work. You can skip this game

I bought this as an attempt to get back into Pokemon as I haven't played since gen 3. I really enjoyed the game while it lasted. The shortfalls that I heard of from other people didn't seem to bother me as much. I got a good 40 hours out of the game, but it has completely dried up now. I dont really see any replay value
titles: Fun game, bought for nostalgia, didn't keep me around for long.

review_contents: This, along with the Shield, was a Christmas gift for my grandson. I don‚Äôt get it, but I don‚Äôt have to (I‚Äôm okay with being a Boomer); it made him happy, and that was the point of Sword as a present.

Perfect new condition.
I loved the game, it took 34 hours to complete this game. I am not trying to go go back and catch every Pokemon there is.
Will definitely buy the expansion!
Better if you have the online subscription!
Vibrant, sizable pokemon really provides players a new immersion into the pokemon series. I really enjoy the 2 player settings so the kids can adventure together. Some pokemon can be ridden.
titles: Save a Horse, Ride a Pokemon

review_contents: Loved this game. I think I can play this for a long time! The only thing I wished it had was that it included some previous generations Pok√©mon, but overall I love it!

Easily a top 3 Pok√©mon game (opinion). I‚Äôve been playing the series since Red/Blue and this game has streamlined so much of the grind out of the game without depreciating what has made the series fun.

Like many, I was worried when Game Freak announced that not all of our favorite Pok√©mon would make it into the game. However, the ones they selected for this (and Shield) are abundant and feel curated to better balance the game.

I do not regret this purchase whatsoever, and would fully recommend you give it a try if you‚Äôre a new or old fan.
titles: One the of the best in the series.

review_contents: I love pokemon sword so much! But I have not finished it yet... But overall it is a very cool game and you can camp with your on pokemon! A Pokemon game never let you camp with your on pokemon best Pokemon game ever!

I bought a switch just for this. I spent 90 hours playing. It‚Äôs a fun game. Collected all 400 but there isn‚Äôt much replay value for me after that. You could always collect shiny Pok√©mon afterwards but that‚Äôs just too much for me. Other than that, it was worth it!

Being a Pokemon and overall Nintendo fan since I was around ten years old, I always have high expectations for any Pokemon game, and Sword definitely takes the cut. I haven't finished the game yet, but so far it's been amazing exploring the new region and meeting new quirky characters. I would say the most difficult part of the game is catching pokemon as it takes way more pokeballs and effort than before. But, overall I have enjoyed my experience so far and look forward to the rest of it.
10 year old nephew loved this gift!! (He picked it out:-)
Wife loves this game. Brings back the nostalgia from the original game boy and game boy color but with present day technology and graphics. Love the incorporation of new Pok√©mon to discover.

I love Pok√©mon from the very beginning I still have my original gameboy and gameboy color with the red, blue, yellow, gold, silver, emerald, and so on I have collected all the Pok√©mon games since it all started. I simply love this game I know some people didn‚Äôt but if your a true Pok√©mon fan there is nothing that will stop you from loving this game. It‚Äôs a must buy for the collection! Loving the dynamax feature too!
This game is so addictive I recommend it for anyone! It‚Äôs so fun with all the adventure and Challenges and all the attention to detail and ughhhhh I just absolutely LOVE this game!

A pretty straight forward game. Level up your team, beat the bosses, and get the prized pokemon.

Didnt really take the time to talk to the people but loved every moment of this game.

Cant wait for the expansion pack
My teens love this, great graphics and lots of fun.
Son cant stop playing and really loves this new game

Despite the flaws I find Sword to still be very enjoyable. I have around 40 hours in the game already. It's story could have been a bit better and the lack of GTS/Pokemon is kind of annoying but I am still having fun with Pokemon Sword.
The graphics are great and the raid battles make the game hard to put down.
A lot of cry babies over this game. It is fun. It's easy to pick up and play. People need to realise it's the era of release, get feedback, then fix. It is just how it is and I like the new features.
Was great for the first 20 hours. Lacks any decent for of end game content.
Not fun

This game was great! It included enough of the nostalgic Pok√©mon with some new ones to keep it interesting! The graphics were amazing and the game keeps your interest even after you‚Äôve beaten all of the gyms
My bro likes this game came fast.
My oldest daughter absolutely loves Pok√©mon. She almost lost her mind when she got it. That was enough for me. She was so happy. It arrived very quickly.

30 hours in, love the game. The graphics are average for a switch game, but that's not what we are here. The battles? Fun. Pokemon selection in game? Really good my pokedex was at 90 before the 3rd gym. The story? Average Pokemon game story with a bit more character development then usual. Max raid battles? Lots of fun and the rewards are just right to keep you hunting for them. Competitive? Made a lot easier to get a great team to do the battle tower and online battles. Id recommend this game to anyone.
titles: Great for new and old fans alike

review_contents: An amazing game if you love the freedom to roam around to enjoy scenery and building custom teams. Love playing this game so far!

Game box came slightly damaged on the title side of it. Not a big deal but still annoying.

Game is good, not the best. If the whole game was 3rd person It could have been a massive success, but it still relays on old style camera perspectives, so it feels a tad outdated at times.
titles: Okay Pok√©mon game, bad shipping with a damaged case.

review_contents:
My son loves playing Pok√©mon games. He uses it to relax from playing Fornite.
Sigh...
I can stand to watch him playing this game rather than Fornite.

I loved the game, however it‚Äôs only getting four stars as there‚Äôs an expansion pack for $30 and had the game been released later, you wouldn‚Äôt need to shell out $90 total for the game and the areas that will be released in June and later in the fall. - Animations are definitively worse for a Switch game, it's literally copy/paste

After having seen this game, it's not worthy of a purchase. Many people have thrown away criticism of the game for people being upset about pokemon being missing from the game. What they didn't tell you is that most of your favorite Pok√©mon from LGPE cannot be transferred into SwSh. Those teams you spent a ton of time building like my Blastoise cannot be imported into the game. Imagine spending a lot of time into raising your venasaur, Blastoise, and Arbok only to find out you can't bring them into this new game.

The game is short! It'll only take your 12 hours or less to get through the entire game. The game is also very easy. Unless you're under the age of 10, this game will have very little challenge for you. Mind you Nintendo is charging $59.99 for this game. The fields are also very empty for the most part which makes the game artificially feel big. The game is mostly devoid of content so it feels like a big walking simulator.

You can no longer have your favorite Pok√©mon follow you or ride your Pok√©mon. This was so fun in Pok√©mon let's go. I have no idea why they removed it. It greatly reduces the immersion of the game and it's basically an easy addition considering they already did it for let's go.

There are two new mechanics in the game, Gigantamax and camping. Both of them pretty much suck. Gigantamax makes your Pok√©mon big. It's basically pointless since it only lasts a certain number of turns and gym leaders always use it on their last moves. This is actually worse than mega evolutions and z moves which was replaced by this mechanic. Camping is boring. It's essentially a portable Pok√©mon center with a dumb minigame.

Finally the graphics and bugs. I'm not going to rail on the fact they reuses models. However what I am going to rail on is the bad framerates at times (drops well below 30fps) and a lot of garbage textures. At times this game looks worse than an N64 game. What a disappointment. Next the bugs. There's these freezing bugs which could easily set you far back in terms of progress. What I don't understand is how breath of the wild has this system working perfectly, yet Pok√©mon managed to bungle it.

Bottom line is don't buy this game. If you're looking to get a nice Pok√©mon game, let's go is way better. Buy that instead.

I like this game for what it is: a pokemon game on the switch. The problem is that there could be so much more to love about this game if they just added more to it. A lot of the new features feel quaint on their own, like the Pokemon Camp, the Y-Communications, and the world you inhabit. It all just feels passionless in some cases, and with more time I feel like they could have really polished this one up and filled in all the blanks without cutting corners to make the game.
titles: I would stay away from this game if you want a complete game

review_contents:
I will start with the unfortunate news which is this game will NOT have every Pok√©mon in the Pok√©dex represented for the first time ever in a Pok√©mon game. Inevitably this day was going to come when there were too many Pok√©mon but it‚Äôs a bit of a surprise that it happened now on Nintendos first full console Pok√©mon release. I will need far more hours than I already have but after spending numerous hours in Pok√©mon sword and Pok√©mon shield I have to say I have been pleasantly surprised. I had some concerns about the game based on the gameplay I saw before release. The story is actually pretty good so far and while it‚Äôs not incredibly deep it‚Äôs still engaging (especially for a Pok√©mon game). My favorite thing to start the game that made me extremely happy was no more random encounters with a Pok√©mon game as they get old fast. There are also so many great new Pok√©mon that you encounter right from the start of the game. A piece of advice If you encounter a Pok√©mon with an exclamation point in a grassy area (hopefully I will find a shiny one soon) if might be a great rare one to catch. The game is very accessible as well and should be very playable for new or younger Pok√©mon players. The standout for me thus far is the wild area where there are tons of different high or low level Pok√©mon and you get to go on Max Raids. It seems like raids are always the best part of games they are included in (it was the best part of Destiny) and this game is no exception especially when playing with real other players (instead of NPCs) with the ability to Dynamax. I assume it will become less enjoyable eventually but watching your Pok√©mon turn into a Godzilla like monster version of itself (for 3 turns) is great fun to battle with and against. Also like most raids in games the loot that comes from it is pretty great.
All is not great however and I would be lying if I did not admit there are some issues. I think the tough thing here is for the most part Game Freak has not really had to do much in the way of better animations and graphics when making 3DS games so perhaps complacency set in because the game definitely could be dramatically improved in both areas. Despite what some say it does not look like a 3DS game but it doesn‚Äôt look great either. It actually becomes more apparent when you come from playing some of the recent triple A Nintendo releases like Luigi‚Äôs Mansion 3, Astral Chain, Fire Emblem Three Houses and the list goes on. In addition a lot of the game animations have clearly been recycled but with much better graphics than on the 3DS. They seem like they have not even tried to do enough new animations and movements for trainers and Pok√©mon alike. There also should have been a much bigger jump in graphical fidelity for a full console release. There also could have been far more depth added to the game for its console release along with more characters in large towns. Another negative about the game is some of the things that have been discovered by data mining like not being able to transfer Pok√©mon, trade Pok√©mon online, and how some of the Pok√©mon you add will lose moves because the animations are not present in the game.
There are some small frame rate drops and pop In but I haven‚Äôt had tons of issues yet.
I do wonder if they try to add the rest of the Pok√©mon later when they add in other features though. The game is fun and I think most Pok√©mon fans will enjoy it. I do hope that Game Freak takes any criticism as fair and make an even better Pok√©mon game next time because there really is the framework of something great here.

Note: in the game make sure to take your time to cook some curry, it‚Äôs worth it!
titles: Pok√©mon but you can‚Äôt catch them ALL!!!

review_contents:
I wish I could say that this entry was a good first step into bringing the Pokemon series into a new and more powerful console, but it's more of a hastened stumble. Before the game's release, fans of the series voiced extreme criticism over half of the total Pokemon available being made unavailable, but Gamefreak communicated that these were necessary cuts in order to improve other things in the game. Some fans didn't find that to be fair, while others waited to see what the tradeoff would bring. Now that it's out, here's what we got:

1) The Removal of the GTS: the global trading system introduced in a prior generation that made trading Pokemon online so much more simpler was removed. Instead, we're given a bare bones trading system that only allows for "surprise" trades and trades with people you're friends with. It's clear that they stripped all of this so that there was a reason for people to buy a Pokemon Home subscription.
2) Subpar Animations: the animation work done here is mediocre. Pokemon models of prior generations were clearly reused and moves are still poorly animated.
3) Mediocre Graphics: these graphics are not at all representative of what the Nintendo Switch is capable of. Even if the series wanted to retain its particular style, the textures could have been a lot more polished. I'd say that Pokemon Let's Go had more polished graphics than this game. The graphics here make the game feel like a ported Gamecube game that was not brushed up.
4) Huge Lack of Content: the game's main story is laughably bare-boned. I'll refrain from spoilers, but the story lacks a strong plot aside from just becoming a Pokemon champion. There is no "Elite Four" equivalent, you just re-battle improved versions of the gym leaders and your rival (who you battle WAY TOO OFTEN) at the end. There are no real side quests either. Although the addition of the Wild Area seems like a big meaty addition, it's actually not that large and made to feel even smaller by the repetitive appearances of certain species of Pokemon. The Wild Area is also almost entirely devoid of any other interaction other than Pokemon if you're not connected to the internet, and when you are, random NPC that repeat the same four lines pop in and out in a horridly animated way. There are no dungeons in this game, and routes are laughably small and hardly populated with trainers to battle. It feels as though this game has the smallest amount of trainers to battle in the series.
5) Huge Lack of Post-Game Content: the amount of things to do after the main storyline is finished is almost non-existent. There is a bare-boned town with a Battle Tower at the end, and maybe another hour's worth of story tied to an extra legendary Pokemon. Usually, players could invest more time into the post-game by catching more Pokemon. However, when more than half of the total Pokedex is cut, you're not just cutting people's favorite Pokemon, you're cutting a large amount of post-game content (Pokedex completion).

Overall, I'd say that the National Dex cut is the least of this game's worries. The game feels rough, unpolished, and superficial. Does that mean the game isn't enjoyable? Not exactly, and it's thanks to how reliable the basic Pokemon game formula is. What it does mean, however, is that whatever fun you do have is over *very* soon, and there isn't much incentive or content to encourage people to play it past the short storyline.

Any other series would be crucified if they had as many faults as this game does. Gamefreak should be thanking their lucky stars that relying on the brand name worked this time, and that Pokemon fans are loyal to a fault.
titles: The Pokemon Series is Resting On its Laurels

review_contents:
I'm not gonna argue with players that like this game, because everyone has different defination of a interesting game. But I'm totally angry with Game Freak. believe that buying products is the most direct way to support a company or brand, but not always the best way if you do want pokemon games get better and better.

When ultra sun&moon were released, we understood that the little difference between sun&moon and ultra sun&moon was caused by the spreaded developing staff onto the pokemon project on switch platform. (Which we know is LGPE now.)
When LGPE were released, we also understood the poor quality of it is because it's just a first try on the new platform and short developing period. And we were pretty happy to support Game Freak so that they will have enough money or time to make a real incredible Pokemon game on the newest platform.
When Sword&Shield released, we all see what Game Freak presented but I really cannot understand what have they did over the past year, where did they spend the money earned from Ultra Sun&Moon and LGPE. I'm really tired of struggling between trusting Game Freak and being cheated by them again and again.
I'll ignore the deleted pokemons and mega or Z-move, because at least Game Freak gave a somehow reasonable explaination of that, including limited developing time, balance of ranking environment, and trying new concepts, though personlly I don't like the logic of these reasons. Let's go over other details.
1. The low quality environment texture, including the trees, the clouds in the sky, and the water that never splash when pokemons swim in it.
2. The mismatch between real environment and battle environment (for example fishing on wooden bridge brings you to lawn area to battle. wtf??? Or you can even see characters standing on water while the environment is water. This is not naruto lol)
3. Game Freak publicized that almost every room in this game can be entered. Then we discover that on some street, yes, can enter every room, but most of them are with exactly the same upholstery. On some other streets, no, the only building that you can enter is the pokemon center. So in either case, Game Freak is cheating us.
4. It's 2019 now and it will be 2020 after 2 months. We can still see Zacian and Zamazenta turning around while their feets moves like moving forward. Giving a salute to MJ? We can also see that the whole world freezes except you when you are climbing on a ladder. Giving a salute to JoJo?

It's all good to love Sword&Shield, but please, please, please, don't praise Game Freak saying that they did a nice job.
titles: BUYING POKEMON GAME IS NOT ALWAYS THE BEST WAY TO SUPPORT IT.

review_contents:
The amount of effort that went into the development of this game really shows. for 35$ at release I got a more complete experience on a console with less power. I unfortunately did not order my copy through amazon but I picked up my copy from a local gamestop. I haven't slept since picking it up and this is my fevered just finished the game review.

It's worse on pretty much all levels except this is a full "3D" experience. The music feels largely recycled with not many new numbers as well as massive graphical and technical bugs. I literally had an onix spawn into my character model in the middle of battle. The game can barely maintain 30 frames in some spaces even though the textures look like they're from the early 2000's. Reused assets and animations also means that Game Freak went back on one of their core promises. (Not a Deal Breaker but certainly worth a lot of good will.)

The amount of hand holding in the game is also nauseating. However, I did not deduct points for this as the intended audience for Pokemon games is children.

I actually like gigamax evolutions but at the cost of mega evolutions and other core features that were present in the last few titles the tradeoff wasn't worth it. The Pokemon cut from the national dex means that people with favorite Pokemon from past iterations are literally just SOL. Personally it doesn't bother me as much but one of my favorites Lopunny did get cut as a result which will ultimately affect my post-story experience.

All of these things added up makes for a very bland and uninspired experience.

I cannot in good conscience recommend this to hardcore pokemon fans and I hope Game Freak learns their lesson.
No national Pok√©dex, missing starters, bland gameplay. Save your money.
This game is slow and cumbersome. Way too much reading and very little game play. Nintendo got this one wrong. 30 minutes in and my kid is getting bored.

This is NOT worth $60. This could have easily been on the 3DS. Please save your money and wait until they fix all the issues with the game. I hope Gamefreak learns from this and doesn't release a "new" game every year.

It's not bad but definitely not good. I was kinda surprised at how little content was in the game. The first hour was pretty entertaining and quite enjoyable however it was after this where you start seeing the problem. The pacing is not the best, I did 1 raid and had a level 30 for the first gym, and most of the promised enhancements by Game Freak don't seem to be present at all... just to name a few of my grievances with the game. Would I recommend this game to people? Yes. Would I recommend this game to people at full price? Definitely not! Double the price of any other pokemon game for less than half the content. Wait for a sale or just skip this one.

I was initially skeptical of this game due to the massive number of Pokemon I regularly use being cut, but I gave it a shot anyway after being given a copy. Figured, hey, maybe there will be something that makes up for it.

On some level, this game actually shows fairly decent potential. They give access to a ton of different Pokemon early on. Also, the raids were an interesting addition that are far better executed than the nonsense of Pokemon Go. The twist with the rival toward the end (I won't spoil it) was a decent idea as well. Oh, and the Wonder Trade being done while you play the game was nice as well (though it would have been better if you didn't have to see the final animation). Seeing some Pokemon roaming around was decent as well.

Now, let's talk about the bad.
*The online system is a joke. You pretty much have to get lucky when you want to trade with someone specific because even when you set a link code, there's a fair chance you'll link up with someone else - my personal record is 11 attempts before getting the right person. Unlike before, where having a person's friend code actually helped, you're screwed this time around.
*Trying to do raids with others online is also a bit of a joke. You can try to reset the screen as much as you want, but there have been times where a friend's raid just never showed up. There's also a better than likely chance you won't connect with the random person whose raid you're trying to join as well.
*Ease - Why the hell do you need access to your boxes of Pokemon at all points of the game? That's just blatantly unnecessary. Don't even get me started on how much money you come across (I had over 200k before the first gym despite spending a decent bit). Heck, you get even more if you hit raids a lot. Also, lest I forget, there's the absurd amount of exp boosts you can get by doing raids due to EXP candy and Rare Candy.
*Not being able to catch certain Pokemon. It's extremely annoying to see a Pokemon in the wild, run up to it, and then not being able to catch it due to its level being higher than your badges allow. This also feeds into my Ease annoyance as you can use the visible Pokemon to gain quite a few levels if you know anything about strategy and typing.
*The big bad legendary (not the ones on the boxes) has a form you can't use. I get it, the thing has absurdly high stats, but would it really kill them to scale back its stats so that players can enjoy the other form every once in a while? There are so many ways they could have managed it, yet they chose to simply limit the players to its base form.
*The new gimmick, Dynamax, is a half-baked idea. Seriously, this dynamic was poorly thought out as it's basically a giant one-hit kill move. So many gyms can amount to you killing the last 3 Pokemon in one shot due to this. It's basically just a three turn Z-Move that comes with extra HP.
*Raids in general - While I love the idea, they executed it poorly. More often than not, you end up with completely useless compatriots if you choose to use NPCs due to lack of people joining online or whatever other reason. Then there's the issue of how many of those break out of the balls with one or less shakes.
*The RNG for moves is atrocious. I have had countless 100% accuracy moves miss despite there being no evasion or accuracy conditions applied to the battle.
*The rival story is effectively a slightly rewritten version of Sun/Moon's story. You've got a guy with a famous relative who strives to surpass him.

There is no excuse for this half-baked game. This is not a debut title by an upstart company with limited funds. Gamefreak and Nintendo have enough money and influence to perfect any edition to this flagship franchise. The lack of a nationaldex is a slap in the face to long time fans. This game is not worth your time or money. Send a message to Gamefreak. Do not purchase Sword or Shield.

At some point you have to make something better. BOTW is a huge step up from previous zeldas. you aren't even competing with your own company. You've been doing the same crap for 20 years and fans are tired of it. This game uses assets from the 3ds game and doesn't have a complete pokedex. nor can you move pokemon from your pokebank. (Something you pay for in promise that you can use your pokemon in future games.) This whole thing is a mess.

So disappointed not at the game but with Amazon I thought the whole point of a pre order was to purchase the game at the time so when it was released I would receive it. I waited 9 months just to be disappointed. I should have just preordered it at a store or digitally

I bought this game from a retailer, and while there are many valid criticisms about this game that you probably already heard, there are some much bigger than the ones most reported on. This game is extremely choppy when it runs, almost to the point where its unplayable. Especially in the wild area, and especially when playing online. I am not one to notice bad graphics or bad performance in a game, but this one is just bad in that area. Again its so bad that its almost un-playable.

This game seems to oddly enough, somehow be damaging other devices. There are massive reports online of Roku TV's or Roku Devices going into a bootloop when a person tries to play this game on the TV. The only fix is to either stop playing or turn off the online play, whatever works for you. Kinda defeats the purpose of buying this game. If you have one of these devices I suggest waiting or don't buy this game at all. I have a Roku and well, I am kinda forced into owning a Roku because its one of very few devices that support my cable company's app, and I need to use the app to watch TV that I pay a very hefty fee to subscribe to. Other devices don't carry the app my provider uses. Kinda unfair for people like me who want to play this game.

This game also seems to be bricking Nintendo switch systems and corrupting SD cards. I don't know what kind of product this is to be honest, it seems to just be a bad product. I have bought every Pokemon game since the originals years ago and none have had issues like this one. I have also never seen or heard of issues like this with any video game and I have played thousands of games in my life. I also bought Pokemon Lets Go and I don't have any issues playing that game either. Clearly this product was either rushed to market or not properly manufactured.

I would avoid it and buy something else, there are Pokemon games on the 3DS system, or just buy last years Lets go, as that game doesn't have any issues that I can see or wait to see if Nintendo and Roku release updates to fix this issue before buying. Honestly I feel this product should be recalled and everyone given a refund.
titles: This game is pretty bad because it doesn't work too well

review_contents:
Nothing worthwhile.
Edit: it‚Äôs even worse than I thought. Moonwalking wolves and lies about reviews (gamespot doesn‚Äôt give numbers, you liars! Also, at least stay consistent! In the accolades it said gamespot gave a 4/5).
Edit: I heard from others that they do. However it was some other thing that everyone in the comments of that video was saying. So they took it down from embarrassment.

So they took our national dex, gave us one of the WORST MATCH MAKING SYSTEMS EVER, and locked Mew behind a paywall. This game had SO much potential, I've been playing pokemon since i was 6 years old and competitively since I was 16, now I'm 25 yeard old and this is one of the biggest disappointments I've ever experienced. Not only did they just render years of my hard work null and void from the previous generations by not allowing me to bring my old pokemon to this game, LIKE I ALWAYS HAVE, they gave the community washed up excuses and mediocre content. This companies greed is getting out of hand. The photos uploaded with this review show a small preview of the aweful experience you will encounter if you want to catch anything powerful, cool, rare, etc. A whole lot of let downs! This has happened atleast 100+ times since games release, and I experience failed connections more often than not. My internet is not to blame as my speed is 1gb/s.
titles: Ready to have your dreams crushed, multiple times a day? Have I got the game for you!

review_contents:
This game was a huge disappointment. I love pokemon I play every single game they release. Every year it gets worse. This one Is absolutely terrible for a switch title. So many cut features and terrible graphics, story is almost none exciting with handholding characters at every corner of the game. Every town and road is so barren and linear.
There team is the worst team ever even worse than sun and moon. I hope next games are a full switch title other wise this will be my last pokemon game. Very sad to see these games go downhill

For starters I wanted to state I'm a huge Pokemon fan ever since it first started back in 2000. Pokemon has for years had a great story and what's better is you can connect with other players to trade or do battle but now it saddens me to say it but you want to do all that you better be able to fork up $5 a month or $20 a year. Yup And that's not the worst of it trying to connect with other players felt like a chore. I litterly couldn't connect to anyone on the wifi but this has been a issue dating back to Pokemon let's go! I miss the old fashioned way where you go online and drop off a Pokemon and tell other people what you want . Now its like game freak assume we are all born psychic and can send messages with our minds. Wow!üòí Don't get me started on the story that's the bread and butter of the game sucked. There really isn't a villian in the game like in Pokemon red and blue it's team rocket and Ruby and sapphire team Aqua and team Lava. Team shout aren't really bad guys at all! The only thing good about it is it introduce better graphics and the ability to see Pokemon run wild . I just wish you had the ability to dive I mean how cool would that be to see Pokemon underwater. And I liked the fact you get to play or bond with other Pokemon like cook Curry and camp or play with them with a cat like you but come on game freak. üòí
titles: By far the worst game ever!Update version

review_contents: Cash grab don't buy

This game has absolute worst case of cheating i ever seen in a game. But first, the story. its paper thin. You will never see or hear from the star mascot after your adventure just begins. Great Wolf Sif who is featured in the game and title has very little screen time and is never involved in the plot. wow already a epic fail
You see the owl in zelda more often & he clues you in
You meet your lame friends in this game more often then the sword holding wolf.
worse is your first encounter is a Lie. He is just a Illusion? whaa? And he is in his smaller weaker form...

A lot of people has been hating the game for awhile now and I understand why. No national dex, reused models, laggy wild area, bad graphics, etc. There‚Äôs some good things though and this game is still worth a buy. (Not at $60 but I guess $50 max)

Pros:
- The ost is amazing, honestly one of my favorites within all the Pok√©mon generations
- The character designs are really cool! (To me at least)
- The wild area is really fun, you can spend literally a bunch of hours there and still not be bored. Especially with all the raids and abundance of Pok√©mon.
- The towns are beautiful.

Cons:
- Forced exp share, it can make the game too easy. There should be a option to turn it off in the future.
- Cutscenes are nice but there should be a option to skip. (Not sure if there is one)
- I don‚Äôt mind the reused models but they could‚Äôve added more Pok√©mon if they‚Äôre reusing models.
- National dex. Again I don‚Äôt mind it‚Äôs not on the game rn but should be in the future.
- Cutscenes. The characters move their mouths like they‚Äôre speaking but there‚Äôs no voice. Future voice acting in the future hopefully?
- Handholding. There‚Äôs too much handholding one this game then any other Pok√©mon game.
titles: I know this game gets a lot of hate but

review_contents: If there was ever an example of lack of content, this would be it. While the game itself is fun to play and the quality of life changes are appreciated, this game feels only half finished. Between the frame drops which happen frequently while connected to wifi, the poor graphical design of the wild area, and the rather uninspired plotline this game pales in comparison to previous installments even from just the last generation. The map feels incredibly small in this game. The wild area was a step in the right direction but it needs work in terms of pacing as you could spend hours in the wild area but there‚Äôs little to nothing at all to keep you in the cities. There‚Äôs no side minigames or real subplots to motivate you to explore like in Sun and Moon where you could take on missions and character interactions regularly brought you back to the city. This game needed more time, more attention and more care. I loved the designs of the pokemon this time around and the selection was superb, however a stellar new roster does not compensate for the lack of content and attention to detail. Gamefreak can do much better than this. I know they can because I‚Äôve seen their great storytelling in action. However, this game almost feels like a throw away cash grab just to placate fans for another year. Please Gamefreak do not fall into the same trap as activision with Call of Duty. Take your time, finish the game. I would much rather wait a couple extra years than have you pump out low quality material when you can do so much better.

Joshua Allen -
The game is amazing, the graphics are a little judgey but it is only the first version of the game. My game never crashed onceüòÅ. There are 80 new pokemon, and that is not bad considering how many gen 6 and 7 had. The Dynamax concept is amazing, along with the pokemon growing, it also gets special moves and it changes it's look. I completed the game in just 19 hours, the story is good, and it gives more love to buy types. The wild area is just a run place in general to explore. Develepers made the game have half of the pokemon which makes it easier for new players to not get overwhelmed and the powered is smallerüëå anyways, I would ignore the bad reviews and make sure to buy this game because it is amazing.

The game is enjoyable as is the case with all pokemon games. Sadly though the game has far more issues than it has strengths.

PROS:
The new pokemon designs are some of the best entries the games have had.

The wild area is an amazing concept that could revolutionize pokemon as a whole if utilized properly.

The gyms were some of the best gyms the games have seen, they weren't too challenging but the gym leader design and the stadiums felt fun and enjoyable.

The clothing and customization options in this game are great and short of a few exceptions your character can truly look how you want it too.

The raid battles are fun and add a good alternative to leveling pokemon.

Quality of life changes like items letting you make pokemon competitively viable, rather than having to get breeding them.

CONS:
The story is almost non-existant up until you are about to challenge the champion. Every time you run into leon the champion they tell you they will deal with things and you to go the gyms, the story they experience seems much more interesting then what the player experiences. For they entirety of the 8 gyms, you only go from gym to gym with some small tidbits of lore.

The game railroads you the entire time, between your rival and other npcs, you never get to choose which way you go, after every gym there is a small cutscene telling you where to go next. Your rival is always right around the corner telling you where to go and what to do.

The routes are tiny with almost no exploration and they are mostly just short paths with a couple of trainers and grass.

The cities are small, and while very nicely designed, there is little more than the gym and pokemon center in each city. One of the cities, that is LITERALLY all there is. Most of the buildings are just painted on.

The wild area is pretty bland, the scenery isn't very detailed, grass, water and trees dispersed around.

Not every pokemon has overworld models, and many of the ones that dont are the new pokemon introduced in the generation, the game doesnt tell you this either so generally one would assume only the pokemon you can see are the ones in that area.

The pokedex is pretty small with many pokemon never going to be able to be added to the game. Many pokemon that would make sense like nidoking and nidoqueen are not available in game.

The legendaries are only in the game to put on the box, you dont get them until after you have beat the game.

The gigantimax forms are only obtainable through raids and the ones you catch outside of those will never have access to thier gigantimax forms.

Now, I must say, I found that a lot of the reviews weren't verified purchases but that's okay as mine won't be either (I purchased my copies from GameStop to receive my applied discount). However, I do believe a lot of the people who gave negative reviews either didn't play the game to its fullest, did not play the game at all, or gave a negative review just for the sake of giving a negative review.

I have been a Pokemon fan since Red/Blue/Green first came out, so as more generations were revealed and I grew, I became highly critical of certain things Pokemon was doing. When the marketing for this game came out, I was extremely skeptical of Dynamaxing, thinking it was just another Raid function from Pokemon GO, or the Pokemon designed were pathetic compared to Pokemon of the past.

With that said, I got Shield first and ended up going back to the store to get Sword because I was enjoying Shield so far. You can tell Nintendo and Pokemon were really working on the overall background of Galar, its animations, and the entire League. Not only do you no longer receive your starter from the Professor (now from the Champion, brother to Hop, your rival), your character will have to be endorsed to enter the League - which is a smart move background wise. The animations are great and I grew to love a majority of the characters.

The Pokemon of the region match the region they're from, from the Grass/Dragon types Applin, Flapple, and Appletun, to the Fairy types living in the Glimwood Tangle. I was also shocked to find the Wild area has differently leveled areas - similar to the sandbox/open world RPGs I've played. Imagine me screaming when I ran into a Level 32 Haunter with my Level 12 Zigzagoon. Yeahhhhh.

Anyway, I was very surprised and entertained. I'm grinding now and trying to fill the Dex and collect my shiny Pokemon. I did find a coveted Shiny through my entire playthrough - a female Shiny Ralts - so I caught the Shiny bug to find more.
Boring as hell and supper ugly!

It's an entirely mediocre experience, honestly the low point for the Pokemon series. Less content than any of the previous titles, for more money. Seriously, you got more content from 40$ Nintendo 3DS titles than this game. Half the Pokemon are gone, there's essentially nothing to do once you beat the game, and it's a very shallow experience that is very quick to be done unless you purposefully restrict yourself and meticulously go over every nook and cranny several times.

All this could warrant a 3 star if not for the fact that the game LITERALLY HAS THE CHANCE TO DAMAGE YOUR NINTENDO SWITCH. Not Nintendo, nor Game Freak, nor the Pokemon Company have commented on this fact, that Nintendo Switch systems are LITERALLY DYING because of this game, not to mention the fact that it has the potential to corrupt your SD card, forcing you to redownload all of your games (People with slow internet, beware), and can actually get Roku TVs stuck in a bootloop. ROKU THEMSELVES had to issue an update to their systems BECAUSE OF WHAT THIS GAME DID. Seriously.

All in all it's mediocre but so poorly put together you're risking 300$ for a 60$ game. Do not buy.
titles: CAN BREAK SWITCH, SD CARD, OR ROKU TVS!! DO NOT BUY!!!

review_contents: I've played every Mainline Pokemon game. This is by far the absolute worst. Many people say, "it's for kids", but that is true of all of them, and this one is definitely the worst. Not only have they removed a significant number of Pokemon, they haven't added any interesting ones. The map is incredibly small, compared to other games and very straightforward. It's just heading directly to one gym after another, with no real adventure or side quests. The wild is a nice touch, but doesn't make up for all of the shortcomings. The game is pathetically easy and unlike all the others, it holds your hand the entire time. And yes, it could have and should have been bigger and better, and should have included all the Pokemon. Yes the Nintendo switch can handle that kind of game. It can play Skyrim, so I don't want to hear anything about how Pokemon couldn't have been a better game. They didn't even bother to really update the animations from 3DS. Don't waste your money on this pathetic installment. I'll never buy a game from game freak again. I will also never pre-order another Pokemon game again.

I've been waiting for a Pokemon RPG on the switch from the Switch's launch date. I must say that I'm not only satisfied after waiting so long, but impressed.
New mechanics, new looks to old pokemon, new types to old pokemon (ex. Ponyta is no longer fire but... psychic?), you get the town map in the menu option, you're reminded where to go in the menu if you forget, you start with an old rod, tons of pokemon right off the bat in the wild area, rumble in the controllers that make the dynamaxing engaging, need I say more? If youre into competitive, this is a good game. I'm no competitive pro but this game make it simple to learn the curve. New to pokemon? This is a great place to start. As you pick up items you're briefed on the information. Your hand is almost held as you're battling if you don't yet understand type advantages. The reminders and town map in the menu are key, too. Two thumbs up.
Oh, and the gyms have been revamped. Best of luck folks. I recommend it to anyone on the fence. It's actually a whole new pokemon experience even for oldies who've been into the games for years.

The weight to my opinion:
-I grew up playing Red and Blue to an unhealthy level of developing neck issues later in life from always looking down
-I loved Gold and Silver
-I had fun on Ruby
-After Ruby I stopped the series for a while and then played Lets go Evee
-Now I'm playing Sword
-I'm somewhere in between 20-30 hours with the story finished

I'm basing this on what the game brings to the table and not on what it doesn't.

My biggest impressions on Pokemon Sword:
-The battles are like all the previous Pokemon games which is nostalgic and still fun 1v1 and 2v2s
-I don't like Hop (the hero's rival?) I feel like i should have a choice to turn him off or something. I've turned off the Switch a few times when I've seen him on screen due to the game using him as a hand holder. They literally bludgeon you to death with Hop and his friendly competitive rivalness.......i hate him.
-The Raids are honestly the best addition this generation brings. I hope they continue using these in the future. (Raid details below)
-We finally got a semi open world with pokemon running around. Similar yet different from Lets Go Evee
-You can kind of customize
Gigantimaxing or w/e its called is alright and changes up the battles from time to time. The name and concept seems as original as Avatars unobtainium idea
-After finishing the story I'm stilling going to hop on for raiding from time to time and playing versus (now that i don't have to look at Hop anymore)

Raid Details:
A Raid is a 4v1 battle against a Gigantimaxed pokemon. In which the 4 players have 4 lives (shared) or 10 turns whichever expire first to defeat the wild pokemon. It can take place either while your connected to the online servers playing with random people or friends, or while offline and playing with NPCs *mileage may vary*. Either way its still a fun fresh way to play the game.

Final Thoughts:
This game is a solid pokemon addition. Its gimmick Gigantimaxing is new and different, I'm still unsure if i want it to stay around for the long term or not. Hopefully the Raid idea does and grows. Some of the newer pokemon are very boring in terms of appearance skunks, squirrels, and literally garbage bags. Perhaps the originality of the creators is fading on the Pokemon creative end?

2 stars for the semi open world area
3 stars for the Raiding mechanic
-1 star for Hop....seriously i hate the idea of him so much
titles: A review from an old (not die hard) fan.

review_contents:
This game is total trash. Stay away from this heaping pile and avoid wasting your money on this and the upcoming expansions. This game has turned into nothing but a money grab for Game Freak and Nintendo.

- Short and laughable story line, if you can call it that. Did they hide kindergartners to write that?
- Gutted Pokedex, pretty much so that they could sell the rest of it bit by bit with paid expansions, which has already been announced .. next two expansions adding back over 200 old Pokemon .. this is turning into EA garbage.
- Weak graphics and enormous battery drain - game is buggy and with crappy optimization and awful, dead looking flat graphics and animations.
- Slow and absolutely worthless Y-Comm, lacking features and ability to manage trolls and a-holes, which the Max Raids are full of lately, trolling raids and making people's gaming experience miserable with absolutely no way to block or report for abusive behavior. And lately filled with hacked pokemon seller advertisers and obvious hacked RAIDs and Devs do not do a thing about it. Lazy, very lazy and sloppy made feature.
- Max Raids as well l as Tower battles filled with bosses and NPCs who's Pokemon have no problem having illegal abilities and using moves outside of their possible learnset.
- Awful RAID fight mechanics that display laziness and extreme lack of imagination on Game Freak's part.
- Slow, tiring and tedious battle setup. Awfully slow drag of status and ability messages from the moment encounter starts and to the point where you can actually select a move and begin the fight (Yes, even with text speed set to "Fast"). Sleep inducing.

I think there could have been so much more. Game feels fun but very limited. For people who have never encountered Pokemon then they will love it, for everyone who has a history they will probably dislike it. I think the criticisms are justified. My biggest problem is the lack of late game (12 hours in was Final Battle) content. Unless you're going to hunt shinys or something grindy there isn't much to do at all. Most the game feels re-used and the pluses are just minor tweaks that should have been addressed generations ago. Content is pretty stingy considering all GF has to do is add 3d models and some basic animations. It's not like they changed the game to take advantage of a new system or anything it is the same old game boy framework.

Maybe it is just me but I felt a little ripped off with lack of new content. I guess they still got my money for this one but I'll hold out on the next one.

The bare bones of this game is like any other Pokemon game. That said, it's also the least innovative of any of the Pokemon games. I've been a fan since 1998, I own every Pokemon Game that Gamefreak has released, and after this spectacular failure I will not be buying Pokemon pre-order (or potentially any other Pokemon game) going forward.

While all other Nintendo IPs have spent the time re-writing game engines and remaking or putting serious polish and vision in their assets, Pokemon contends itself to make money producing the same. The Pokemon have next to no new animations and the graphical quality is far below its peers. It does not fight for play time against Animal Crossing New Horizons, Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Xenoblade Chronicles, Super Mario Odyssey, the list goes on.

If you don't care about graphics, let's get to game function. My first ten minutes the game crashed and froze during very simple cut scenes (the one getting Pokedex). The game slows considerably when inside the Wild Area with internet connection on. The UI and connectivity settings of trading makes it nearly impossible to trade 5 Pokemon back and forth in a row with a friend- I have yet to be successful with that. When you try to join a raid ongoing, you have to click twice to try and "check" before getting denied after a minute's wait. This comes up constantly online. If you attempt to do raids offline, you will lose any and every raid that 5star because of how badly they programmed your assisting NPCs.

This game has improved certain quality of life elements as every new installment, but its not nearly enough. The game costs $60, twice as much, yet for the first time in their history the game has no post game content. Instead, you have to pay for a DLC coming out later for it. The DLC looks mighty unimpressive and was advertised in a way to trick kids into thinking they have to buy it in order to receive their old Pokemon. Whether that was their intention or not is beside the point.

The story is incredibly bland and full of poor follow-through, as if the team developing the game was disjointed. Leon starts off as a very encouraging Champion but by the end he acts like a sore loser, especially if he doesn't have a crowd to ham on. Hop's entire character arc is slashed in the last cut scene of the game where he abandons everything he's learned up until this point and decides to become a Pokemon Professor. The concept of Pokemon Professor is not redefined within dialog of the game, merely, he came up with the idea that they go around and help people and he decided that was the title to do with. Much of the supporting cast have good motivations and excellent designs, but GameFreak also had a cut back in the number of those kinds of unique trainers too as we no longer have an Elite Four or other reoccurring "npc" to appear such as Mohn in Sun & Moon, etc.

I beat the game is very little time and dabbled in making a team, which as mentioned with quality of life changes, is easier than ever before. But I found everything to be a chore, it didn't matter if I didn't have to grind to reach level 100 because it was easily handed to me. I spent more time trying to connect to a raid battle than I actually spent doing raid battles. I did easy shiny hunting which was very successful with a shiny Dreepy in 38 eggs, but I decided afterward that putting rubber bands on my Switch to get shiny Pokemon was kind of a pointless experience. This game has killed my love of Pokemon.

This franchise will go on, probably successfully, doing the same tired thing over and over and making money because there is always a child out there who has never experienced Pokemon and which everything is fresh. But with so much excellent competition, this game is a waste of energy and time I could be playing- anything else.

I would return this game had I not bought it off of Pokemon Center online.
titles: The most disappointing Nintendo IP Switch release

review_contents: Better than Sun & Moon. But still needs work. Still lacking difficulty option. Still adding dumb editions (gigantamax) some Galarian forms didn't need to exist.. could have just made them new Pokemon. Cities/Towns are pretty, some were too small though.. The Wild Area concept & raids were a nice addition. But still feels weak compared to other RPGs environments. A lot of the new Pokemon weren't too interesting. I like that gym battles are stadiums with audience hype. NPCs don't bother you as much. Except for Hop I guess. Glad they have outfit & hair options again, customization is important ! More choices would've been nice. Rotom isn't annoying af this time around, great ! Pokejobs are cool new system. Miss the Elite 4... The Legendaries are cool & so is story. Wish they would've done more with it though. Overall had fun like always. Final Score 8/10

I laughed reading the negative comments! This game takes a proven concept to the level that fans have always dreamed of! The new wild area, where you can see pokemon in the grass, is brilliant! There are still a few mysterious encounters where you can't see the pokemon ahead of time, but those encounters can be avoided if you know what you are looking for. Stronger pokemon roam the areas, and can be battled but gym badges are required to catch the higher level mons. At first, you hate this feature. If it's there, why can't I catch it? but the reality is that this limit keeps the game fun. If you managed to catch something level 35 or 40 early on, it would potentially make the game too easy/boring.

No more HM's! Brilliant! You no longer have to keep pokemon you don't want just so you can cut bushes or smash rocks etc. This is the most streamline and fluid pokemon game I have ever played. Gone are the days where the only thing keeping you from a gym is a dumb bush you can't cut. In sword and shield it is always clear where you need to go, and you progress through the game in a very natural way.

Gameplay: I love the battle animations. Some have critiqued them for not being 100% consistent and not showing up in a few surprising places, but for me, they add so much! A lot of moves have very specific animations unique to each pokemon. I love it! the replay value is huge because battles are no where near as boring as they used to be.

Graphics: okay, they are not mindblowing graphics considering all the games out in 2020, BUT for pokemon, these graphics are great! Lots of beautiful things to look at, but my fav is seeing the strong pokemon walking around in the wild area. You gain a new appreciation for a lot of these guys seeing them out and about.

There is so much to love about this game. More than I can put in a review. If you will be mad that they don't have your favorite first gen or second gen pokemon etc, then yeah, maybe this title isn't for you. If you are someone who likes pokemon in general and will appreciate all the huge upgrades from the gameboy games, well in that case, you can not go wrong with this title. The story unfolds in a beautiful and fun way. This game keeps you engaged and greets you with beautiful mechanics and graphics. So many old frustrations are gone and I personally think this is the best installment we have ever seen! The future of these games looks very bright!

As someone who has been playing since blue and red, save you're money. This is the last game I will ever buy out of the gate without waiting for reviews. It's a waste of $60. Gamefreak and Nintendo should be ashamed that they allowed this game to be published. Listen to the other negative reviews, which basically capture the essence of how horrible and laggy this game is. If you're buying it for a seven year old, they'll probably enjoy it (unfortunately). If you are at all versed in Pokemon, boycott this horrible game.

Despite not having a national pokedex (have every pokemon ever made in game), it's still a fun adventure. Some of your past pokemon are stuck in pokemon jail...I mean pokemon bank; but they said they'll bring back old pokemon in the next games in the series. Hopefully this is not a continuous thing forcing gamers to keep paying for pokemon bank subscription service.

New pokemon variety are very good. Most don't appear as filler. The amount of pokemon that pops up is also increased via the wild areas. Regional forms of past generations appear

More focused on battles. High emphasis on the pokemon league, and a lot of quality of life changes in terms of customizing your pokemon/team

Main plot: Leon undisputed champion who never lost. You set set out to defeat him. Story is pretty straightforward. Not as complex as Black & White for example. Team Yell is very similar to Team Rocket, not really that imposing

You participate in singles, doubles and dynamax/gigantamax battles

dynamax and Gigantamaxing. In Dynamax; Pokemon grow larger and get buff stats and new moves. Cross over for mega evolution and Z moves. Only occur in Gym and raid battles, and only active for 3 turns. Gigantamax is similar to Dyanamx except the pokemon changes their appearance a bit instead of just being larger

You can see overworld pokemon wandering about so you can pick and choose what pokemon you encounter.
There are random encounters if you see rustle (!) in the grass, or shake trees.

You can lure wild Pok√©mon from grass by whistling, as well as sneaking through grass to get close to the sacred Pok√©mon who tends to run faster than you

There is an optional auto save. On by default

Takes place in Galar region. Based of UK like how Pokemon Sun & Moon is based off Hawaii

Wild area. Open field to catch pokemon

You have free control of the camera.

There are weather effects: snow, rain, sun, and sandstorms. These affect what type of pokemon shows up

You can ride a bike again. Able to change speed and ride on water.

Less handholding in beginning. No exposition (you can skip tutorials), more trail-and-error if you want. Great for those who are familiar with the series.

exp share. no longer item a pokemon hold. Set by default in menus

Raid battles. Similar to Pokemon Go. You and 3 other trainers (AI or human players) fight a dyamax pokemon. Beat them to get a chance to catch and get items

-Easier to customize pokemon
TR: similar to TMs but can only be used once
Change pokemon's nature (no need for constant breeding), re learn old moves if you catch a pokemon that's over leveled or if you want an old one that you make them forget by accident

There are items that increases pokemon's exp points. Unlike rare candy, doesn't decrease amount stats gained when leveling up
