First things first, Here‚Äôs a pro tip for any Meta Knight mains, I need you to scroll to the top of the page, close Amazon and go back to For Honor where you obviously main Orochi (pls give Like if you got the joke) but really though. The first thing you want to do is go right into spirits mode, because you only get 8 or so characters to start. Any character you unlock in spirits mode will automatically join you in regular smash, however any character you unlock by triggering the ‚ÄúA new challenger appears‚Äù fight, will not be added to spirts. The best way I can describe this mode is a mix between Pokemon and Mario party, you and your opponents can equip spirits (that have replaced trophies) that can give you boosts like, improved jumps, stronger attacks, fire resistance, etc. And the ultimate goal is to equip spirits that counter your opponent‚Äôs. Although once you have your favorites leveled up enough it‚Äôs possible to just tank your way throughout most of the battles. Except for a few annoying ones. And get comfortable because this mode took me 15 hours to complete with only a 80% completion rate. I suggest you tough it out because the final act really makes the grind worth it.

The entire Game has received minor graphical upgrades, as for the fighters themselves, all have obtained animation tweaks that give them more personality overall, Mario has a cooler down smash, Zelda has a new costume and can now throw energy beams with his sword at full health (A little inside joke for the Nintendo vets) Every part of the game really makes it feel like they put they‚Äôre heart and soul into it. The amount of content packed in here is astounding. Even the settings/rules you‚Äôre allowed to play with can be overwhelming at times, but don‚Äôt worry, you can save and name your custom rules so you can get back into the action quicker. Also be sure to take advantage of the ability to pick 2 stages and morph between them. Home run contest and target practice are gone, Because they had to save space somehow. But Here‚Äôs the real tragedy. I think all of us veterans know that picking the right color makes us play better, and some alternative colors where cut. Are they really expecting us Mario mains to go online and fight those Malakas Meta Knight mains without his fire flower outfit?! (AC fans where you at?) in all seriousness though, this game is a love letter too all the Smash fans that have been with this franchise throughout the years. Do yourself a favor. Buy this game and good luck online.
If you enjoyed this review be sure to like, comment, and subscribe!

Update; So they added 2 new DLC characters, Piranha Plant and Joker from Persona 5. Look up gsmVoiD to get in-depth look at both characters. And be sure to use P Plant‚Äôs neutral Special attack on opponents trying to get back on the stage if you like cultivating salt in amounts that the world has never seen. Also be sure to hit the bell icon to be updated all that is SSBU.

The only place this game shines is as a couch game with friends. There's a world of fun customization options for you and your friends to dive into. Beyond that, the fun stops. There are a number of World of Light fights that I'm pretty sure were never actually tested. They're completely unfun, and you spend your time praying for good RNG or broken AI instead of actually fighting. The online matchmaking is awful, and you're often put into rulesets you didn't ask for. And the overall character balance leaves a bit to be desired. Great that you included so many characters in the game, but you're essentially throwing all hopes of ever balancing it out the window. Is that really worth the tradeoff?

Sadly, this is a completely forgettable and passable SSB game.

Oh, boy, I would love to be mashing my joycons playing this game right now. But guess what? Looks like the package isn‚Äôt on track, and is now expected December 8-11. So much for pre-ordering.
Update: So it came the next morning. It makes sense since it was just released today! Love it!

I just want to frontload my review with this: I'm over 40, a father, and have never played another Super Smash Bros. game. I've played older fighting games, like Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat, and know the gist of how they work. I've played and enjoyed Breath of the Wild, Super Mario Odyssey, and Super Mario Kart 8 on the Switch very much.

The good: The backgrounds on this game are extremely well-done. They can been a little confusing at times, as they move and drop you into new settings during a match, but that is easy enough to avoid, if you wish. Fun if you're solely into button-mashing, with no strategy involved.

The bad: The only way to figure out the game menus is to have played the game before. There is no reason for the navigation to be so complicated. Unfortunately this makes the game much more tedious than it needs to be.
titles: Almost necessary to have played the previous ones to understand this one

review_contents: Just so people know! The Digital Code version gets delivered nearly instantly and you put the code on the eShop. I then got a second email with the code for Piranha Plant.
titles: Got The Digital Code Which Included Piranha Plant

review_contents: My freind told me pokemon lets go pikachu/eevee will outsell super smash ultimate.... I told him he needs to go seek medical help asap.
I‚Äôm not happy. In the catalog it didn‚Äôt say digital and when I tried to cancel it and order cartridge it won‚Äôt let me. Gift for grandson. I didn‚Äôt want digital version. What now
titles: Should have said in catalog it was digital.  I didn‚Äôt want that version.  What now??

review_contents: I just got the game today in the mail today and I opened it and there was no game. The package it came in, with multiple items from Amazon as well, was not tampered with or looked like it was so it couldn‚Äôt have been a post office or delivery worker that took it. When I took the game out I noticed the plastic cover (which every game has), was tampered with but thought nothing of it, but once I opened it, there was nothing there. It looked like someone cut the side but again I thought nothing of it. I think someone ordered this game, cut the side and took the game out, then returned it and got the money back. I think whoever is in charge should check every returned game to make sure the game is ACTUALLY in there. Honestly this is such bs
titles: The company has to check returned games

review_contents:
Mario still hasn‚Äôt made an appearance in smash brothers. I mean come on microsoft, but everyone else is in the game, even the girls from dead or alive. my friends say its better with the GameCube cobtrollers but even that also sucks. I plug in the game cube and none of the three buttons work except for one and all that does is flip open the disk reader.

and that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm rating just dance at a 3/5. technology works efficiently but it‚Äôs too gimmicky and repetitive

As a person who has been riding the hype train for Smash Ultimate, I was NOT disappointed in the slightest when I began to play it. There is just so much content in this game that I can already see myself having 100+ hours in it. I'm making this review because there was some concerns that I read in some other reviews and I want to point out some things.

There was a review that talked about how you start off with 8 characters and how it was not advertised above. Although I cannot confirm the second statement as I did not read it, starting with 8 characters is true. The truth is, this game's 72 characters are unlocked every 10 minutes which if you do the math means a seriously long time. How to fix this? Play a match with 20 minutes facing any CPU on any stage with a lot of room. Once done you should see a new challenger. Beat them and exit out the game. Re-enter in the game and play again only this time with one live and self destruct at the start of a match. You should get another challenger. Rinse and repeat until you get all the characters and if it doesnt pop up anymore, redo the first method and follow the same progress. I have used this method and unlocked 53 characters and I could have done more if my switch didnt die or I wanted to eat. (I searched and found that I only played this game for 6 hours in my profile).

One review said that it doesnt teach you how to play the game which is completely 1000000% false. When you enter in the game on the smash ultimate logo, DO NOT TOUCH ANYTHING. A video pops up to tell you how to play that any child can learn from.

This review is already super long so I'll end this by stating that there are ALREADY videos on how to find things on the menu, unlock things, and many others. If you are complaining here without even doing your research then clearly you arent doing your homework.

I recommend watching a Youtuber called "Zerowondering" who was ranked the best player in Smash Wii U/3DS and posts videos on how to do "this and that" in Ultimate. Be sure to tell him that I sent you lol. Alright. This ends my review! GO PLAY SOME ULTIMATE!!!
I am just writing this review because I can!

If you've been into Smash Bros. since its early days, or have ever wanted to get into the series this is the best entry point for newcomers. With every character that has been in all the previous games back and this one, plus a good number of newcomers, and with more on the way in the form of DLC. Many quality of life changes have made this more accessible to beginners while also helping you train to get better to reach a more competitive level. There are hundreds of hours of playtime in this for a single player, but of course the best fun is with friends and family.
titles: The Best Smash for your Money

review_contents: Boy am I livid. I had been waiting patiently for my physical copy to arrive and was looking forward to playing it after work the day it arrived. I opened up my SEALED case and it was EMPTY. NO MANUAL NO CARTRIDGE!!! WTF how does this even happen.

Been playing the series since Nintendo 64, great family and friend game to kick each other butts with hahahah I canceled my non-bundle order for the bundle order one for the fighter‚Äôs pack dlc. I‚Äôm hopefully it will leave up to it‚Äôs heightest for butt kicking good time!!

This is the first time I‚Äôve ever played any version of Super Smash bro's. It‚Äôs loud, it‚Äôs flashy, it has great music, but has no instructions $^!*@#^!! I spent the first 15 minutes just trying to open a battle, then got destroyed for the next 30 minutes while I helplessly mashed any key I could. One hour and 10+ Google searches later, I was just trying to figure out how to open training mode. Was there a training mode? Thankfully yes. There is a training mode hidden here in a place you wouldn't think to look.

After another hour trying to figure out how to do moves (the game only gives you instructions 5 moves.) The rest you kind of have to figure out on your own. I still have no idea how the spirits are used (are they just aura buffs?) and how much each level improves my character? Where are the stats? Why are there 2 spirits? Are there other special moves not listed on those 5 moves? Where can I find them? I use game suggested spirits because there is no darn manual to explain! Why can my damage go above 100%? How do I do a ‚Äúfinal smash?‚Äù What the heck is a ‚Äúfinal smash?‚Äù Why does Kirby change after eating an opponent? How do I revert back? What is the buff he gets? It is incredibly frustrating for first time players. I played fighting all my life and this is the first I‚Äôve had so much trouble with.

I gifted a copy of the game to my 8-year old nephew on Wednesday, and called me crying in frustration this morning letting me know he still can‚Äôt figure out how to get past the initial menus screens.

I feel Nintendo let their "new players" with a short rope, banking all the "veteran players" who knew the game would know what to do. What about the rest of us? The game play looks fun, but there are no instruction on how to reach that level of knowledge to enjoy it at its full potential. I bought a 3rd copy for Christmas for my other nephew, but thinking of returning it. I seldom play and just wanted to enjoy myself. I don't feel like spending hours just to try and figure out moves on Adventure Mode to be able to enjoy a game which should already come with instructions?
titles: First time playing - No instructions included - Hard to figure out

review_contents: Great game. All the characters are there. Placed my order and can start player. Everyone should get. Really great game.

Pros:
+ Large roster of 75 fighters at launch.
+ Huge list of 103 stages.
+ ENORMOUS catalog of music. The audio in this game is INSANE! I've never seen a game with so much musical variety on top of all new voice acting and sound effects.
+ Many franchises represented with fighters, stages, music, spirits, and challenges. Where else can you throw a Pokeball at Mario and Sonic while playing as Samus on a stage resembling Midgar?
+ Chrom, Incineroar, and King K. Rool are excellent picks for new characters. There are other new characters.
+ Very fun to play with a lot of friends! 8 player Smash on a projection screen is still a blast!
+ Multiple control options. Use Joy-Cons, Pro Controllers, or Gamecube controllers.
+ Everyone can play Smash Bros. Adults, kids, and even non-gamers can play the game. Easy to learn; difficult to master.
+ Very flexible fight system. Deep customization options for player handicaps, fighter balancing, stage hazard control, item frequency, teams, and more. More options than previous games.

In-Betweens:
o All fighters can now be unlocked thanks to patch 1.2. Previously it was near-impossible for a non-competitive or casual player to unlock all the fighters due to super-aggressive AI.
o Online play is smooth and tries to respect your preferences. Prior to patch 1.2, the online was laggy and would put you in matches you didn't want to play.
o Nintendo seems very disconnected from their players. They don't seem to be able to interact with casual Smash fans without sending the hyper-competitive group into a meltdown.

Cons:
- "Everyone is here" is not actually true! Charizard is not a standalone fighter anymore and has been tied back to Pokemon Trainer. Nintendo really should release a patch that gives the option to play Charizard standalone again. Being forced over to Squirtle upon KO is a problem. The competitive player argument that Charizard was always intended to be part of Pokemon trainer does not satisfy the casual crowd. It was fun to play standalone Charizard! Nintendo, please fix!
- Gatekeeping online community of hyper-competitive players who care more about tier lists and frames than fun. Very difficult to get Nintendo to pay attention to genuine problems when the elite players are constantly screaming for nerfs and more difficulty while suppressing everyone else.
- Starting roster is only the original 8 fighters from the N64 days. You must unlock 67 other fighters. Ridiculous! Takes a long time to unlock all fighters even when using workarounds. Not acceptable in a full priced game.
- Adventure mode is highly repetitive. It could have used some side-scrolling, beat-em-up levels like mini-Subspace Emissary or Smash Run experiences. It can take a long time to unlock new fighters in adventure mode.
- Some features are missing. No stage builder, home run contest, target smash, and some other classics. Not a huge loss, but still curiously absent staples of the franchise.
- Online system does a terrible job of separating competitive players from casual players.
- No Miiverse doodle fun.

I've owned every Smash game since the original N64 game. Smash can be a fun game to play with your friends if everyone chills out. Smash Ultimate feels like a step forward in some ways, and a step back in other ways. At launch, Smash Ultimate felt too focused on the competitive players. After patch 1.2, Nintendo has made some adjustments for the casual crowd and earned a star. The jury is still out as to if Smash Ultimate is more about fun or more about competition. I need to see some of the cons addressed before I increase the star rating for this product again. Good game, but could be so much more!

Have played about 3 hours so far and am really happy with this game. World of Light is a really interesting way to keep the content fresh and the characters unlock at a steady pace.

Definitely lived up to the hype.

It was a lot different than I thought and that's in a bad way. First impression was the interface. The menu screen and the rest of the selection menus are incredibly dull-looking and honestly just ugly. It's grrat that it's easy to navigate, but I was a little let down on the interface. Secondly, online play is laggy, huge disappointment, sometimes nearly unplayable. I did not have this issue for brawl. Thirdly, we're severely limited in character selection for online play. This definitely applies to co-op mode online (not sure with single player) teams, but in order to change your character, you have to exit out and quit playing with the same opponents? Again this wasn't the case with brawl. This is such a stupid hassle and I don't understand why Nintendo would even do this. Also I would like to have the option to play with multiplayer mode online with friends. It's ridiculous how it's only single player and my siblings can't join in on the fun for battle arena. Moving on, World of Light was fun for the first 10 minutes, then I realized how repetitive and boring it was, epecially with the lack of a promising story. Attempting to obtain 4* through spirit battle are nearly impossible--it's pure luck if you win, but you'll be bummed if you miss your shot trying to "steal and awaken" the spirit from the statue. Last but not least, why was the option to create custom stages removed?

First time for Smash series. It is very much fun including online play.
I played Pokken a lot on Switch and Soul Calibur 6 on PC/PS4. I love Tekken 7 too.

The 11 language support are great.

I've unlocked all fighters and play online about 100 fights.
Now I understand that this game is so widely poplar and some over expected low rate reviews.

It has lots of random factors for winning and called party game. And it's Nintendo game.

I think this is great game and fit many players. But if someone is not satisfied, I think it's better to play more real fight games like Pokken on Switch.

I wish more cute female fighters on this game as well. Tekken, DOA, Soul Calibur have more leading female characters.

Over all this is one of the best game on Switch for sure. But if you're not satisfied on real fighting game experience, I think it's better to try other game as well. I would recommend Soul Calibur 6 as my most favorite now or Pokken on Switch.

It's easy to be bitter over the minutiae of what's missing, what's different, etc. But the fact is, this is undeniably the best total Smash Bros package to date. It's massive, it's superbly polished, and it's seemingly boundless in its content. The first couple of days with this game have taken me back to the sentiments I had when first experiencing Melee on the GameCube, and that's a phenomenon I haven't enjoyed since 2001. I'm 36, and it's like I'm a kid again.

The best aspects of the series have been distilled down to what initially seems almost certainly the best-balanced installment to date. The action is swift, the characters and stages are seemingly neverending, and the music... 850 songs spanning dozens of franchises from different companies in gaming history. Unreal.

Here's hoping the online wrinkles get ironed out to where matches prioritize connection quality over brevity of the waiting period. If this can be accomplished, I'll have very few complaints about anything.
titles: Top notch product; an unprecedented love letter to gaming

review_contents:
I'm not a competitive player so I picked the characters I enjoyed the most of Smash History.

This is my Top 10 Favorite Super Smash Bros Fighters of all time.

10. Sonic the Hedgehog

Back in Brawl, I was excited to play as him when I unlocked the character, He may be bad at launching opponents like Young Link, but I played a lot of his games since then. I don't play as him as much in newer games. But I like to play as him once a while.

9. Joker (Persona 5)

I loved Persona 5 back when I played it. I was kinda supprised when Joker was announced as a first DLC fighter, Once I played as Joker, He has all the attacks from his game, like pistols and grapple hooks. I also liked that his Persona Arcene comes out when his gauge gets full, His attacks are powered and his recovery are better, Arcene won't last long in battle, but he's a fighter he won't be reckon with from his past criminal record.

8. Dr. Mario

I liked regular Mario, but I'm not fan of this FLUDD attack from Sunshine. So he was brought back in Smash 4, I still like his attacks are more tougher than Mario's, He may lack in recovery. I still prefer over Mario for his down special spining attack tornado.

7. Toon Link

Link and Young Link are good fighters, but I always play as him since I unlocked him in Brawl. I like he jumps higher, and he's quick as Young Link, I was fan of his Cartoony Appearence from Wind Waker, A lot of people didn't liked it back in the day. I still play as him over other Links.

6.Rosalina and Luma

I was kinda supprised when they decided to bring Rosalina to Smash 4, I liked her attacks like the Luma, You can control both Luma and Rosalina at the same time, I also like she can have her Luma defend her from attacks. Her attacks may be nerfed in Ultimate, I still play has her.

5. Byleth

I was supprised I started to play as the character more than I expected, I was kinda not too crazy when a another Fire Emblem character come to Ultimate, I was impressed of his or her moves, like the Powerfull Bow, Spear and Axe, Atttacks may be slow, But I like the Grapple Hook Recovery, There's a male version, but I mostly play a female version of her thanks of her pleasant appearence.

4. Ice Climbers

I was kinda bummed when they removed the duo in Smash 4 beacause of techinal limitations of the 3DS Hardware, I glad they were brought back in Ultimate, Their attacks are changed, I played them in Melee and Brawl. Not beacause of their broken imfamous ferocious chain grab attacks, I liked you can control both Popo and Nana at the same time, your probably supprised I had them on this list.

3. Princess Peach

Okay, I love to play as her in every Smash Bros games since Melee, She may be nerfed in Brawl, but she got slightly better in later games, Her Parasol Recovery is great, I liked how she floats with her elegant dress, I know I'm a guy playing as a Pretty Pink Princess, I also like to throw veggies at opponents as well, I love her feminine charms to take out opponents with her slap and her Heart Bomber.

2. Ness

My boy Ness has been around since Smash Bros 64 as a unlockable fighter, I was fan of his original game Earthbound. I like how he floats, He has PK attacks to take out opponents, like the PK Thunder to recover himself. I played as him in almost every games in the entire franchise.

1. Kirby

Kirby is one of my favorite characters of all time, He may be bad in most games, but I liked is copy ability like swallowing his opponents to use their attacks, I like he hovers to recover, and I like how he sounds in most game, just so adorable, I play almost every games just like Ness. Just knock his opponents out with a hammer just like King Dedede. He also great for combos like kicking.
titles: This review has my favorite fighters of all time from all generations of Smash.

review_contents: This game truly lives up to its name by offering the most comprehensive game in the series to date. With so many things to play, fight, and unlock you‚Äôll be enjoying this title for hours and hours. The new World of Light adventure mode is a huge improvement and a welcomed addition with it‚Äôs amusing and shockingly large campaign. The Smash Bros. series has always maintained a balance of chaotic fun with a fighting game with so much depth to it. Super Smash Bros. Ultimate refines and improves on both sides of itself without abandoning either one. Definitely a most have if you own a Nintendo Switch.

(Update after Terry had just released, since having the game day 1)

Online is terrible, single player is terrible. Outside of playing locally with friends this game is worthless.

The single player experience boils down to "Did the AI read you controller and just cheat to win or was it unbelievably useless and walked off a cliff?" There isn't much in between.

The online multiplayer is a lag fest slide show most times, and barely playable at others.

I do not get the praise.
titles: Unplayable online and awful single player content, feels like half a game

review_contents:
Pros:
The World of Light adventure mode is fantastic. Not only is it really fun to play with the addition of a progression system with the spirits, skill tree, and unlocking more fighters, but it also quite long and will take you many hours to fully play through. I actually quite enjoyed the spirit system and the many different spirit fights seem diverse enough that it doesn't really start to bore me. Maybe the only problem is the varied difficulty of fights. Most fights are insanely easy after you have a decent full leveled spirit, even on the highest difficulty, but you can always purposefully handicap yourself by using a weaker spirit if that's your thing. But also some of the fights were so insanely difficult and unfair that switching down to "easy" mode still made the fight take me 30 minutes of replaying to beat (and I'm pretty decent at the game). Honestly it wasn't even a downside for me I enjoyed the challenge and it wasn't a necessary fight for progressing.
Huge character pool this time around. "Everyone is here!" Not an exaggeration over 80 characters will be on the roster after dlc and counting Pokemon trainer as multiple fighters. Obviously some of those are just slightly different echo fighters, but the diversity is still great. Just quick unlocking characters by restarting, unlocking, and restarting again took a long time. All the characters look great and feel great to play and play vs, though I haven't been able to use all of the extensively yet.
I'm not a pro player by any stretch, but the fighting mechanics feel fluid and the engine seems well polished. I love that the heavy characters have been buffed by having their lag time for aerials and landing reduced. I like them making perfect shield harder/different as it will give pros something to develop skill wise as well. Hopefully the pro scene will be able to make something of this game as smash 4 was a bit of a let down (won't even talk about brawl).
They also made training mode better, and allow you to play the game while waiting for an online match, but many other parts of online are less than desirable.

Cons:
Online mode is kind of taking a back seat here. I was really hoping we would be getting a more fine tuned and more competition oriented online mode, but got the opposite. They made online mode a for fun system, which I understand is the direction Sakurai wants to take with the game, but I just don't understand why they couldn't have given their competitive community a bone here. Online match making no longer has a For Glory mode. There is simply casual mode with a matchmaking system that puts you up against someone near your skill level based on an elo system on a per fighter basis. It also matches you with some with a game rule similar to your own, but not exact.... this has made me go into what I thought was a 1v1 no items match into an assist trophy free for all nightmare. This is also going to continue to create debates as to what the "official" competitive rule set will be for 1v1 online play.

Overall the game is a great experience and was definitely worth the purchase and worth the wait. Tons of replayablity and fun for all levels of players.
titles: Amazing Adventure Mode, Huge Character Pool, and Great Mechanics

review_contents: This game is absolutely crazy. Love the new animations and feel of the game. Even joker is going to be in it! What else can we ask for

It's good for the fact that it has all the characters from previous versions and some new ones as well, but has some flaws too. The 'story' mode, World of Light, is further from a Brawl-like Subspace Emissary adventure, and more of a boring slog through a seemingly endless line of one-on-one fights. The cutscenes are few and far between, and the spirit system is more cumbersome than enjoyable. The changed battle mechanics are a bit of a step down from Smash 4 in my opinion, although everyone will have their own opinion on this. With all that said, this game has the most to enjoy out of any smash game, including all the battle modes, characters, and stages. There are simple tweaks that make the game more enjoyable, such as the ability to set different and default rule sets, the Pokemon-style party battle, the variation in classic modes, stagemorph, controlling stage hazards, final smash meter, the big scoreboard, and more. If you enjoy Smash as a multiplayer experience instead of a single player one, this game is a must-have.

I bought this as a Christmas gift for myself. This is easily the only reason I bought a Nintendo Switch initially (I recently received a few Switch games for Christmas as well).

The game is incredibly fun. The Adventure mode takes you around a huge map where you collect 'spirits' that aid you in battle while you unlock your main fighting characters who have been trapped by evil. When you think the Adventure Mode over and you beat the game - guess again. You'll see what I'm talking about!

I ended up beating it and finishing at 99.02% completion. I played it on 'normal' difficulty. If its too easy or hard, you can switch difficulty as well. For the entire Adventure board and 99.02% completion, it took me just under 30 hours of game play. You will definitely get your money's worth.

There's also a 'spirit' mode where you just conduct battles to gather spirits. They cycle out every 5 minutes or so. It's great to collect any spirits you've missed as last I checked, there's over 1,200 in the game and there's been updates to continually add more.

Smash Online is fun to battle in multiplayer. There's different settings you can do from lives, items, maps, etc. that you can set so you're placed in a game that you want to be in. My biggest complaint with online play though is that the servers are extremely laggy. If one person in the match has a bad connection / slow internet / etc, then everyone suffers with lag and stuttering. I am not sure if this is a Nintendo server issue or a Brawl server issue, but its pretty frustrating. Other than that and if you're placed in a good server and people with good connections, its a load of fun and challenging if you're paired with other experienced Smash players.

Overall, a great game. Its definitely worth purchasing.
titles: Best game for the Nintendo Switch!

review_contents:
I've been playing Smash Bros. since the N64 days and it's been great watching the evolution of the franchise. There have been stepbacks, especially with Brawl, but each iteration brings something new and unique to the playing field. Smash Ultimate is more than that as it brings most of everything from all Smash games and THEN some.

Technically, this game is gorgeous to play on a big screen and portable mode and 99.9% of the time, runs at a stable 60fps. Lag inputs are somewhat of an issue compared to older titles, but it's something I've gotten used to (still hoping for a patch).
Speaking of input, the mechanics of this title are fluid and tight with each character feeling unique in their own movesets. There are so many characters to choose from and the promise of even more is mindblowing. It's almost impossible to buy this game, play it, and not find a character you stick to.
But the real star of this show are the gamemodes, specifically the Adventure mode. World of Light has some great battles and good challenges for those looking for one, but it's extremely lengthy. My 100% playthrough of the adventure mode on hard clocked in at over 40 hours. Of course, your mileage may vary, but expect a long time grinding. Other modes, like classic and multi-man smash are also great fun, with challenges encouraging you to pull off some crazy, insane feats.
But, when it comes down to just playing Smash by yourself or friends, this is the ULTIMATE package. I haven't tried the online yet, so I don't have an opinion on that, though I have heard some negatives. Either way, your $60 or whatever price you pay will not be wasted, rest assured.

This is not just a Switch essential, it's a reason to BUY a Switch.
titles: My Favorite Smash Bros, Bar None

review_contents:
The latency in this game made it a trashfire for me personally. Yeah I'm coming from a melee background. And if you tell me I'm spoiled I'll tell you that things should get better not worse and you're the reason searching for a movie on amazon and netflix sucks. Because scrolling to a file in an alphabetically list and clicking it which takes 2 seconds was somehow, to you, less preferable than taking 7 minutes to get your tv remote to painstakingly land on Twilight on your streaming services when you were actually trying for Titanic. Admit it, the Apple spearheaded gaudy-square ui that infects everything now was more preferable to your lazy narcissism than selecting from simple raw data and that's why we're all doomed. That's why capitalism is allowed to take away user's right to easily perform maintenance on their own devices. They distracted you with an Idiocracy level ui where you can push pretty buttons and you gave up the entire logic center of your brain with no complaint.

ANYWAY I have beef with a bunch of Ultimate. Here's a main one: Screwing with the screen in 50 different ways during play is not a game mechanic. It's bad game design and there's no way to avoid it in the single player. You limit who you play with when you have to set flags for "yeah stop putting an insulting giant dog graphic over the screen when people are playing and calling it a feature." Single player is especially heinous with this crap.

Online is toxic of course. People just troll or kill themselves over and over when they die once and it apparently bans you for 30 minutes when you do that. When that happens I'm mostly like "yay I get to stop playing." Nintendo failed to balance their way out of metas so you're always going to have 50 Peaches spamming the butt attack one week and I dunno...Kirby doing some pink auto-win nipple dance the next. Who cares anymore.

Buy this if you've got people in the room to play with and only if you want its frustrating nature to permeate and destroy your various friendships and family ties faster than Monopoly.

I was really excited for this game. Normally I don't care too much about games, I buy the ones I think will be fun, and leave it at that. This, however, was very different. I now didn't need to choose which game I wanted to play, because all the characters are available. Of course there are changes, but I'm a very casual player, so Im not really affected by them. I also like that now you can play on any map in any form essentially. This makes it more fun to do a random map without worrying about a place like 'temple' coming up. Unlocking all the characters was such a journey, but well worth it. I do wish I tried out other characters during that time so I can learn their moves, but I was just trying to unlock them first...so I only know like 5 characters, but with all the echo fighters, and other just pretty similar fighters, it shouldn't be much of an issue, and like I said, very casual gamer here. Can't wait for the online to actually start working properly so I can see how bad I actually am

Tons of characters are only attainable in DLC packs, of which there are many. Good game though, just tired of paying through the nose to get part of a game and then having to pay more to get the rest.
titles: Great game, but too much DLC content

review_contents:
Solid game. Many great characters and counting. Negatives would be the lack of any non-fighting mode. Was hoping for another Home Run mode at least. I would've preferred they work on incorporating a non-fighting minigame than add more characters to this already great roster I haven't even played all the characters with yet. Was very disappointed after beating the World of Light to find there was nothing else to do but fight in every other game mode. Also the World of Light has steep variances in difficulty. I had to switch to easy to beat certain spirits, but switch to medium or hard to get a decent challenge out of the unlockable fighters and boss battles.

Pros
- Large array of characters.
- Long story mode that requires you to think a little

Cons
- All game modes revolve around fighting
- No cool minigames
- World of Light has steep variances in difficulties due to spirit abilities/conditions
- No ability to lower difficulty in Spirit Board. Getting legendary spirits really comes down to a luck. AI is too difficult for casual gamers.
titles: Solid Game, but missing the extra mile for those who enjoyed mini games

review_contents: I didn't really find it particularly enjoyable like everybody else did mostly because the characters feel even harder to control than the previous game I do like the fact that you have to unlock almost every character in the game I guess but that means you're required to spend at least 10 hours unlocking characters. And there's no guarantee within that 10 hours period that you're going to unlock every character. But considering in the adventure mode the first character you're able to use his Kirby witch honestly I don't like Kirby kind of kills it for me I would have honestly preferred anybody else first in the adventure mode

Unlike the previous Smash games, this one is made for competitors in competitions. The difficulty spikes are completely random and when they do spike...you better be good or you will lose your chance at a new character. Don't worry though, after waiting 2 days (literally the amount of time I waited for a rematch) you'll get another crack at them. There is a new adventure mode called "World of Light" but again even playing on easy the difficulty spikes randomly even if the enemy encounter says it'll be easy. I would never recommend this game to anyone and I have all the Smash Bros games and LOVED THEM...till now. Do not get this for your child or you will hear screaming and controllers being broken. Last warning...DON'T GET THIS GAME IF YOU DON'T LIKE HEARING "CONTINUE?"

First off the game definitely has potential, but the Online is atrocious. For starters, you have to pay separately for online unlike Ninentdo‚Äôs previous online systems. This wouldn‚Äôt be so bad if the online itself was well executed, but it‚Äôs awful. You can request a 1 vs 1 match, yet end up in a 4-player Free For All with items on everywhere. Oh, and if you disconnect from the game you didn‚Äôt want? That‚Äôs a penalty, so no more online for you for a while!

The game also has some awful balancing. Characters like Inklings, Bowser, and Charizard are ridiculously overpowered. It makes playing ‚Äúworse‚Äù characters not fun at all.
titles: Awful Online and poor balance overall

review_contents: Imagine you are playing one of those popular Call of duty games that all the kids are playing now adays. Now imagine you want to play team deathmatch, you tell the game that all you want to do is play team deathmatch but instead it keeps aggressively rubbing your crotch with a cheese grinder until all that is left is the bloody pulp of what used to be your manhood. Steer clear of this game for now if you are trying to have any sort of skill based online gameplay. All that you are going to find here is ffa with all items turned on. Tldr: 5/5 game ruined by Nintendo's ineptitude with anything that connects to the interwebs.

I never played the original, so have nothing to compare this to.
With all the hype, I was expecting more, but I was indifferent about this game (maybe I'm just old, original Atari era gamer). This has so much going on at times, its nigh impossible to see what is going on.
Sure it nice to see soooooooooooooooo many iconic Nintendo characters in one place and beat the ever-loving crap out of each other, but I guess I was expecting more MK/Tekken/SF - this is not the game's fault - its mine.

The graphics and sound are superb.
Gameplay seems repetitive to me though, with no clear end-goal.
However, my son loves this so that's a win and not a complete waste.

Giving a 4 for graphics, sound and atmosphere, but brawlers just aren't for me personally.

I grew up on Smash Bros. Melee for the Gamecube. I never adjusted to Brawl and never owned a Wii U. I did however get a switch and after waiting for initial reviews decided it was time to have Smash on my switch.

What can I say? I love this game. As an occasional gamer, I get a lot of value out of this game. I personally focus on classic mode and unlock a lot of elements of the game through the classic matches (new characters, music, etc (it has a story mode as well which is fine but not my focus). As of 2019, you can use the gamecube controller for this game with an adapter (which I have yet to try but expect it to be fantastic).

Some reviewers who are new to smash have been turned off by initial impressions of the game. This is not a game to show off/play with friends the first night you open and play it. You have to play it and unlock its full potential. You will grow and develop into a better player doing so. If you want a fighting game for parties/gatherings and don't have the patience to unlock this game, consider something like capcom vs. or street fighter II.

Additionally, you need to make sure you have a tv or monitor that has gamemode. If you have a bunch of settings on your display to make things look better, this will create input lag. I also recommend the pro controller for this game.

All-in-all this is a fantastic version of Smash. It has replaced my need of Smash Bros. Melee (my wii won't run forever and Gamecube discs will not hold up forever either).

So if you love previous Smash titles or are thinking about getting this, just buy it. It rocks.

This is my first smash bros game of any kind on any platform. I haven't played it for very long and even then only the single player "story mode", no local or network multiplayer.

I don't usually get into fighting games but I decided to give this a try (there was that brief phase with "killer instinct" in 90s but lets not count that).

What I eventually realized is that this is to the street fighter or soul caliber games what mario kart is the forza series: technically the same genre but serving a much different purpose. I mean you can probably guess that seeing how you can pick "the wii fit" character as a fighter.

The game didn't came with a manual but there is a "moves list" for each fighter. Feels like I'm still missing a lot of important information that I just assume I'll have to look up on my own. For instance all the moves in the moves list seem to emphasize some combination of the B button but there's no mention the A or other buttons. I'm pretty sure the combinations of the other three button also do things. I also have no idea how to recover from falling off the edge of a stage.

Actually there's one stage where this giant...I guess battle ship is aiming a massive gun at me the whole time and will decided the fire randomly. There was match it lasted about 5 seconds and I was already dead having not had time to do anything. It's a short loading time to retry but do it enough time even that load time gets annoying.

I knew going in the pacing is fast and furious and probably confusing with so many characters on screen at once. I can't exactly mark it down for that. And wow, it is hyper fast and jumbled up when it's at its peak.

For now I'm giving it four stars for lack of clarity and some truly confusing and arbitrarily hard stages. Not the characters that are hard. The literal backdrop/background attacks. Maybe there's some way to attack the stage along with the enemy character(s), I don't know since I usually get defeated before I can even tell.

I'll certainly come back and update the score and review as I get more experience.
titles: This is my first smash game and I think I like it

review_contents: Amazing game. If you're a fan of the Smash series, it is well worth it.

Everything except the core gameplay is amazing. Plenty of gamemodes, great look and feel, all the characters and stages are there, everything is top-notch.

For any new or returning Smash player who just wants to have a great time with their buddies: 5 stars; stop reading and buy the game now.
For anyone who wants to play the game competitively in any way, 1 star; total garbage.

The balancing of the characters is so, so far off from what is appropriate for those who fall between completely-casual and tournament-winning-professional (which is 99% of people). If you want to have a friendly competition with your buds, SSBU just isn't suited for it. If you want to climb the Online ladder, SSBU just isn't suited for it. If you want to practice and improve, SSBU just isn't suited for it. (Although the game is pretty balanced for the top 10 players in the world, no one reading this review is top 10, and that's what matters.)

There are MANY reasons for this, but they all come down to balancing. For two players of about equal skill, some matchups are just unwinnable because one character is so much better than the other. The game also has so much cheese; some characters are seemingly unbeatable by spamming one or two moves.

I'm not going to list out ever issue I've encountered, but trust me when I say that you cannot take this game seriously as it is currently balanced. Nintendo has made several mistakes when deciding which fighters get what moves/abilities, and the quality of the gameplay greatly suffers for it.

Side note: the Online has way too much input lag to be playable on normal home Wi-Fi. 0/10, do NOT recommend.
titles: Poor balancing ruins the game. Otherwise amazing.

review_contents:
This game is a mess. The developers tried to cram a whole bunch of crap into this game. Not to seem like I'm living in the past... but the Super Smash Bros games for the N64 / Gamecube were much much better. This one has a single player mode called Adventure Mode, which is a headache. The whole spirit thing they've added in this game probably ought not to be there. The graphics are pretty good, admittedly, although sometimes the screen is such a jumbled chaotic mess that you'll strain your eyes trying to track your characters' position in the map.

Anyway, this was fifty bucks wasted for me. Your mileage may vary.

I was so excited to play this game because I had never played it before and I heard great things about it. I had also just purchased my switch and this was one of the first games I purchased for it. I went to open it and noticed that the plastic wrapping around it was a little bit loose but I didn‚Äôt pay much attention to it. I opened the box and saw nothing. There was no game in it. I looked online to see if this has happened to anyone else and apparently it does happen a lot. I immediately started the refund/return process and sent it back ASAP. I sent it back on March 25 and am waiting to get my money refunded.
titles: There was no game cartridge in the box

review_contents: So I won't go into what makes this a better Super Smash Brothers. Most of us already know that it has an insane amount of characters in it. An insane amount of levels. Better gameplay then Super Smash Brother Brawl and I would rank it as this almost the same game play as Super Smash Brothers U. Out of Super Smash Brothers games, it's easily my favorite besides The Golden Child of Super Smash Brothers Melee. My real issue with this game comes to what they didn't give us. It's is a small complaint. I'm really sad that we didn't get a home run contest or break the targets. I miss the trophies that you would get and how you could spend time just looking at them. I get why they're not in there. This game is huge. I like that they put in a story mode. Then again I also wish it was more like brawl when it came down to that story mode. It would also have been nice if the story mode came with a two player option. Overall this game was in the right direction. Every issue I have with it is just my issue. I'm still loving the game
titles: Too big and too small at the same time?

review_contents: Had a delivery snafu and ended up having to get a refund from Amazon, but I was able to get the game digitally through the eshop (14GB for those wondering). I am absolutely stunned by the amount of content in this game! It has the nostalgia and simplicity of the earlier entries in the series but there‚Äôs so much to do and unlock between the many different game modes and the challenges that it feels completely brand new. The roster is huge, but you only start with the original 8 characters. However, you begin to unlock new ones very quickly. Not sure if there‚Äôs any method to how you unlock certain characters, but they‚Äôre coming along at such a steady pace that I should get to my favorites without a hassle. The level selection menu is a little overwhelming so I tend to just stick it on random. The Adventure mode map is HUGE and will likely keep me busy for many hours to come. Online is pretty seamless for matchmaking with strangers but the inability to directly message or invite friends is a little cumbersome. Also, relying on the phone app for voice chat is just ridiculous. I like that it limits my kids online interactions but it makes it so much more difficult than it should be.

Delivered on Release Day and currently playing it and it rocks. It‚Äôs so good that I bought several copies for my other friends who couldn‚Äôt afford to get it on launch day due to being broke from Cyber Monday shopping. It does really bring backs nostalgic feeling once again with the Smash games combine into one(technically). Here is my own opinion/review on the game.
Pros:
The Gameplay aspect of the game is still basically the same with added mechanics that make it more fluid especially to some of the characters who were given upgrades to make them more enjoyable to use and the new additions to the series is like Sakurai said on several Nintendo Directs and it is mostly based on their moves from their respective series.
The Modes is what you expect from the Directs especially the adventure(World Of Light) mode. I won‚Äôt put any spoilers into this review but I can say that it is an ending for the series that give the fans for Hardcore and Casual gamers to be happy about.
Music/etc: The Music section aspect of it is for those who really enjoyed their favorite music list and function of listening it on the go is nice extra function. Recommended for those who enjoy listening to their favorite series music. Especially the opening of the game(Lifelight) and that is what you called a Fantastic opening for a game.
Cons:
Each character has a certain learning curve to master-or to the basics type of move set.
Online: Some issues with the online service, could see them already releasing a patch soon later in the month to solve most of the issue. Watch for lags and slow frame rate when playing online. Also paying $20 for online sevice(it's not that much like PS+ and Xbox Live).
Well thats it for my review of the game and I will enjoy it for a long time for the years ahead and it is a must for Nintendo Switch users to have this in their collection of Switch games. I will wait on buying the Season Pass until they show the second challenger pack next year. Well happy hunting everyone and for gamers out there, let‚Äôs spread the message of Smash of being the best hype game in the Year of 2018.
Hansuke21 signing out.
titles: Smash Ultimate Review: A place to come back to since Childhood.

review_contents: A fighting game like this with all 70 characters to choose from make a game so Exciting. But who knows if this is the last Super Smash Bros game? Who knows if a another one is on the way? Apparently their were other fighting games that came about compared to SSMB but they didn't succeed to be better than SSMB. If this turns out to be the last one I guaranteed that their will be remake if necessary. I still have the SSMB for the 3DS and Wii U but no need for me play them anymore. I couldn't even play the one my Wii U anymore after I had to delete to make room for extra memory. When I tried reinstall it to play it again an Update was due but I didn't have enough memory so I never able to play it again. I was lucky that I still had on my 3DS. But now this has arrived I'll never get rid of it ever. Then again who knows if this is the last Super Smash Bros game?
titles: Best of the Best of SSMBU

review_contents:
I've always been a Smash fan. Had the 64 version and the Game Cube version. Loved both to death, but missed out on any others in between due to limited budget in college. Once I got the Switch when it came out, I was chomping at the bit for when this would come up!

I love how many characters you have to select from once you unlock them. Its also fun to play the single player Light quest mode. I found my brother and I unlocked most of the roster working together and taking turns. I also love the customization you can make to matches when you're playing against friends or the computer! Changing maps randomly is a fun feature! I know the Assist Trophy's are an addition in one of the games I missed, but between them and the pokemon roster you can get from the different pokeballs can make the entire match crazy if that's all you have selected to spawn. It's great fun all around!

A great installment to the Smash series!
titles: Great Game for Multiplayer and Single Player

review_contents:
Let's face it. You didnt buy the switch because of legend of zelda, mario odyssey, splatoon, mario kart, or pokemon. You bought the switch because once you saw the the Smash Bros first trailer you could feel your inner child screaming at the top of its lungs.

How to describe this game? Imagine taking the wiiu (3ds) smash bros, balancing some character attacks and adding melee (gamecube) tactics into the mesh. Oh, and then put every character ever made for smash bros into the fighting roster while adding 4 new characters totalling 74 playable characters. Let's top it off by saying theres no locked characters behind a pay wall. The CEO of capcom could take notes from this practice to rebuild its fanbase from previous titles while having characters associated in smash.

Without giving away too much I'd highly recommend this to all smash fans as well as newcomers that want a step different from racing and shooting. This game is, although too early to say, a masterpiece.
titles: The reason you bought a switch

review_contents:
FANTASTIC game. I've already put in 20 hours and still haven't unlocked everyone, it's just incredibly deep. The gameplay is fast and aggressive - campers will be punished. The animation is slick, the movements are smooth, and the fighters are all incredible. Just an absolute masterpiece of a game, the pinnacle of the series, and the crown jewel for the Nintendo Switch. You can't say you own a Switch if this game isn't in your library!

EDIT: A couple hundred hours later, and the game is still fantastic. The roster is well balanced, the characters are fun, and the gameplay can be as deep or as shallow as you want. Want to just have fun with family & friends or a good party game? This game is for you! Want a deep fighter with a high skill ceiling? You can find that here! The online portion is full of players trying very hard to be competitive. Basically anyone can find something to enjoy - if you own a Switch, you NEED to own this game

Wanted to love this game, but as a person who buys these games for the vast assortment of characters to play with it‚Äôs extremely annoying to find out you only start with 8 and have to unlock the rest. I simply don‚Äôt have the time or the patience to do this the normal way, and even using a method to speed up the process, beating the characters to unlock them is WAY too hard. I‚Äôd say I only unlock about 2 out of every 10 I fight. I bought this to just enjoy the game, but it‚Äôs hard to enjoy it when I‚Äôm spending all my time just trying to unlock the characters I actually want to play with.

This game is vastly improved from the Wii u version because it doesn't have unfair difficulty. Classic mode was a joke in smash for wii u. Classic mode and adventure provide a challenge without being unfair. the vast selection of characters and stages are another one of the stronger points. Stage select could have been easier to navigate through though. The fighting mechanics have been polished to make it more fair.
I love adventure mode and its story. Something that smash for wii u lacked.
I do feel like that the Spirit list should have more features that the trophy list used to have. I also miss home run contest and break the targets. Local multiplayer multi console gameplay is a bit laggy and slow. It becomes unplayable with more than 4 consoles connected.
I would say it's definitely worth picking up. It is much better than the Wii u version
titles: Greatly improved from the Wii u version. Still has some issues

review_contents: First Smash game I‚Äôve played since the N64 one. There are a lot of hidden mechanics and things to master in this game. A lot of the reviews on Amazon are so harsh it‚Äôs actually funny. I really am enjoying this and am learning how to master aspects of it all the time. Great to play with other people online and on the couch!

Very very fun game. Im not the biggest in for smash players but I do own the n64 and the gamecube versions. I missed out on the wii and wii u but this game makes up for it. Its basically all out with the cherry on top.
My favorite characters are in the games so Im pretty happy with who I wanna play with. The online is fun but I do gotta play more to get better. I have heard of people having some problems with online issues like slow down but I havent ran into that problem yet.
Overall if your thinking of picking it up, what are u waiting for? I pre ordered it day 1 and man Im very happy with my purchase. Thanks Nintendo.
The process for receiving the download code is pretty ambiguous.

Some characters are just plain broken (the Belmonts just feel like such cheeseball characters to play)
I hate the dynamic camera and there's no option to turn it off.

inb4 "lol you're just bad at the game", tested these in training mode too.
Apparently it's new that I can't change my character's left/right direction in midair anymore?
Sone really annoying hitbox issues where you're clearly passing through an enemy and the hit doesn't register. Even in training mode, standing still, not recently hit, or dodging, or invincible, just standing still and the hit just doesn't register.

Loading screens take forever after the recent update.

It's overall a fun game, but I can't give it more than 3/5 with these issues. Nothing kills fun faster than having a really good fight only to be felled by some minor glitch (or poor design) at a crucial point.

In my mind 5 out of 5 better be AMAZING or PERFECT. Ultimate is GREAT, in my eyes at least. Every fighter from the games before and new fighters come in to give the player an impression of the best that they can be. Some are better and some are worse (Little Mac but every fighter has a different profile of strengths and weaknesses that everyone can appreciate and not find frustrating to play. The new "system" has features that pros can appreciate but won't distract or discourage new players. Overall, it is coming off as the best Smash game.
Now here is my ONLY let down: World of Light feels grindy, boring, and I would REALLY much rather have sub space emissary from brawl, or adventure mode from Melee, or; better yet, more bosses for Classic mode would make this game AMAZING. I understand that they wanted to do something new and the symbolism, as well as the end of the game, are great. I am just not a fan of running into battle after battle equipping spirits for each and every encounter (same or less power level spirits give better rewards, so I was trying that). Others like me have eventually just choose one team and use them for the rest of the game instead of adjusting the spirit team.
Yes it is close to amazing, but what I am saying is that World of Light could have been done better.
If you‚Äôve never played smash before or are a super casual gamer this game is not for you. It is incredibly difficult and unforgiving with no tutorial.

Waited soooo long for this game to come out, and I can truly say it was worth it! The best smash bros game ever, so many characters to unlock, story/campaign mode is what this game needed too.. Can't really explain a lot more, but if you were a true smash lover before, you're are definitely gonna love it now too!
titles: Best Smash Bros you'll ever buy!!

review_contents: First I must say the graphics is breathtaking, but this is supposed to be the Ultimate meaning final, but where's the missing games? What missing games? Well on the GameCube version of Super Smash Brothers Melee there was a BREAK THE TARGET, and a HOMERUN CONTEST game in single player mode that just is not there is this Ultimate version for the Switch, so how can you say this new Smash Brothers is better than the low tech Gamecube's Smash Brothers? I don't know, but when you buy the newer version you just kinda of expect that all the games would be included. I'd have given this only two stars, but the graphics was very good to earn the 3 stars, thanks for reading my review, but if those games are there, and I'm just over looking them, please send me a comment letting me know what I'm doing wrong, thanks again.
titles: Couple of problems with this Super Smash Bro's Ultimate

review_contents:
Smash Ultimate is the best-looking game on the Switch in hand-held mode. This is the definitive mobile version of Smash, and it runs beautifully.

The single player content is outstanding. While I thought World of Light was decent, Spirit Board is an addicting collectible mode for people like me who want to pick-up-and-play. Each character getting their own themed Classic Mode is also really cool. One of my favorite changes is that the challenges aren't totally brutal overall. No "complete X mode with every character" stuff.

Multiplayer leaves a lot to be desired, though I've had lots of fun by avoiding Quickplay matchmaking and taking turns sparring with others in Arena.
titles: The definitive mobile Smash with realized single player

review_contents: This is a fun game and I would buy it again. Having said that the adventure mode is way too long. They try their best to give good variety with different characters and scenarios, but in the end it is still very monotonous. It also seems at times to go from reasonable beatable to nearly impossible to beat an opponent (or 2, 4, or 8 at once). I also find it annoying that you earn these cool rewards that cannot be used in the adventure mode. You can use them in a different mode, but that seems ridiculous to win them in one mode to only be able to use them in another.
titles: Fun game. The adventure campaign mode is WAY TOO LONG.

review_contents: Tuve problemas con el producto ya que la primera vez que lo recib√≠ el juego no estaba adentro del empaque sellado, sin embargo hice el reclamo y me enviaron al instante un reemplazo. Es un excelente juego, con muy buenos gr√°ficos y un concepto nuevo del viejo smash,

As of this point, I have positive feelings about the game. World of Light isn't Subspace Emissary levels of good, but it offers enough to make this game worth revisiting 10 years from now. Classic mode is very carefully thought out, giving a small story so every one's story is themed. The cast is loaded and it's mostly a buffed up version of Smash for Wii U/3DS. My only issues as of this point is: Final Smashes suck, they are about half as strong as they were in Brawl, and most are stupid cutscenes or things that restrict your control. Online as of this point (3/14/19) sucks as well. I don't know what Nintendo is doing, but we went from 4 player matches loaded with items running smooth on the Wii U version, to lag city on 1 v 1 no items Final Destination.

I always take my switch whenever we go somewhere far with my little cousins. When they are bored as hell when their cell phones are taken away, I just pop my switch out with super smash, oh man, they swarm you like little hungry mosquito. So many characters to choose from and intense fighting, make them joyful for many hours. I also grew up playing smash on N64 and I can easily join them and play together. Thank you nintendo for making this great game and I really appreciate this.
titles: One of best games on Switch

review_contents:
I and my bros have made the full transition from Brawl to Ultimate. I love the large selection of character and variety of stages to choose from. Figure players also add to the gaming experience with their unique adaptive personalities!

I am very glad single player was brought back in this rendition, though I‚Äôm a little disapointed that it‚Äôs no more than a map of arranged CPU battles instead of the classic side-scrollers like in Brawl‚Äôs Subspace Emissary. I‚Äôm also sad they removed 15 minute brawl as well as the custom stage builder. I still have Brawl I can fall back to for these features, but I would have really like to try the new characters on these. Maybe in a future update or extension? Fingers crossed.

Lots of fun and a great way to power down from a hard day‚Äôs work!

Well I‚Äôll try to give this a serious review. This Smash iteration is the most polished out of them all. The game just works. For comparison, Melee had too many glitches which is what made it competitive, Brawl had too little hit stun and was too slow to do any combos at all and Meta Knight was just ridiculous, Smash For 3ds/Wii U had some combos but it really rewarded defensive play but you‚Äôll find a compromise with all of that in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate. If you want to play a party game this is it for you and also if you like to play competitively this is also for you. At first it was very weird getting into the game because of the new engine but when you get used to it. You‚Äôll be able to zoom all over the place and just land hits reliably although not too recklessly. The only issue I have with this game so far is there‚Äôs a slight hint of delay with the joy cons. I have my TV set to game mode which the game recommends and also there‚Äôs a lot of buffer. What I mean by buffer is let‚Äôs say you press A to attack, and then you input a jump on accident after the attack. The game will still register what you input first so instead of doing any other action you jump instead. It got in the way of continuing my combos but I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs too much of a problem. Hopefully it‚Äôll be patched soon.
titles: I‚Äôll try to review this seriously

review_contents: There is no chance whatsoever of playing with anyone online. The game lags so horribly, you'll be grabbing someone one second, and the next second you'll be off the screen because they apparently smashed you. Check the real reviews online, away from Amazon. Online play is horrible. Nintendo needs to synchronize a little better amigo.

Love this game, from the improvements from Smash 4 to the Light World campaign. All of the characters feel much more balanced, it's nice to have characters like Zelda and Donkey be competitive again. BUT! Online makes me want to drive my head into a 3 brick wide wall, 3 wide just to make sure I die from my injuries trying to break it down. It's incredibly inconsistent, not just from match to match, but second to second within each match. This is a huge portion of the game for me since I love playing against all different types of players and styles, and it is 100% garbage. Unless they fix this I don't see me playing it much into the new year.
titles: Nintendo should be ashamed of the online services

review_contents:
Smash is usually at its most fun when you're playing with friends. But as you grow up, the likelihood of living near your friends who would be willing to play Smash lowers, so you usually play it solo. I'm happy to report that this Smash has a really engaging solo-player aspect, mainly in the form of the World of Light campaign and spirit board challenges.

While not as good as Brawl's Subspace Emissary in terms of story, it definitely has more interesting content and just lots of content in general. I was bummed when the previous gen of Smash didn't have as robust of a single player experience and non of it had any kind of story, but the World of Light has both.

I also like the classic modes, which is like the original Smash's single player where you fight a series of configured battle based on which character you choose. This one adds more fun to it by basing the fighting conditions throughout each battle on the character as well. For example, Kirby's love of food is reflected through his classic mode by having healing food items available at the start of each battle. This makes each classic mode extremely unique from one another, so you don't get bored redundantly playing similar matches throughout. And it's especially fun if you're familiar with the characters and see the tweaks based around their characters.

So in short, I recommend this game, especially if you're looking for a fun single player experience instead of just a multi-player/online match only game.
titles: Great fun for both single player and multi-player

review_contents: Got this for my super dope 30-year-old brother who wanted this for Xmas. I only had to buy this one thing. And he loved it. It was very unexciting, though. Only one present. It was $60... I'm not gonna get him more than this, you know? But I felt bad, like, sorry you don't have more presents to open, but, I mean... this was expensive. SO I'd recommend this if you like this game (I wouldn't know how the game is, only how it is received as a present/makes 30-year-old Gamer/IT Programmers feel @ Christmas) or if you need to get on the good side of some nerd. Just kidding. Happy Holidays.

No se pod√≠a esperar m√°s de este producto es excelente. Te diviertes bastante gracias a las opciones que presenta la Nintendo switch si tienes 2 pares de controles pueden jugar 4 personas lo que lo hace muy divertido. Una amplia galer√≠a de personajes jugables y aparte una amplia galer√≠a de personajes de apoyo con los que puedes variar tu estrategia. Aparte cuenta con distintos modos de juego que har√°n que disfrutes tanto jugando solo como acompa√±ado....,

Competitively, I was a bit dissapointed that dash dancing is not like Melee's, you can only do short and mostly useless dash dances or full length foxtrots. The game is still infinitely better than trash 4 and has a fairly long single player experience for those than enjoy that aspect. Faster moves with much less lag, more match customization, pretty well balanced characters, promised patches, pretty much anything you could ask for. Right now there irritating glitch (hopefully a glitch) where using the new instant shorthop aerial causes your momentum to shift in the direction of your aerial. Hoping it will be patched but it doesn't really break the game. If you haven't bought this game then what are you waiting for anyways.

Not sure if smash is for me.

I played the GameCube smash years ago and loved it but picked up the Wii U version for my son and played it very little but it was ok.

When my son got a switch for Christmas this was one of the first games he asked for and once we got it, we played heavily for a few days unlocking characters etc.

The gameplay is just so simple I got bored quick and even he at 7 complains that it‚Äôs boring now.

This is the ultimate version of smash with a ton of characters and game modes, unfortunately i just don‚Äôt think I care for the game and would rather play deeper fighters (injustice 2 and street fighter come to mind)
titles: Meh it‚Äôs the best version of smash

review_contents:
Need I really say more for this game? It has an incredible roster of unique and interesting characters (EVERY character every released in any of the previous games plus a few new ones). The adventure mode will keep you busy for a while, excitedly unlocking new characters to play as.

And of course, the multiplayer is fantastic. Great for quick brawls and competitive duels alike. Up to 8 people can play on one Switch console at a time, which is amazing! Honestly, I don't have any complaints against this game except that I need to get better at it, but that's on me.
titles: Best Multiplayer Game for the Switch

review_contents:
This game disgusts me. Nintendo legitimately hates their player base. The "online" in this game is a slap in the face and literally a step backwards in time. I hope you have fond memories of playing online games via Dial-Up. Just kidding, it's worse. Let me explain why...

First, the online performance sucks. You'll lag. You'll cry. You'll keep playing and wonder why.

Second, if you want it to suck just a little bit less--and I do mean just a LITTLE bit less--you have to buy an ADDITIONAL piece of equipment (USB-to-Ethernet adapter). Even then, it still sucks. You'll Google why it still sucks and be told by internet strangers that it's still somehow your fault. Ok. They don't have a problem. It's only you. You should stop using WiFi. You should get better internet. You should move to Japan.

Third, you have to pay for online. That's right. You have to PAY someone MONEY in order to GET the worst online experience in your life. Scratch that; the worst online experience in your LIFETIME. I guarantee you that you have never--nor will you ever--have this bad of a time playing an online game.

I hate my life.
titles: MSN Gaming Zone from the 1990's had less online lag than this piece of garbage

review_contents:
Definitely my favorite Smash Bros entry of the entire series. One could even say it's the "Ultimate" version of the game. It can be played for hours with friends and I've even enjoyed playing on my own, though that isn't quite as fun as playing with a group of friends and family.

I will admit it can be a confusing game to jump right in to if you've never played a Smash Bros game before. However, it can be enjoyed by little kids and adults alike. Make sure to watch the "How to Play" video after the intro to the game to get a basic idea of how the game works. These games have a pretty unique take on the fighting game genre, so I'll leave a basic summary below.

The goal is to knock your opponents off the edge of the screen to reduce their lives. As you hit your opponent their percentage goes up. The higher that percentage is, the farther they will fly away when attacked. When a character is knocked out, they come back at 0% and continue battling until time runs out or they run out of stock/lives.

Each character (there are 74!) has different kinds of moves, strengths, and weaknesses. There are multiple items, modes, and stages/levels in the game. The best way to learn it all is just to play. You'll quickly find characters you enjoy playing as and develop a fighting style that's all your own.

I realize I haven't said much about the game yet, but there is so much going for it that it's hard to pick things out. The music, sheer number of stages and characters, and overall polish to the game is astounding. In terms of changes between previous versions of the game, some of my favorite things are:

1) The physics of the game are the best so far. Its crisp, fast paced, and not as floaty as Brawl. Knocking people away, trying to get back to the stage, and performing combos just feels so fluid.
2) Setting custom rulesets. I have my default 3 stock no items for 1 on 1 or true skill matches. I have a 3 stock all items high and smash meter on for the free for all party play. You can set the rules up whatever way you like and set a preset which makes getting in to play that much faster.
3) Starting with the original 8 characters and unlocking all the new ones is actually really fun for me and never felt like a chore. Anyone complaining about this part must not remember what it was like to get Mewtwo (20 hours of vs matches) or Game and Watch (1000 vs matches) in Melee or Wolf in Brawl (450 matches). In this mode you get the chance to beat and unlock a challenger every 10 minutes of VS play, or even quicker if you reset the switch after every match. You also face a challenger every time you finish classic mode, or throughout the new Spirits mode in World of Light. It really is fun to watch the roster grow, and doesn't really feel all that grindy unless you are in a huge rush to unlock every one. If there is a character you really want, look up the charts that show you who unlocks who in Classic mode and you can have the character you want within 30 minutes easy.
4) Slow-mo on knockout hits, extra damage in 1v1, the overlaid out of bounds box when someone went flying, and the smoke trailing characters matching their color are all huge quality of life improvements.
5) Everything? I could go on and on. I love this game. Within a night of playing it was without a doubt my favorite game of the series.
titles: Amazing Game, Best Smash Bros Yet!

review_contents: This is fun overall but not a five star game by any means. It is more like a 3.5 so I just rounded to 4 but the kids played a good bit the first week then its fun started to fizzle out. In comparison, I bought a few games for a stay-at-home stimulus package. Most of the games cost much less than this one and they are playing two so far. One for one-third the price of this one is being played by everyone for weeks now. Again this is a good game but they wanted more variety it seems.

I've been a Smash fan since N64 and I consider this version just as great as all the others. There's plenty of improvements/changes over the last Smash with everything you love about this game series: all your favorite characters and stages, single player content that is enjoyable in small doses, and it will still be your go-to game for local multiplayer.

As others have already ranted plenty about, the real killer of this game is the online. The "preferred rules" concept is terrible. You frequently can't play the type of stages you want, you can't change characters between battles, etc. etc., but I expect that to improve over time (it already did in the first patch). The real problem with the online... is you.

I'm not a "pro" that participates in tournaments and argues with other "pros" on reddit; I primarily play to have a good time and enjoy 1vs1 Smash 4 "for glory" style battles the most. However, with the introduction of the GSP ranking system, the online community has been reduced to a slop fest of trolls who will do anything they can to win a match.

You're happy that your favorite character Snake is back? When you meet him online, expect to be placed on a BF map with 3 stock and 7 on the clock then be zoned with grenades and other projectiles in an unrefined manner until the clock runs out.
