I'm completely fine with using projectiles; I'm not some elitist who thinks touching the B button for anything other than recovering makes you a noob, but there's a difference between using them effectively and using them to annoy your opponent to death.

No more taunting? Not to worry. Everybody will make sure to skip around throughout the battle and/or frantically run back and forth between kills to assure you that they are superior. I'm not sure if they actually think they're fooling you while you respawn or they are just trying to piss you off, but you didn't see this kind of behavior in Smash 4 nearly as often. A personal favorite of mine are the players who repeatedly do their best hit box dance while waiting for you to attack, resulting in a painfully long and boring match. And that's just it; the online battles are BORING.

Hopefully these people will lose interest after they fill up enough tiles in their Elite screen and go back to Fortnite. I'm certainly getting tired of playing already, ending my morning Smash & coffee sessions questioning myself as to why I'm still playing this game. Maybe I'll go back to Splatoon 2 for a while and wait for the Smash community to improve.

If you're reading this and happen to be one of these players, I hope a dragon with the face of your grandfather and giant ram horns crashes through your roof and psychically forces you to eternally relive the traumatic event(s) from your childhood that caused you to become this type of player. Stay real.
titles: Everything you love about Smash Bros + a horrible online community

review_contents:
So far I am enjoying the game, I have tried a mix of the different modes, including the story mode, regular brawls (up to 8 fighters locally!), online, and the new Mii fighter creation, and have found all of these aspects to be well made so far. The only issue I have is the removal of features such as the target destruction/home run mode and one of my personal favorites, the stage builder. Used to play ridiculous custom stages in Smash Bros. Brawl all the time such as a stage completely enclosed in a box made up of spike floors with only a small hole to launch out of. I hope that Nintendo decides to add this back at some point in the game. I know not everyone used it, but is there really a point in taking out a game feature? I would have even been happy with the exact same builder from the Wii version. If added in a future DLC, I will return to revise this review.

Edit: With the stage builder, I am now 100% satisfied! Updated to 5 stars.
titles: Fun game, missing a few features compared to Brawl, but also has some new stuff

review_contents: It is one of my favorite games ever, I have been waiting for it to come out forever, and now that I have it I"m not disappointed at all. It's everything I wanted + more. For one Ridley is finally a player in smash and he looks perfect! I've had this game for 5 days and have already played for about 24 hours, and thats saying something becauseI usually only play 30 min a day. Basically it is supper fun, It has a great story mode, smash mode, and so much more. Before my brother played it he was like, meh that doesn't sound fun, but then he played it and he said that it was his 2nd or 3rd favorite video game. It is a supper fun family game if you are having a party, or still really fun if you want to play by yourself. I would recommend it for basically everyone (unless you don't do video games) Its a fun game just to pick up and play, but if you are supper competitive it is also really fun. I didn't have any smash games, but then I tried one at my friend's house and it was supper fun, so I was going to get a wii U (that's what he had) but then I realized that Nintendo was coming out with a new smash for the Nintendo switch, so I bought a Nintendo switch and waited for what felt like 10 years but really was only one then I finally got it and so far it is a blast! For anyone who is looking for a fun game for your switch, or a game for someone who has a switch and dose not have this game I would highly recommend Supper smash bros ultimate. I say it is defiantly worth the $ . Reviewed by an 11yr old
titles: BEST GAME EVER Period, no arguing

review_contents:
Si tienes un Nintendo Switch , es un juego que debes de tener junto con Zelda Breath of the Wild, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe y Super Mario Odyssey. Es un excelente juego, la verdad, al ver los videos del gameplay no es lo mismo que jugarlo, es un juego bastante divertido, estrat√©gico adem√°s de que genera muchas horas y diferentes tipos de juego. Quiero agradecer a Amazon, ya que la compra la realic√© digital. En cuanto compr√© el juego, me enviaron el c√≥digo al minuto, di click en el enlace, y autom√°ticamente se empez√≥ a descargar en mi consola. Cuando llegu√© a mi casa ya pod√≠a jugar el juego.

Excelente compra, de lo mejor que he jugado este a√±o Y ES EL MEJOR JUEGO DE PELEAS QUE HA SALIDO HASTA EL MOMENTO.,
titles: EXCELENTE COMPRA. DE LO MEJOR QUE HAY PARA NINTENDO SWITCH

review_contents: My biggest issue with this game is simply keeping up with the characters. The background moves and changes color, the camera moves in and out making the fighters very small at times. It's just impossible to tell where you're at, if you're hitting anyone, or if you're getting hit. Couldn't send back so I put it on ebay.

This game is full of hundreds of hours of play. Although I wish world of light would have had more too it. I also wish that they would have kept hit the targets and homerun contest but you can't get it all. The game is a ton of fun and great with friends. Though the game is only fun when you have a ton of people playing. I also feel that their internet service still needs to be fixed. Way to much lag input problems and my other online games on other consoles do not have this problem. However even with these issues I love this game! Easily one of the best games on the nintendo switch.

This is a great game, with a lot of fun.
But it is not an easy game.

I am pretty good at fighting game, such as KOF and Dragon ball Z fighter. But this game gives me some hard time on the adventure. Any battle that higher than 3 star is really hard and pain.

Again, I am new player to this game. Pretty sure it can get better once I pritice more.

All I am saying is be ready, don‚Äôt expect an easy family game. It is really not that low.
titles: I am a new player, here is what I thought...

review_contents:
I bought this product for my son‚Äôs Christmas present (Christmas 2019) and because he had other games playing with, he just opened the game case this past weekend (April 11th) only to find that the game was not in the case. Maybe this was an oversight but I‚Äôm extremely disappointed as had he opened this at Christmas last year, it would have been disastrous.
Please ensure that this doesn‚Äôt happen to other faithful and loyal Amazon clients or anybody.
Paul Russell.

This game is fun! The adventure is alright but a little long. However, if you like story modes you‚Äôll enjoy it. I‚Äôm just crunching through it so I can get all the characters. This game is slot of fun though! It‚Äôs beautiful and it will being in all the precious super smash bros and adds a few other features that gives you the best of both worlds. If you‚Äôre a fan of super smash you need to get this game! Online play is a fun bonus to when your buddies aren‚Äôt around.

We bought this for our daughters' Christmas last year, and we think they ceased to play all other games momentarily. This game had my girls, aged 11 & 13, playing and giggling together like best friends, which I loved. They spent all their waking, free hours playing it, which I did not love. This game is the reason for our current game time limits, which were not needed before we got this game. I do not know whether that is due more to their ages or this game...judging from the chatter about it with other kids, though, I tend to think it was the game. ;)

This game has the most stages and characters in smash bros. history. A downside is the small amount of new stages. For single player content we have world of light which can give people dozens of hours of fun and classic mode which is the best it's ever been. For multilayer there are welcome new additions like stage morph and the FS meter which makes it more accessible to new customers. And this is a huge video game crossover with so many iconic video game characters and franchises represented here. The music libary is the best smash has ever had with easier ways to your favorites and a huge pool of classic and modern video game tunes. Graphically this game looks much better than smash for Wii u. A consequence of that is that it is easier to lose track of your character. More things that were disappointing is the race to the finish in classic mode and missing several classic modes like break the targets and home run contest. World of light can also be repetitious at times. But overall this is the best smash bros. game with the most content and is the easiest for newcomers to get into. I'm sure the competitive scene will be looked into maybe even more than smash 4 maybe even bigger since this is faster than that game. I would recommend this game to anyone who has a switch or are into nintendo or fighting games.

Has all of the nostalgia of the old game, but with all the new flare!

New characters, moves, and a great story mode.

I like the idea of physical cartridges for if you want to swap games with friends/relatives, and they‚Äôre less storage on your console. The digital downloads are nice too though for if you want to navigate to different games without having to get up and switch out your game.
titles: I will always love Smash Bros

review_contents: First of all let me start off with saying that my switch is a part of the day one releases so this might not apply to newer switches. I got the game on release day and decided to try and play it right away. When I first put it in it asked me to do an update. After the update finished I found myself stuck on the startup screen and can no longer get past this screen and I can't enter safe mode as well. Currently I am trying to wait the battery out and see if that helps at all, and if that doesn't work there is probably nothing else I can do to keep my save data. Currently I only use licensed Nintendo products with my switch and this update that I had to do before I could load the game is the only culprit I can think of.
titles: Warning: The game update Bricked my switch.

review_contents:
This review is focused on online play. As a beginner who has spent countless hours trying to get good at this game, online play is NOT built for beginners. Two critical flaws that need to be addressed:
1) Matching based on rank - every player starts at a high rank and lowers if you lose. I've played at 2.5M rank (hard) and 20K rank (easy) and do not notice any difference in opponents abilities. I play people online and there is a clear distinction between beginner, intermediate, and expert players which is not reflected here.
2) Custom preferences - You can select things like 2 players, no items, certain stages, etc. I find that battles reflect my preferences, at most, 5% of the time. Virtually every match is 4 players, often with items. I don't even know what the point of this feature is because it doesn't do anything.

This game has a long way to go, but it will be great if they focus on the right features.
titles: Online play is garbage, single player okay

review_contents:
Great game! Haven‚Äôt played since N64 edition. Brings back great memories.

FYI N64 controllers can take more abuse. If you are losing Switch controllers can‚Äôt handle throwing. If you flick it. Towards a pillow/couch a few times you are safe. Throw with a floor skip and walk smash not so much.

I am most likely less than 1% of the buy experience, but caution of Super Smash replicas. I had initially thought that it was the actual Super Smash Bros. Ultimate but after further inspection by putting in the switch and the game cartridge itself, it turned out to be fake (I received a $15 game). Everything was imitated with a paper cover and also paper on the game itself. I was actually excited to receive this product (would have gave a 5) but the 1 star is just for my personal experience.

It's Smash that's portable, that includes every character ever included in a Smash game and has good physics (coming from someone who's last Smash was Brawl). The online has a few issues, but I stick to playing with friends in private online matches anyway so I don't really encounter many of those problems.

Been playing Smash since Melee came out and I have to say it's easily the best fighting gaming series out there. The director, Sakurai, never disappoints and I undoubtedly say Ultimate is the best in the series so far. It has almost everything a Smash fan can ask for and plenty to do to keep you busy on the game for hours upon hours. It has the biggest roster to date in the series and they're still adding more and balancing them out. Only thing the game is missing is more cutscenes and character interactions in its story mode and I'm disappointed that Waluigi isn't playable in it (AGAIN) but I'm hopeful Sakurai might troll us all like he always does and make Waluigi the last DLC character. Other than those 2 things, it's a near flawless game. 9/10.

I was able to play for the first time for a couple of days and am having fun with it.

What I liked - Everyone Is Here; the little shooting game at the credits roll; Daisy's inclusion; addition of Spirits
What I will soon like - The DLC characters (I will get them another day)
What I found to be "Meh" - Unlocking fighters. The CPUs are far harder and smarter than ever that it took me two attempts for a few characters (three for Mega Man). Sakurai really wanted the player to earn new fighters, which I respect. That said, I was able to unlock all fighters today.
What I didn't like - World of Light. I did unlock 19 fighters this way (20 if one includes Mii Swordsman) but the very first legend spirit I came across (specifically M. Bison) felt almost impossible so I gave up and would never touch adventure mode again.
titles: I am liking the game thus far.

review_contents: If you never played a smash bros game, this would be the best time to get this game, it has everyone from past smash bros games, with a few new characters and really good amount of stages. I play this game with my 5 year old nephew and he loves it, I just love to sit with him and play for hours unlocking new characters, the memories this game makes in itself is well worth it and something money can't buy.

It's fun and easy to learn. There is a huge roster, and most characters feel unique. I can play this on a 10 minute break, or an evening hosting friends.

It's great that I don't feel like I have to play this connected to the base/TV to really enjoy it like some other games.
titles: A fun game for any situation

review_contents: DOnt really care for all the other characters or online dont even play the switch online any way only one reason why i get super smash bros is my beloved samus aran crazy for her got everthing for switch samus aran skins controller stickers cases posters figures amiibos shirts custom made jackets helmets everything possible did i mention im a really big big big fan of samus aran oh yea i did and yes thats why i buy smash bros only for her and this game playing on tv or car i can go with her every were lol 5 star and got my copy yesterday from amazon thanks

Super smash bros ultimate is one of the best smash bros ive played. I threw two parties this weekend and everybody had tons of fun playing it to where two of my friends are going to buy a switch just for this game. There is a lot of new stuff like characters maps spirits and game modes. A con for former smash bros players is that its going to feel repetitive because at the end of the day you use the same character you always use on your favorite map. But for new people it is a must have.

I've been playing Smash since the first one. I was pretty close to pro level in Brawl (I know it's not great, you don't need to tell me). This one is absolutely incredible. The mechanics have been tweaked enough to differentiate it from Smash 4. The character roster is absolutely insane. WOLF IS BACK!!!! Their are only two negatives here: 1) The mini games (break the targets, board the platforms, home run contest, etc.) are gone 2) World of Light is pretty meh.

This is a must have for any Nintendo Switch owner.

This game is amazing! If you own a switch and enjoy fighting games then you need this one! I consider it to be a must have switch game right alongside breath of the wild, splatoon 2 and Mario odyssey!

I haven't been able to put it down for long since receiving it.

I gifted my daughter Smash Bro‚Äôs as an early Christmas present. We realized our switch was stolen. We held each other and cried.

She lost all her game play in Zelda and I‚Äôm not going to spend Christmas break playing smash bros with my girl.

üò≠.

Even in a year with games such as God of War, Spider-Man, and Read Dead Redemption 2 this was still my most anticipated game of the year. It has met all of my expectations for a Smash game, and I would recommend it to any fan of the series. The game has every character ever in a Smash game, over 100 stages, and also looks beautiful. Smash Ultimate plays a lot faster than Brawl or WiiU/3DS, but not as fast as Melee. It is a great middle ground for fans of the series. The only downside right now is the state of the online infrastructure. Many games can be laggy when playing online, especially in 4 player matches as one player's bad internet connection can hinder the experience for the rest of the players. This, however, has not detracted from my personal enjoyment of the game as I generally play with friends in-person, but if you plan to play online a lot I would keep the current sub-par online experience in mind.

***READ BEFORE JUDGING ME***
Ok The Game is Amazing. The Controls are excelent and feels great and the game is best but the copy i recieved was awful. The game care could not read until I tried reinserting a bunch of times. Then when it did read the game had a corrupt data problem with me having to redownload so many times until finally it worked but I still have to redownload and repeat until the game works. I guess I recieved a ‚Äúbad apple‚Äù copy but this makes me want to go digital.

I bought the console just for this, and it was well worth it. If you have ever played any of the previous titles than this is nostalgia at its finest. If not, then you will see why so many have fallen in love with the series, and a cult following has developed. The best choice characters Nintendo and beyond in an all out war. The perfect fighting game for anyone who doesn't care for the rigid format of traditional fighting games of the day

The game is great and reminds me of previous versions, but it has much better graphics, performance and responsiveness than previous versions. The amount of levels and characters with unique traits and moves is astounding. The music and sound effects are also great and all of the positive attributes of this game make it addicting to play. I will be playing this on the train to work for a long time.

Sakurai is loved for this series. And players should see why once they've experienced the flood of content in this game.

Competitive and DLC packs seem to be where their effort is right now. Online is an improvement, but is still not enjoyable for most people due to input delay.

The CPUs are less BS to fight while also being much more savage with edge guarding and meteors. (Previous CPUs in Smash 4 had perfect responses with inhuman execution allowing for perfect dodges & frame perfect moves to trump player input at the instance)

Just pick this up. You don't need to read reviews for Smash games.
titles: Fantastic game. Worth picking up again.

review_contents:
Been awhile since I played in the Smash series (N64!) but this has some welcome features and room for improvement.

I love how all the series characters are here a long with DLC incoming!
World of Light is a lot of fun overall although very long.
Unlocking characters will probably take me years but each unlock feels earned.

This is a much much better game than smash 4, it‚Äôs almost like melee but more refined. It‚Äôs a faster pace game than brawl was and smash 4. The amount of characters to choose from in this game is one of part of the game and every character seems like reasonably balanced, there are a few exceptions now and there but that‚Äôs to be expected. There is no such thing as perfect, at least in my opinion, but this iteration of smash is as close to it as any of the ones before it.

This game was dope when I was a kid. Now to see my kid playing it with the same excitement I had when I was a kid just takes me back. My son is 6 so I had to show him the ropes by whooping him a few times here and there #nomercy. He got pretty close to beating me one time so I retired as the champ for the last time. He‚Äôs too young to be beating his mom in games. I‚Äôm just saying.
titles: Blast from the past with better graphics!

review_contents:
If you've played a Smash Bros game then you know what to expect. This version has more characters than ever, with all the characters who have ever been playable in Smash coming back. Nearly all the stages are back as well, and tons of music too. Smash Ultimate plays a bit more quick than the 3DS/WiiU versions did, making the game more fast paced in general.

Lots of stuff to unlock, and just so much fun to play with friends. The online component is a bit iffy at times, but it's been improving.

I've always loved playing the Smash Bros series but this game is so much more. I started playing Smash Bros Ultimate as soon as it came in, since then my girlfriend left me (because I forgot I had one), my cat ran out of food and started eating my legs because he thought I had died, and I almost passed out because of a horrible smell in my house but came to realize that that smell was me. On the bright side, I have lost a few pounds because I haven't eaten in over a week now. Please send help!

This game is so fun! My kids love it and have enjoyed playing the game and unlocking more characters. I can also say that it has caused some contention around our household, but the game encourages you to get better. My 5 year old couldn't help but call it Smusher Smash, so that is the name it is know as around our household.

Fun game play and very enjoyable.

What more could be said? It's pretty much the ultimate version of Smash bros. Tons of characters to unlock, an amazing adventure mode featuring spirits we know and love. Plus, classic mode! Do you have what it takes to reach the end?

As for the online some have had good experiences some bad. You know how it goes first few days of a game?

Overall if your looking for a good time with your friends/family nothing beats grabbing the joycons or gamecube controller and having a blast.
titles: Its a matter of fact! Smash is back!!!!

review_contents:
Story mode was a solid 20 hours or so of gameplay and I loved every bit of it. You start out as Kirby and then get to battle and win every character. There are way more than in other games and a lot of fun moves to discover.

A couple of the dungeons were confusing and took a glance on the Google to figure out but eventually got them completed.

Overall one of my favorite switch games and would highly recommend!

I've played every single smash game since the n64. This is the best one yet. It combines the best of Melee, Brawl & Smash for Wii U. The single player mode is amazing on its own. Online is great as long as you have an ethernet adapter and you play with wireless controllers. I actually ended up settling on the Pro Controller which is working well for me, which is surprising because I was certain I would want to use the Gamecube controller & adapter. YMMV. But if you've been on the fence about this, GET THIS GAME.

For those unfamiliar with Smash Bros: This is a fantastic game for people of all ages. You can take control of characters from many of Nintendo's iconic game franchises, such as Super Mario Bros., The Legend of Zelda, Star Fox, Metroid, Donkey Kong Country, Animal Crossing, and more, with some guests from Sega, Capcom, Square Enix, Konami, and even Namco's Pac-Man. This game is designed so you mostly play against each other, but there's nothing wrong with pairing up and facing computer opponents or real people over the internet in team battles. You already have enough controllers for two because of the two Joycons that come with the Nintendo Switch, but for a more comfortable option, there's a full pair of Joycons, the Switch Pro Controller, and the Nintendo Gamecube Controller, but you need the Gamecube Controller Adapter to use those. A Must Have for the system, whether for children or adults.

For Non-Casuals: Fantastic. This game feels incredible. There's a certain swiftness and power in this game that I didn't feel in Smash 4. First of all. Look at the UI. It is streamlined and kind of gives off that competitive feel. Characters KO faster and most, if not all characters that I know of , have kill-confirms, so you have a certified option to defeat your opponent. Online is on the weak side. For me, an ethernet adapter made a difference, but if your opponent has a bad connection, you will. Hopefully, Nintendo will improve the game's netcode. Just get it. It's GREAT.
titles: The Lovechild of Melee and Smash 4.

review_contents: You will start with one fighter, and your goal is to bring balance to light and dark. Along the way you will gain spirits which will give you perks in battle. Having the right spirit in a battle can make a big difference. There can be up to 3 different endings in the game. There is an optional tutorial if you want to take it. This is a rather basic fighting game and is very easy to pick up. I am not a fan of fighting games, and found this game alot of fun.

Amazing game, easily the best of the series thus far. Lots of characters to choose from, with lots of stages to battle on. While it might take a while to unlock all the characters, it was still fun to see who would show up next. The new story mode, while fun, was a little too difficult for me at times, and I went about unlocking characters the old fashioned way. As for controls, the usual Smash rules from Melee onwards are still the norm and as a result the GameCube controller is the best way to play competitively.
titles: Lots of characters, stages and battles to be had.

review_contents:
I used to play this growing up so I got it for my 5 year old. He loves the combination of all the characters in one game. His two favorite types of games would be battling and adventure so this was perfect.

We did have issues figuring out how to make it two player! Felt like that could have been better but other than that no complaints.
titles: Just as good as the original!

review_contents: I don't play video games but this is what my son had been asking for. It was the height of his Christmas gift list! He was very happy with it. My only problem was at first because I don't understand video games I ended up ordering the download instead of the actual game. I had no problem returning it and then was able to order what I needed. It might be good for someone like me to have clarification on what it is

Was expecting something funner TBH. Daughter loves it, but I find the controls to be awkward and the whole experience somewhat frantic. I probably need more practice, but it doesn't help that there was no tutorial for a first timer into the series. Just learn as you button mash...

I did get a laugh out of me and my daughter fighting against a bunch of cpu players though :) nobody knew what the heck was going on most of the time, but it was funny at least.

The game is amazing, from the maps to the vast amount of fighters there is no shortage of content. The graphics are great and the world of light mode is a lot of fun. The game also is given a constant stream of support and events. There are so many small things to appreciate, such as the ability to change the menu music to the N64 version. The multiplayer does need some work in my opinion, but it is still great.

P.S. WHERE IS WALUIGI?!?!
titles: What do you need to say this is the Ultimate Smash!

review_contents:
Over the course of this weekend, I've put an embarrassing number of hours into this game and it really is Ultimate. It's fast and responsive, the new modes and customization options allow for playing just the way you want, the Adventure mode is a pleasant surprise--fun and interesting--and being able to play it on the go is just incredible. Minor elements are missing from previous games, but the really core important things are here and improved upon in every way.

Note: I have heard a lot of negative feedback about the online experience; I personally don't play it so I'm unconcerned and also optimistic that issues will likely improve or be patched over time. Time will tell, but this is not a significant concern for me.
titles: Just a lot of fun for a Smash fan

review_contents: Great for all ages! Packed with nostalgia and good old fashion character vs. character fighting. My boyfriend and I play for hours and when we take it places, it‚Äôs the life of the party. Probably the first game I didn‚Äôt feel guilty paying $70 bucks for. If you‚Äôre a Nintendo fan at all, you‚Äôll be happy you made the investment.
titles: Why haven‚Äôt you bought this yet?!

review_contents: Super Smash brings the whole family together in a knockdown drag out fight & that's even before anyone gets a controller! But seriously this is a great game, had a 30 yr old, 20 yr old, 14 yr old, & a 7 yr old all playing at the same time (all were actively engaged & away from their cellphones). An absolute must if you have a Nintendo Switch!!!
titles: All family squabbles are started & finished here!!!

review_contents: I specifically wanted the physical version of the game and was sure that was what I ordered. After waiting a few days I finally looked up the order to find it is a digital download. I have no idea how to do that and am not interested in learning. I wanted a physical copy!! Now I can't find a way to reverse this process and get the product I ordered. Not happy!

I never played Smash Bros that much before and I decided to pre order this game. However, even if it's very hard there are guides on YouTube and customization with controls for your liking to make it easier to play. I am still struggling to fight against the CPU players. However, for me personally it's a great experience so far. If you look at the game as a whole it was what I actually expected for the price and content. However, if it gets too frustrating to play I might update this review but overall I love playing Smash Ultimate.
titles: Great game but very difficult for beginners.

review_contents: I know some people will disagree that its the best game in the series, but I feel that it is. The adventure mode is alot longer than expected, Spirits is a great way to have interesting battles and finding characters from a wide range of game franchises. The online menu can use a little work, but is playable. I did enjoy that you only start with the original 8 characters from the first game and have to unlock the rest. It gives you a goal.

All I ever wanted out of a Smash game. Beautiful graphics. Strong mechanics. Lots to do. My wife and I are well over 100 hours into this game (most of that was spent brawling it out against each other while earning characters) and we are not even close to burnt out. Worth buying a switch just for this game? Yes. There are plenty of other titles that make the switch worth every penny, but this one is the MOAB of this system. (MOAB- an acronym for the United States military ordinance entitled ‚ÄúMother of all Bombs.‚Äù)

My son is enjoying the game, FWIW. But I hate Nintendo. Why do I have 7 different kinds of accounts, and I could not download this title until I straighted them out. Also, now we need a monthly subscription account to play core elements of the game that I already bought? Thanks Nintendo.
titles: Hate Nintendo, but kids love the game.

review_contents: I'm writing this review on behalf of my teenage son, who ordered this game. When I asked him what he thought of the game, he said," It's a beautiful game." I honestly have never heard that said of a game before and I had to laugh. But he takes his videogaming seriously. He loves this new version of Super Smash Brothers and has even set up a tournament with his friends with a Super Smash Brothers Ultimate game as the prize for the winner.

My son got a Switch Lite for Christmas. We wanted to wait to let him pick out his own game. Forgetting everything is closed on Christmas.ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è But this code showed up minutes after purchase and was WAY cheaper than Nintendo store. Easy to download and works GREAT. He spent 10 hour playing the game had to take it away.

My 8-year-olds requested this game for their birthday. They LOVE this game, however, they request the light stays on at night. Some of the characters are quite scary. Next time I'll stick to the suggested age on the front...My bad.
titles: A bit scary for 8 year olds

review_contents: I‚Äôd probably give this four stars if online was good, but, unfortunately, it is a terrible lagfest without a true 1v1 mode. I dock another star because the game play is a bit too simple. Characters have very little depth and it is difficult to differentiate yourself from other players due to the lack of options.
titles: Pretty fun but online is trash.

review_contents:
Next to BOTW, I think this is next best game in the entire Switch collection.

Spirit mode is a great addition to the game. It takes a while to complete and it's not all that easy. It gets a little repetitive but still good.

The fact that you can also play with up to 8 players on the same console is great. I really value being able to play with your friends in the same room. Most other companies/games force themselves to allow another player besides you in split screen, smh.

Online is really fun and competitive. Although, I don't play it much. There's a lot to be worked on. EXTREMELY laggy at times which makes it a bad experience. When it actually is working, it's pretty fun. With some updates, I'm sure this will be fixed.

Overall a really solid game to play with friends with a lot of things you could do on your own.
Opened my SEALED copy and discovered there was no game cartridge included. Absolutely mental that this is even a possibility. Looking at the reviews, this isn't even that uncommon. Unbelievable.

Still miserably balanced from Wii U, didn't fix anything that needed to be fixed. Adding more characters was the last thing it needed because it's now even worse, trimming the fat and making a better game was the missing improvement and they moved in the opposite direction. Don't commit a lot of time to it.

The release of Joker shows that this is going to be another pay to win game like Smash 4.
titles: Imbalanced mess, pay to win DLC

review_contents: Pre ordered a month in advance, while everyone got to play on opening day I had to wait 5 days later

I love the faster pace of this game and the single player is very addicting. I was slightly disappointed that subspace emissary didn't make a return but world of light is still great. I am surprised by how addicting it is to collect spirits and create op combos and teams. It is very satisfying to beat a legendary spirit and i like the new classic mode (although i do wish there was a way to randomize who you are going to face and a different bonus stage would've been much appreciated. The online is still a little laggy but its miles ahead of what it used to be and is actually quite playable. Lack of dedicated party system is disappointing but not unexpected from Nintendo since they always seem to lag behind their competitors in terms of multiplayer. Overall this is a great game and the best smash game since melee.
titles: Best mechanics since melee coupled with the best singleplayer since brawl

review_contents: Changed to one star. Game gets stale fast so your only resort is online play which is terrible. I honestly wish I could get my money back. Game is a terrible mess of people spamming one move without consequence. No skill or thought. Waste of money.
titles: Cash grab of an excellent series

review_contents: Not even the pro controller will make you feel like you're in control. It feels mushy like playing on the Wii, this must be why Nintendo is pushing the game cube controllers.

From the little bit that I've played, it's been amazing. The mechanics are good, the different characters that I have played are very different from each other. Even characters that are similar to each other each have their own differences in terms of moves and stats. It's very impressive. There is a single player campaign, but it isn't necessary to play to have a great experience.

My favorite Smash Bros game was from the Nintendo 64. I feel that this version is very well done. Some people feel that the card system associated with the single player mode is a little silly, but I feel that it adds a different spin on the regular game. I recommend this game for fans of the Smash Bros games.

Most of the time online works reasonably well, then sometimes it will be an absolute slideshow. There is no reason whatsoever for the game to not judge somebody's connection speed and discourage them from playing if their connection is bad. There is no reason for matchmaking to force two players into a game if their connection to the other is abysmal.

Way too much happening on the screen at one time. A real cluster, if you catch my drift. Seems harder than the originals. Lots of characters and levels. Its all just too much for my mind to handle anymore I suppose.

Not a review of the game itself.

Bought a new sealed copy of the game and there was no game cartridge when I opened it. Looked all around me to see if I accidentally dropped it somehow, but nope. No cartridge and no booklet (if it even came with one). Also tried to look for a download code but there was nothing of the sort. Thats about $50 that I spent on literally nothing.

The story mode doesn‚Äôt beat SSBB and it should have multiplayer mode for story mode (spirits) but the majority of smash bros is regular brawls with friends and this game feels so much more polished and smoother than the older games. More balanced too besides the DLC characters and lil Mac
I didn‚Äôt get the code yet why is that i bought this since September
titles: I didn‚Äôt get my code and the game was released at 12 am

review_contents: With so many characters to choose from you really can't ever go wrong love the fact that there is many different game modes so there's always something to do and the fact that it also has online play if you have the Nintendo switch online I can't really say anything bad about this game it is a must-have for families as a person that played the original N64 love it
titles: It's a must have to families

review_contents: I bought this for my brother for Christmas, it came factory sealed, but when he opened it on Christmas it was EMPTY. The game card was not in the factory sealed box... It was a MAJOR let down..
Helped my two bored kids from this stay at home restriction, now they play this game like there‚Äôs no tomorrow!
titles: Kept my college and teenager girls from boredom ...

review_contents: Definitely one of my favorite Switch games! Co-Op in Battle Arena needs to included in an update because playing co-op online shouldn't just be obligated to Quick Plays. There was co-op online against other friends in Brawl and Wii U/3DS, so there should be no reason to exclude it in Ultimate. I hope to see it included very soon (yes Nintendo, I'm implying that you're going to do this or keep getting fan complaints to where you'll be forced to). Other than that and the online matchmaking itself, playing locally is great and the World of Light adventure mode is pretty cool!
titles: Great Smash Bros. game! Just needs to add/update certain things.

review_contents: What can I say that hasn't already been said? This game is absolutely gorgeous, it's a ton of fun to play and it runs as smooth as butter. So much love and care was put into this Smash. Mr. Sakurai, thanks a million! Now go take a break! You deserve it!!
Received our code in minutes and my grandson was having a blast! A great way to give a gift when you live far away.
titles: A quick way to gift a game

review_contents:
It's the next Smash Bros. game. It's beautiful and amazing and very well done. Creating rules and picking stages becomes 10x easier. A new adventure mode has been introduced. All around an amazing game!

Online though is currently in a bad place. There is no standard ruleset anymore. If you are trying to play online in a competitive sense, you may as well give up. You have a *PREFERRED RULESET*. This means that the game will attempt to match you up with players with a similar ruleset. So if you wanted to do a 1v1 with 3 stocks, no items, and on battlefield then you would put that in your preferred ruleset. However you could be placed in a FFA, items, and 5 stocks, 2 minute time limit. Here's hoping online changes!
titles: Online stinks at the moment. But an amazing improvement!

review_contents: Best Smash game to date with: tons of music, characters, and stages. The core gameplay is improved. It's an awesome party game. Story mode and single player content is a step down from Brawl but a step up from Smash 4. Online is not that great though.
titles: Step up from Smash4 but step down from Brawl

review_contents: I've played all past variations of Smash Bros, well into the late night, for many many hours. This one is by far my favorite. Plus, if you don't know how to play, you can make it crazy enough that your chances of winning are still very good! We've had my kids and all their friends all playing and laughing and having a great time many times. Just a great game all around!
titles: Greatest iteration of smash bros to date

review_contents: So much fun! My kiddos have played this with their friend, so when they got their own switch I had to buy it. They love all the characters. I now have to set time limits because they will play all day.

The game is great and was delivered quickly. However, I purchased this particular listing because it came with a $10 reward for later use, and it still hasn‚Äôt been credited to my account. I can‚Äôt even look at the details of the credit, because they‚Äôre not showing on the listing anymore, which is frustrating to say the least.
titles: Game is perfect, but rewards missing

review_contents: Loving it so far! Like many others, my only complaint is the inability to play an online co-op game with our friends/family. The max online players per console in a custom arena is 1. The only way you can play up to 2 is via the co-op mode in Quick Play, but it‚Äôs a random match-up. It‚Äôs a big bummer for us because we have family out of state that we would love to play 2 on 2 with.
titles: Great game but limited online options...

review_contents: The Mario brothers have finally released a smash hit squequal to the hit Wii game brawl. I was excommunicated by the melee and smash 4 community years ago, so it will be nice being back in a thriving community. I lost a lot or friends fighting over the validity of the tripping mechanic. My "pal" Rico Elroy routinely would humiliate me in front of my long time ex-flame Jenifer Wu (gamertag: Frostedk1tten). Needless to say I will be looking forward to using the piranha plant (my main) to crush Ricos stupid guy. I hate Rice. I mean Rico. Sorry autocorrect... dont get me started.
titles: Great new game alternative to brawl.

review_contents: My 9 year old son wanted this game for his birthday. He loves it, so does my 12 year old son.
Fun fighting game. You can play against the computer, friends and family, or online. Great fun

Of course the gameplay is addicting and the fighting system is geniously deep yet simple at the same time Etc etc, but my problem is the online is absolutely trash. Do not go in expecting it to work honestly. But other than that, this really is one for the history books.
titles: Online mode is lacking, to put it politely

review_contents: Such a fun game! Best mode is the Smash mode with multiple players in your party, but if you're playing alone the story mode and challenges will keep you entertained for hours on end. Sometimes there is nothing like the original, but the progression of the smash franchise is one of the best I've seen. 5 stars no doubt

We are college boys. 10 in the house. Epic gaming nights. Who needs girls when you have Super Smash Brothers? We are obviously too smart to have to study. (Mom wrote this about these handsome, smart, dorks who act like puppies. They LOVE this game)

The best Switch game to date, blows Mario and Zelda out of the water. Everything is tightened up in the latest entry all around. World of light has some fun aspects although it carries on far too long than it should. Roster is to the best it has ever been and probably will be, m especially with upcoming Dlc. One of those games that will forever be enjoyable.
Don‚Äôt buy this unless you want hours wasted playing a video game. Seriously I swear time doesn‚Äôt exist to anyone playing this game.
Want to play against your friends in a fun and thrilling way that losses your concept of time? This is definitely the game for you!
titles: A great game to play with friends!

review_contents: So happy we could order this digitally! All we had to do was log into the Nintendo account and it automatically showed up on the Switch!

I ordered this by mistake and am horrified that there is no return or cancellation on this game. I am a 76 year old grandma and did not know this was a digital download. I think allowances should be made!!

There are so many characters in this game. And the variety of the inkling costumes alone are worth the money. But mostly, this is smash brothers, it doesn't matter if this game is good or bad, people will buy it. There's like a million characters in this game. How can you not like this game? Well it isn't as good as melee but way way way better than Smash 64 and all the other smash games.
Where is Waluigi? Not in this game, skip. One star!
Bright, colorful and full of excitement. It's a good buy and i have to admit, I play it too.

The gameplay is fantastic. Fighting is fast and fluid. Each fighter is fun to play, if only for their awesome animations. The graphics are colorful and fun. The amount of quality content is astounding right out of the box. Every character has 8 costumes. Each mode provides hours of entertainment.
The only problem is the online multiplayer. It is lag city if you play at peak times like weekend evenings. This isn't minor lag; gameplay will simply stop for a few seconds regularly. It's alright if you play on a weekday morning, but I should be able to play an online match without mega lag in this day and age.
Beside that caveat, this is the game of the year no question.
My Grandson loves it, was so excited on Christmas Eve. Didn‚Äôt even want to finish opening his gifts.

Game is amazing. Just like I remember it.

Pros: game is awesome
Cons: only con is if you don't have the game it sucks to be you lol

Best, most playability of any switch game so far in my opinion. Controls are easy and smooth. Having to play to get all the characters (while sometimes frustrating when u don‚Äôt beat them and have to randomly wait to fight them again) makes u want to play it more to have them all. Lots of different modes to play.

Some people are trashing this game...they must stink at it ü§£

This game showed up two days before the Nintendo Switch console. I was worried when I ordered it that the console would show up and my son wouldn't have any games to play. It worked out great. I got a good price and didn't have to leave the house.

I assume if you're reading a review on this game it is because you don't play games and were looking to get this as a gift for someone else.
Do they have a switch? If yes, then make sure they don't already have this as almost every switch owner has it. If the answer was no, then go be that cool friend or family member that brings them a game that will occupy hundreds and thousands of hours of their time. Also you should play with them so you aren't reading amazon reviews on Nintendo games in the future.

I bought a switch just to play this game and boy was it worth it. The game is amazing and packed with so much content. The music, the characters, the collectibles, the gameplay. I've never had so much fun playing with siblings! I've played for so many hours already and have hardly even scratched the surface. It's a GOTY kind of game and if you're into Nintendo franchises then this game won't disappoint. Btw it's a fighting game lol the best fighting game ever imo considering how many things you can do.

if you ever play smash before, this game is another game to have. its great fun and haves over 70 characters to play. best of call 8 players can play on the same T.V. another good thing they added to this game is a real story line. holy that's really fun. i would recommend this game to anyone who has a switch its a must have for that console

Best one to date, characters are better balanced this time around and the complete roster is present. Single player seems like a bit of wasted potential but it‚Äôs a fun diversion from the multiplayer. Couch co-op and vs. are of course still the best. Because nothing beats smashing your real brothers in a round of smash bros.

Every Switch needs this. Good for group gaming, parties, kids, etc. Honestly would be weird if you has a Switch and didn‚Äôt own this game.

Compared to previous versions, this has many more characters, no story mode, and a much better online play. Online is cheap.
titles: Must-have if you own a switch

review_contents: This game is absolutely awesome. It has an awesome learning curve that makes the game challenging. There are a couple of things here and there that can get frustrating, but overall it's an awesome game.

This game is amazing! I rate it 4 stars because unlocking characters was way way too hard at first and then unlocking them later just felt like I was rewarded them for trying. All around though, this is a really fun game to play, especially with friends and/or family. My wife and I had a lot of fun playing this for about a month. Now it just sits there collecting dust. To be fair, that‚Äôs just about any game though.
titles: One of the best Nintendo Switch games!

review_contents: Son loves this game and he has a bunch of Amiibo‚Äôs that he uses with it.

What more do you need to know. Its freaking Smash. All the original characters, almost all of the original stages(with the exception of PokeFloats) So much music to customize the stages with and did I mention over 70 characters?! 70. Holy crap.
It's Super Smash Brothers, just buy it.

Throw in a pizza a couple of friends, maybe a few drinks and you got yourself a good time.

This game is capable of teaching healthy competition, and teamwork. Some of the modes has a good element of moving more then just your thumbs. Which makes it nice for my moms shoulder recovery as well.
it's fun, but for 60 bucks I would expect free DLCs
titles: would give it 5 star if it was like 40 bucks

review_contents: By the time Christmas morning brunch was finished, all of the men, and my grandson, disappeared...they were all downstairs playing this game (which I don't understand, but then I'm not a pre-adolescent boy, or a dad or uncle!

You cant go wrong with Smash Bros. The newest game is another great iteration of a great series. The normal campaign as well as World Of Light are really fun and will offer hours and hours of play time. Multiplayer is what really matters though. This is a super fun game to play over and over with your friends!
Was my son's favorite game until he got into Fortnite

My 8 year old got this for Christmas and both him and my boyfriend are obsessed with it. They have competitions to see who is better.
Both of my brothers really want to try this out also, but whenever they come over the Switch is dead because my son overplays this game.

What can you say about Smash Bros That hasn't been said already.
Great game, Nice Roster of characters to play as.
What i like most about it is you gradually unlock all 72 Characters as you progress, I have heard some complaints about this, but it doesn't feel tedious at all, new challengers are popping up every 2-3 rounds, and adds to the replay of it. Overall i love it.
titles: As advertised, shipping was on time

review_contents: The best Super Smash Bros. I've ever played. Tons of characters, cool stages, and the Adventure Mode adds a fair amount of playing time to it. It's even more fun with other people. I'm not a competitive player by any means, but it's great having a beat 'em up game that you can dive into quickly once you pick up the controller. Definitely worth the money!
titles: A must-have game for the Switch

review_contents: If you are looking for a solid game that will appeal to young and old, this is it. If you are looking for a game with replay value, this it. If you are looking for game for your Nintendo Switch, this is it. A great continuation of a great game series. I bought this first day it was out. Fantastic.
titles: Great game with lots of added value.

review_contents:
Purchased this for my son for Christmas. It is literally the most played game in the house right now. He and his friends love the game. The mark of a good game is one that can be enjoyed over and over again by many different people. Everyone enjoys playing this game.

Recommended Product.

This is the best group game you could possibly buy. Anyone and everyone knows smash, and with this iteration it looks to be more balanced while expanding the roster and maintaining the easy to learn, difficult to master aspects of the game. Great game and I'm excited for the DLC characters in the future!

Our sons have put in HOURS of time into this game already. The only issue (coming for a 33y/o) is that everything opens to easy... some of the challenge is gone; however this appears to be common in newer games (Mario kart 8). But there is still much enjoyment being had so it‚Äôs still worth it!

I love smash, but seriously. Watch the Game theorists Matt Pat. Or as i like to call him Fatty mcpattyface. To get a good insight of the emotional battle the creator is going through. Nintendo needs change & so does Japan. They ask so much of him, & Japan government is oppressive in its ideology of work ethic.
titles: Amazing game, but holy cows the meaning behind the story mode is deep

review_contents:
Outside of battling my friends when they come over this game did not have a lot of replay ability.

I beat the game in a week or two then went on to other games. Great game but probably not worth $60 or more. Would have been an excellent pickup for $25-30
titles: Not a ton of replay ability

review_contents: I ordered this before it came out and received it the day after it was released. I gave it to my nine year old as an early Christmas present and he loves it!! My boys age 9 and age 5 have been playing this game and not any other. I believe the updated version has more characters and things to do! Would highly recommend.

Love this game there are so many characters that it is hard to pick my favorite because this game has the most characters I have ever seen in a game before it is Nintendo's kid friendly version of Mortal Combat that is how I see it.
titles: Best Nintendo Fighting game out so far.

review_contents: this and Mario Kart 8 are the reasons i bought my switch. I love this game since my first exposure on N64. there are a lot more things to do and the story is good, good and easy time dump. 15.7GB download BTW without DLC
titles: I love this game and i am very happy i bough it.

review_contents: You know how good smash is. You know you want to get it. If your a parent thinking about getting this for your kid, do it. Then get another one, for you. Then get one more, also for you, because your an adult and you get to decide what that means. I'm an adult and I decided that that ment I played smash. I do not regret this decision.
It's smash Bros. If you liked smash Bros on the n64 when you were 12, you'll probably like this just as much even though you're 30. 4 stars because I'm 30 and still playing Smash Bros.

Fun maps, awesome roster of characters and skills. My 12 yr old LOVES it! Lots of great nostalgia hits for the older crowd too.There's a ridiculous amount of content! The local multi player is super fun and very refined.
Only con I have come across yet is that the Spirits thing is kinda confusing....
titles: Super fun game for the kids and the adults!

review_contents: This game is incredible in every way. It is well-balanced between characters. There is no way I can possibly describe just how well the developers did in creating this game. It is probably as near to perfect as a game could ever be.
titles: Perhaps my Favorite Game of All Time

review_contents: This game is very fun and I have to admit I've been playing it nonstop since release day. My only complaint is that the online play is laggy. This is disappointing because it was a problem in Smash Bros For Wii U and it still hasn't been fixed. I expected a smoother experience considering that it is a paid service now.
titles: Great Game Overall But Online is Inconsistent

review_contents: If you love any smash game, you'll love Smash Brother's Ultimate. The pacing of this game makes it feel incredibly fun whether you're playing for competition or just casual fun with friends. This game is AMAZING. Join the community and play with us!

I had high hopes when I made my pre-order, and they were all surpassed. The game has so much content I don't think I'll ever really finish it, and the game looks, plays, and sounds incredible. I highly recommend this game to any Nintendo fan, as it includes essentialy every character from your childhood in one form or another. Eve characters that aren't playable have key roles in the adventure mode, and fans of the Smash Bros. series will thoroughly enjoy all the mechanical changes made to this edition of the franchise. 10/10.

Delivery was prompt and made the day of release.

This was a very wonderful surprise for my daughter who has been wanting this game for a while. It lives up to the picture and wasn‚Äôt a scam. It was never used and in very good quality when we received it. I really appreciate this product and would recommend for a gift for your child.
There is not one thing about this game that I am disappointed with. I can't think of even one complaint. My favorite Smash Bros was Melee and this was the best upgrade I could've ever dreamed of.

This is an exceptional game, filled with incredible attention to detail and over 70 playable characters from which to choose! There is an extensive single-player story mode and a "Classic Mode" that can be single or co-op. Lots of things to collect, and lots of replay value.

The online seems to have lag issues, but local play is very fun. If you have friends but only one Switch, the Joycons can be turned sideways to act as 2 separate controllers, which is a great quality-of-life feature.

Would definitely recommend, highly recommend if you have friends to play with you in local matches.
titles: Fun for newcomers, amazing for returning players!

review_contents: good game online kinda sucks some times but just sometimes

I'm really liking the attention to detail and just the amount of content Nintendo put into this game. Every time I think I've finished World of Light, another part opens up. After completion, I've put almost 45 hours into it. Outside of a strong single player, this game has the classic multiplayer that really makes it one of the franchise bests.
titles: My favorite Super Smash Brothers yet.

review_contents: The game was very repetitive and restrictive, hardly any story unlike smash bros melee. Overall was disappointed, and the stages are largely the same. Zelda and Sheik are now 2 separate characters, which is a bummer. Most of the new characters have awkward fighting styles, so they go unused. Would not buy again.
There's not really much to say about this. My son likes the game. It's easy to pick up and play for few minutes.

My wife and I play this quite often and enjoy it. We do strain our friendships with friends on this due to fierce competition and backstabbing, but this is a great way to settle debates. The choice of characters and maps are huge, and we have yet to get bored of this game.
titles: Ruining friendships since the inception of this game

review_contents: Great local multiplayer. Has so much content and fan service for the price. I love this series, and this is my second favorite thus far, after melee. Only downside would be the online multiplayer, but that can be overlooked in my opinion.

Well, what can i say.... My 12-year-old kid saw this game on another's kid Nintendo Switch and asked me to get one for him.
Despite having XBOX and PC with many famous videogames, he loves playing Super Smash Bros.
Excellent gameplay and graphics.
titles: My 12 year old likes it a lot!

review_contents: I have been waiting for this game to come out since they announced the release of the Nintendo Switch. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this game and I cannot wait to play this with a full group of people!

The game itself is a great party game with an average single-player experience which is second only to Brawl's Subspace Emissary in personal opinion. The selection of characters is the best in the series and is only improving with time. If you have friends over often and need a party game, this is a must have.
titles: Great party game, so-so single-player game

review_contents: Multi-player online is unplayable because it uses p2p instead of dedicated servers. No plans to fix this, everyone accepts this issue and still gives the game 5 stars. Don't advertise online multi-player if there isn't a playable online multi-player.

With excellent multiplayer as well as decent single-player gameplay, Smash Ultimate is a game that just about every Switch owner should own. It IS rather fast-paced, so if you're not into that sort of thing then you should probably give this a miss - but otherwise, go ahead and get it. And have fun!
titles: If you have a Switch, you need this game

review_contents: It was a gift but my partner cannot get enough of it. Buy it only if you don‚Äôt mind how addictive and fun it is, specially if you play online. Actually, if you don‚Äôt like playing online forget about it, this is all about fighting the unknown.

The best Switch game to date. The best Smash Bothers game to date.

The adventure mode is the weakest part. It‚Äôs enjoyable, but not very challenging.

I strongly recommend dedicated GameCube style controllers even though this greatly increases the cost of playing.
titles: The best Switch game to date. The best Smash Bothers game to date.

review_contents: While online hasn't been perfect for me, everything else has been so good and online is better now that I put the rules off. I've unlocked all characters and I love trying all of them out online and can't wait to keep unlocking them in world of light. Best game I've played in a long time.

I was a little bit worried in the days leading up to Smash Ultimate's release. Now that I've played the game and unlocked every character, I can say without hesitation that this is the definitive Super Smash Bros experience, and to have it on the Nintendo Switch is another bonus. The game is packed with so much content and detail that I really felt as though I got more than my money's worth. If you have a Switch, this is a must-own, and if you haven't, buy one to play this game because it is more than worth it!
titles: The most complete Smash game EVER!

review_contents: Super Smash Bros Ultimate Is So Much Fun and Addicted It Awesome. üëåüòéüëçüôÇ

This game was so worth the wait. The new Spirit board was a great addition and keeps me coming back even a month after launch. Unlocking all the characters was a blast.The details in the graphics are amazing! You can see the hair on some of the Pok√©mon. This is a must have for anyone with a Nintendo Switch.

This game is a must have if you own a Nintendo switch. I have spent countless hours with this game and still haven't unlocked all the content. Every time I get a new unlock-able character I spend even more hours trying to master it! This game is refreshing in a time of paid DLC and micro transactions! thank you Nintendo!
Me and a buddy have been going ham on this game. Won't make this reviw too long because I have more characters I need to unlock. See you all in a couple months I guess ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø
With all the characters returning plus plenty of new ones, this is the definitive version of smash bro‚Äôs and a must play for anyone with a switch.
titles: This really is the ultimate version of Smash

review_contents: This game is great for a group, adults and kids. The youngest in the group might get frustrated by getting beat by the better gamers, but they love seeing the new characters get unlocked.

I got this game because of a suggestion by a friend and I am so happy I did! My son loves it!! I do not have to worry about him getting bored with this game! He stays on for hours at a time! I recommend it!!
titles: Keeps My Son Busy For Hours!!!!!!!

review_contents: This is the best smash game just because online isn‚Äôt as good of a system as the previous game doesn‚Äôt mean we can‚Äôt appreciate the new features this game has to offer such as world of light, spirts, with a roster of at least 80 characters confirmed

This game is the modern version of Melee. Wii u version was fun, but this one adds an extra layer of technical skill (ie. new perfect shield mechanic). Characters feel faster and more aggressive. Havent bothered to start up the story mode but personally dont care much about that. I came here for no nonsense SMASH and that‚Äôs exactly what I got.

Love this game! Been playing for 50+ hrs and I've barely scratched the surface of all the content available (also haven't gotten into the expansion packs/DLC either, but that's another large amount of content). This is definitely an "Ultimate" version of the Smash Bros game!

What can be said about this game? I played Smash on every console it came out on and this is probably the best one. It has a type of story mode that's neat. You can unlock characters as you fight in the game (for free!) Take not EA, this is how you do a game.
titles: Very nice game with no needed micro transactions

review_contents: We have been playing smash for years and it still holds up. Good entry-level fighting game with enough challenges for more advanced gamers. Just all around fun.
Online in this game is worse then a bad joke. Lag is insane, "preferred" rules don't work. Nintendo deserves no more money till they make an online game worthy on 2012.

This game does not disappoint. The regular smash mode is fantastic and brings a lot of action. The story mode with the spirits has a lot going for it. It allows you to gain a sense of accomplishment when you beat it, but if you try to 100% the thing some of the area's might be counted as complete when they are not. Nintendo brought back a lot of the Classic modes that were in previous games. I haven't really played anything else on my switch since this game came out. Some of the new items are great and there is a lot of customization to how you set up your smash games that are good for playing with your friends.

As someone who loves party games and fighting games, this game is such a great combo! I always get the newest fighting games, Smash Bros. included, so this was a must-buy. This is by far the best addition to the series I have ever played, with over 70 characters to choose from. Whether you want to play an engrossing single player campaign mode or play 8 player matches with some friends over some drinks and food, this game will meet all of your needs. Recommending this to everyone who owns a Switch!!
titles: Great Party Game to Share With Friends!

review_contents: Nintendo impresses yet again with their latest Smash entry. The combat has never been more refined as it is here. Melee veterans will feel right at home as it offers fast paced gameplay, and newcomers will be able to learn quickly. The amount of content in the game is astounding, and a massive open world map for its story will give players something to do for quite a while. The massive roster is welcomed, and the player will constantly feel rewarded by consistently unlocking new characters. An excellent addition to the Smash franchise, Super Smash Bros: Ultimate serves as the perfect swan song of this long running fighting series.

Never played smash on the Gamecube or any other platform but everyone was clamoring about it so I just had to try it out. I can easily say that it's much more fun to play this game with other people. The controls and moves take a little getting used to but once you get a hang of it, you'll really start to enjoy it especially when you take turns destroying your friends. No doubt, this release does not disappoint, just prepare yourself because it does have a slight learning curve if you've never played smash before.
titles: Enjoyable for a first-time Smash player

review_contents: I've enjoyed this game more than the 3DS Smash Bros, and almost as much as Brawl...but while it doesn't have an incredible story mode like Brawl, it does have an "Adventure mode" that pays homage to hundreds (?) of classic Nintendo, Sega, Capcom, and Konami characters that more than makes up for it. There are SO many characters in this game, SO many stages...if you're a fan of Smash Bros, it's impossible to get bored with this game quickly.
titles: This is the definitive Smash Brothers game

review_contents: Was a fan of super smash since Nintendo 64 and still a fan now. The controls and mechanics have changed since then but that means I'm not as good as I was before. It's excellent nonetheless and especially with a storymode. That sucked up a lot of my time personally. 5/5
The character selection is amazing. The game looks and plays great. I'd say this is definitely the best Smash Bros since melee for Gamecube. Bravo Nintendo!

I LOVE this game! I put over 26 hours into it the first weekend to beat every stage in world of light, unlock all the characters and some extras. So if i had to say a negative, the online only allows 1 person on each console. Was hoping for 2 on 2 with a friend.

They love this game! My sons actually played it together without threatening bodily harm on each other. I felt like the best parent ever. They sang my praises too. I think they want another game now.... 5 stars on this one :)
titles: Be the best parent ever! Buy this for your kids!

review_contents: THE BEST installment as of yet to the super smash bros. Series. If you like smash, you'll like this. So clean cut, good little story mode, all the classic characters you love and new ones that are even still being released after the game is out. Gotta love it.
titles: Best in the series so far

review_contents: Fast fluid fun. It plays great and looks great. It's my first time smashing and so far is everything I hoped it would be. I now see why there was so much hype.
titles: Smashing has never been so much fun.

review_contents: I bought this because it's Smash Brothers, and Smash Brothers is the not-fighting game that everyone loves. I'd say that for fans of Smash, this is probably the most consistent and enjoyable title in the series thus far. It's definitely got a few attractive features for return veterans to Smash, but the new additions to the game and to the gameplay will appeal to new customers.
I haven't had much time to play this game but so far it's fun and enjoying it. I didn't give it 5 stars because I haven't had much time to play it.
Tedious and boring trying to unlock all the characters. And Nintendo trying to push micro transactions is personally disgusting. Pay 60$ for a game that will resell for 5$ at GameStop.

‚Ä¢ It is such a great game for kids and adults. Its winter time and I wanted a game for me and my 6 year old son to play. We both have fun playing this game and the graphics are amazing. We have had the game for a month now and it‚Äôs still really fun for us to play.

My 27 year old son loves this game. I bought it for him for Christmas. He was so excited and couldn‚Äôt wait. He played it before Christmas. He wrapped it back up and put it under the christmas tree. He said that he would recommend it for hours of fun.

EVERYONE IS HERE! The latest series of smash bros hits it out of the park by including every past character. This is probably the best smash game since melee, but it still doesn't stand up to it in my mind.
titles: Still doesn't match N64 and Melee

review_contents: This game is like nectar from the gods.

This isn't the game for someone who enjoys classic fighting games like Mortal Kombat and Street Fighter. I classify this as a button smasher and feel most reviews of this game are highly overrated, or were posted by gamers with limited experience.
titles: Button Smasher - Not my kind of game

review_contents: Simply great!

This game was much better than the crappy predecessor. I played this with my brother while were were still in school. We would spend hours on this after classes. However, after graduation, we hardly even touch the game as it gets really old after a while.

I got this for my Nieces and Nephews for Christmas. (Ages 3 - 12 )They have called me 4 times since then telling me how cool it is. The game didn't seem like much to me but they absolutely love it. Sorry bro.... Score one for the cool uncle.
It's all it's good game love the characters is that it has too much having to buy this and by that after I just spent 60 on the game.
Package was sealed and once opened it was empty. I was In shock but if you look at the 1 star reviews there‚Äôs over 50 complains about the same . Smh I got a refund at least but wow

I bought my switch for a variety of reasons but the boyfriend really wanted this. He uses my switch more than I do. With all the characters to unlock and all the extras, Nintendo delivered on a full game that really needs no add-ons. So the DLC coming out is really a big plus since the game feels complete already and that is how DLC should be done.
titles: This was the game he wanted!

review_contents: There is so much content in this game it's impossible to get bored! It is a great game especially for multiple players! I wish I could find even more fun games that would allow 4 or more players like this!

This game is awesome! I normally don't play Smash Bros. for several reasons, the main is not really being a complete adventure like the Legend of Zelda, but this one is definately one of the best ones. I love how they brought back everything that they ever had in this one. I would have liked to turn off characters that I think are dumb but whatever, it is still a fun game

Do not buy this if you want to ever speak to your kids again. Downloaded this game for my kids for their switch after Christmas, I haven‚Äôt seen them for over a month. Good game, one of the top two switch games. Digital downloads stay on the device, make sure you get a decent SD card.
titles: Do not buy this if you want to ever speak to your kids again.

review_contents: This is THE game to get. Everyone is brought together for one purpose: to kick the other person's SMASH! Lots of characters, lots of maps, still great fun even after all the remakes.
titles: Must have for any switch gamers.

review_contents: This game is a great addition to the Super Smash Bros franchise. All characters are able to be unlocked and the developers paid much attention to detail. Would recommend.

This was purchased for my 9 year old. However, his two older brothers (16 & 24) enjoyed it also. They enjoyed the fact scenes from a variety of older games were incorporated. It‚Äôs rare but nice to find something they all enjoy together.
I'm excited to get to play this again after not having played it since High School of 2001 - 2005 really miss me and my old friends up all night parties with it.

My children thoroughly enjoy playing this game! I was informed that everyone who has a switch owns this game and it was about time that I bought it for my children. They actually smiled at me! Thanks Nintendo.

I like this game so much, it has every character ever! I like the music in the game, I even listen to the music when when I take my Nintendo Switch with me.
This game is perfect for playing multiplayer mode.
This game is awesome!

Haha I bought it for my boyfriend and he definitely loves it. He bought the newly launched switch two months ago and he loves to play Smash Bro. However I got dizzy watching him play it on TV. Only if I am not dizzy, I love to play!
This game is a must have for the Switch! Hours worth of enjoyment for both single and multiplayer games!

We purchased this on Amazon to get a free $10 rebate card on the site, and it is a great game! One of our favorites. For something we were already planning on purchasing, the $10 back was a nice plus. Thanks Amazon!

The kids were waiting to get this game and they love it. They have us parents playing too. I like how
we can change the characters‚Äô clothes and hair colors. And the different arenas that are offered for the characters to play in.

Best Smash ever. 74 characters, over 100 stages, over 900 songs, 60 fps, and a good single player with amazing multiplayer.

Only con is playing against people using WiFi is still kinda laggy. Use the Ethernet adapters, everyone!!!
titles: Best Smash, Best game last decade.

review_contents:
I haven't played a Smash game since Melee, and I really enjoy this game. I spent a ton of time in adventure mode and had a lot of fun.

The online mode still needs some work in my opinion as it's been fairly laggy for me.
this is my first smash game I actually spent more than 1 hour playing but the only other smash game I played was on N64 I do recommend this game to any switch owner or anyone getting a switch.
titles: not really good at the game but still fun

review_contents: I have always played the super smash bros series since the N64. This is a great addition and will continue to play it.
Got this for my kids on the switch. They love this game. You don‚Äôt need an internet connection either. That‚Äôs the best part.

Got this for my 13 year old son for Christmas and it is the only game he is now playing on his Switch. He loves it! Seller was also wonderful. The game arrived on time and in great shape. Would recommend both the game and seller!
Smash Smash SmashSmash SmashSmashSmash SmashSmash Smash Smash Smash Smash Smash Smash Smash SmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmash SmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmash

My son and I LOVE playing this game. We loved the Gamecube version, so I am not surprised. They did an excellent job on this remake. I consider this a must have game for the Switch if you enjoy fast pace fighting games.
