The game is terrific. A MUST BUY for all brawlers lovers, especially if you like Nintendo and related properties. Really and amazing experience and I say that after having more than 2,000 hours of play in Melee. Really amazing game. Props to Nintendo & Co.
I got the game on the day of the release, and im happy to say that i am satisfied. This game is a SMASH. If you haven't played, you haven't lived ;)

Arrived right on time and my 8 year old is so happy with it! He says it‚Äôs his favorite Christmas present. My husband and I have enjoyed playing the game with him, there‚Äôs a lot to unlock so we‚Äôll be entertained by this game for a long time!

Smash Bros really pulled out all the stops on this game. This has always been my favorite franchise, and it still is. It's amazing because it appeals to every age. It's clean and simple enough for kids, yet it's nostalgic and engaging enough for adults. With a much-improved stage builder, immersive single-player and classically perfect 2-8 player local play, Smash Bros Ultimate is the essential game for any Switch owner.

I was so excited to receive this on the day of the release. It was delivered at around 3 PM. This game is very fun to play solo or with family or friends. The point is to have fun, it's not fully a skill game, Fun for all ages.

I‚Äôve been playing smash bros since the original on n64 and this by far is the best one yet. So glad to see Nintendo still making awesome games that I grew up playing. It‚Äôs just a shame I can‚Äôt easily get all my buddies back from their now mature lives to spend countless hours all night playing this masterpiece.

I originally got this game for my husband for Christmas, but I cannot stop playing it myself! I was never into this kind of video game, but I have played it more than the games that I was actually gifted for Christmas.
titles: Awesome game with lots of playing time!

review_contents: Best nintendo switch game ever

Ever single smash bros is the same thing over and over. Fight over 2k games get the new characters play online. But I can ever expect any more from Japanese developers. They usually copy paste without any additions to get money kind of like dynasty warriors. Smash bros ultimate basically puts all the games in one. So if you've never played any smash bros befor your in luck. The game is always fun with friends or online. If you lack friends and dislike or lack ability for online play then this game is not for you.
titles: No differnet than smash bros 64 imo

review_contents: Compr√© este juego en Estados Unidos y me lo trajeron a otro pa√≠s, y cuando mi hijo abri√≥ la caja que estaba sellada con pl√°stico, la caja estaba vac√≠a, no ten√≠a el juego. Ya hice mi reclamo en Amazon, no me sirve que me env√≠en otra vez el juego, porque yo vivo en otro pa√≠s donde el servicio de correo es p√©simo. Grande fue mi sorpresa que reci√©n leo los comentarios sobre este juego y muchas personas han recibido la caja vac√≠a tambi√©n. Ojal√° me puedan hacer un rembolso.,

Very yes, much awesome. It's the best smash bros. I wish it had map builder and a little more to do alone, like challenges, but it is the pinnacle of party game fun times. 9/10 Best smash bros to date
titles: Buy it, what are you waiting for?

review_contents: Good game, decent value and some nice inexpensive DLC. The package deal is pretty great considering you can listen to the music for the stages. I recommend it.
This game is beautiful in every way. With so many characters and stages to choose from you will have hours upon hours of fun. I could not believe I found this game for this low of a price!
Buen juego,
This game is awesome! The graphics are great and it reminds me of playing it with friends back in college on the N64. Great game!
titles: Brings me back to college days...

review_contents: Best smash game so far with the largest selection of characters to date, everything is top notch: graphics, gameplay, content, characters and controls.
titles: Best SS game to date with the largest selection of characters

review_contents: I had to buy this game the moment after I bought my switch. After starting off on Melee and all the great memories I had then it was only necessary to make new ones with Smash Ultimate. The packing was great and it came just days after I bought it. Thank you Amazon and Nintendo!
Bought this game for my 15-year old and 11-year old nephews back when it came out. Even today in 2020 they are still playing it. Thumbs up.

I love all the new editions to this Smash Bros. edition, adventure mode is too fun. You've got your classic smash, but adventure mode has all sorts of new extras that me and my husband are addicted to. Great game!

The game has everything you could want. Online play is what you would expect from Nintendo - confusing, somewhat frustrating, but ultimately allows you to play with your friends. Perfect way to assert your dominance again and again... is what I would say IF ANDREW WOULD QUIT FREAKIN GRABBING EVERY ASSIST TROPHY AND POKEBALLS.
titles: In case you need a review....

review_contents: More of the same, and when say more, I mean more quantity and also another game that's for the most part the same thing we been playing for almost 20 years. It's a five star cause if it's not broken dont fix it, I guess.

I got this for my Son and he unlocked all the fighters in 4 days. [AND HE'S NOT EVEN GREAT AT SMASH] My Son's Been playing since Melee And He Totally recommends this game for newcomers and old fans. also the online has received a BIG upgrade! You can now create arenas which allow the player to host a mini server with a max number of players at 8.also this game added personal modes which is a really cool feature that has never been in a past smash game My son gives this game 9.5\10
titles: If Your expecting it to have a great story mode you are wrong But besides that its Fantastic.

review_contents: Why are you reading this instead of playing the game? Are you some kinda weirdo? Why am I writing it instead of playing the game? Maybe I'm the weirdo. But you'll love this game if you grew up with Nintendo in any fashion
I am amused for all the great content included in this game. Away from the DLC you can have LOTS of gameplay hours and very good moments with friends. Excellent game, truly recommended.
titles: Awesome game, a lot of content.

review_contents:
I've played a few hours so far and I'm hooked. The textures and rendering are a huge step up from the last game and the fact they brought back every character plus a few more is amazing. Multiplayer is decent (but there are matches where people are clearly on McDonalds wifi).

If you have a switch, this is a must have title!

Arrived quickly. Packaging was fine. Game itself is phenomenal; I've been a Smash fan since N64 and this exceeds my expectations. Online mode is weird and laggy for me; otherwise, I am thoroughly enjoying all the local single and multiplayer options.
The graphs and board are amazing fun to play and watch. Purchase game for my sons, best purchase they are so busy playing u don't see or hear them. lmao...

Almost gave 3 stars due to WiFit Trainer not being among the original 8 characters...but the unlock happened within my first hour or two of playing. I've been crushing noobs with sweet yoga moves ever since. That satisfaction that comes from destroying children and their favorites video game characters with WiFit Trainer is endless.
Before I even got the game I knew I would like it. I nearly did not know what is was about and when I got it I loved it 5 stars.

Game came on release day, super happy. 1 star off because online always feel heavily delayed. Someone described it as "boxing under water" and I couldn't agree more. Even when frames are smooth there is still a noticable delay lurking behind inputs.
This. Game. Is. A. Blast. I have never really played it before on my Wii, but decided to give it a try with my 12 year old son. I have been playing nonstop ever since. I am a mid-40s Mom. :)
titles: Coming from a middle aged newbie:

review_contents: This game has been a long time coming and with the DLC that‚Äôs been added and the ones to come make this truly the Ultimate Super Smash Bro‚Äôs.
titles: If you haven‚Äôt bought this already, why haven‚Äôt you?

review_contents: This was a Christmas gift for our son. He loved it. He has played this game for hours. It s a fun game and very challenging.

Lots of fun. My 5 year old enjoys it. Can be confusing trying to figure out where your player is but that's always been the case with Smash. The more players, the more confusing but the more players, the more fun.
I bought this as a Christmas gift and the recipient loved it so I gave it 5 stars. If the recipient loved it then so do I.
titles: I've never actually played the game.

review_contents: The game was absolutely superb my grandson loves the game. As far as delivery I will only get that one star the person said they handled it off they left it on my steps anyone could walk by and took the package

I had been looking forward to this game forever and I was so happy when it was released. I love playing it and it brings me pure nostalgia because I remember playing older versions when I was a kid. Great graphics and smooth gameplay.

I received mine a couple days late since it got lost in transit or something... but the game is great! Love that all the characters are there and how they incorporate other characters from other series.
Another fantastic addition to the Smash Bros series. Huge selection of characters brings great variety to game play. The single player mode is also a nice addition. Easy purchase.
Or dig dug guy

This was my kids' group Christmas gift this year. It got so much gameplay over Christmas with visiting family. A hit with everyone. I recommend having Pro Controllers for the best experience with gameplay.
titles: A hit for gatherings and family time.

review_contents:
My favorite game to kill some time on the train ride to work. I have to say it's easy to play and loads of fun.

It's the only reason I purchased a switch.

Simply put the 5th game in a series of fighring games that almost anyone can get a hold of and immediately have a good time with. While some would call it a port it is far more than that and it shows. If you want a. Fun game to play with friends then buy this right now. You will not regret it.
titles: Absolutely no reason NOT to buy this

review_contents:
Best smash bros to date. So many characters that to master and tons of stages to fight on.

World of Light is fun too. Haven‚Äôt played online yet because I don‚Äôt have Nintendo Online at the moment
titles: How can smash get better than this?

review_contents: The online is terrible, most matches lag and you often get banned for lagging out, sometimes for more an hour and a half. The game often prevents you from playing. It is trash.

Lots of fun, loads of multiplayer options, great soundtrack, graphics are crisp, controls are tight.

Only thing that was disappointing was the World of Light single player, it has practically zero story
titles: Best entry in the SSB franchise

review_contents: Very fun and classic feel to the game. Live all the co tent in this game so far and it only keeps getting better as you unlock all the characters. Me and my family loved this game in the N64 growing up, and this makes us feel like we are playing the classic game and with a new modern twist! Amazing game and this is why I stick with Nintendo!

Perfection at its best! Either on the big screen at home, on the go or even with friends anywhere, this game brings the fun and action to your day! Adventure mode is absolutely terrific, SSB Ultimate is the perfect game for any Nintendo Fan! Highly recommend

This game is the best smash game (R.I.P Waluigi and Bomberman) everyone is here and the gameplay is way more fun then the other smash games and the roaster is amazing one criticism I have is the story mode is crap it‚Äôs not that fun subspace was 1,000,000,000 times better
titles: Great gameplay but bad story mode

review_contents: The adventure mode is unbelievably hard, and the online play is absolutely terrible. Don't buy the game until they make online actually worth it.

If you kids love Nintendo games and characters this this game is a must buy! We bought this for my kids for Christmas and they absolutely love the game! They always want to play it and love playing it
Played this for over 100 hours and I care very little for fighting games. Games like these are why Nintendo remains relevant and if you have a switch I think you would enjoy it too.
It doesn't matter if this is your first smash game or you have played them all, this is an excellent game that is fun to play single player or with friends/online.

Great game. Best one on the switch, most fun and great with friends. Brings back memories from my childhood. Online is still not that great, but portable smash and having it on the tv I‚Äôm not complaining.
titles: Best game on switch so far

review_contents: I got this game on eShop on Christmas, the game has the return of Adventure mode which I can explore with collecting spirits, I use this game using my GameCube controller.
titles: The game has the Adventure mode again

review_contents: I skipped out of the last smash cause they removed my boy snake. But now literally EVERYONE is back. Holy cow. Im in elite smash with Snake so if anyone wants to smash lemme know.

titles: Super Smash brothers continues to impress.

review_contents: Kids love it and so do i, big fans of super smash since original and this one delivered. Must have

review_contents: I got this for my son. He loves it. I'm not really into it myself but it looks great! My son has a lot of fun with the game. Worth picking up if you like Smash or your kid likes smash.
One of the best fighting games I‚Äôve tried. The adventure mode is amazing, really worth the money
titles: This goes to my top games !

review_contents: Bought for a 10 year old. He and his friends love playing this. They played a ton of it before Fortnite erased it from their minds.

titles: Switch fans this is the game!

review_contents: We bought this and the game wasn't inside even though it was shrink wrapped! The game was replaced with a piece of plastic. So disappointed for the birthday party. Had to return.

I would write a 3 star review if Nintendo allowed returns, but buying this game and expecting something resembled the other games in the series was a mistake on my part. The input lag makes it unplayable on a competitive level and as a personal review of the game, this ruined my personal experience. I would not have bought this game if I had had the chance to play it beforehand.
Nephew loves this game, smash Bros is a classic and I'm glad I can share/bond with him over videos! Being two decades older.
I bought this for my eight year grandson. He loves it and can‚Äôt stop talking about what a fun game it is. Great buy!
The best fighting game, Super Smash Bros is even better with this version. More characters, stages, and madness than ever before! Get it already!
Both of my boys, ages 5 and 10, love this game. I strongly recommend it to anyone who has kids in this age range. Incorporates all kinds of characters.
And the most ultimate one of all. Enjoyable Adventure mode, fantastic soundtrack, and acts as a nice little museum of gaming history. Responsive fighters to be more in line with how Melee worked.
this is the best smash bros I've played so far, so many characters!
Great game, great content. I love the multiplayer mode, and am still playing the single player. The art is amazing, the music great, and the new assists are fun to see. Highly recommend.

I bought this game as something I could play with old friends who I've been out of touch from. I read everything I could find about the online capabilities of the game, and everything I read said you could play online with 2 players on your local system.

So I went all in. I bought a Pro Controller, a dock for my battlestation, a year of online subscription, a wired ethernet adapter, and all extra cables necessary to have the ultimate online Smash experience with my friends in Discord.

Then the game came out and we tried to put a lobby together. Most of my friends have roommates or partners who they like to play with, and we were all under the impression that they could double up, two to a console.

That's not the case. When playing with online friends, this game is STRICTLY one person per console. It makes me SO MAD! I spent a lot of money, and I was so excited to finally have something I could play with my old friends again. Now they're getting together to play as a group, having fun Smash parties, and I have absolutely nobody to play with.

Screw you, Nintendo. I know you have a history of terrible online services, but I had faith and was grossly disappointed. Online lobby systems have existed for over a decade. Pay for someone who knows their shiz to come and do it for you.
titles: Want to play online with a group of friends? You're out of luck.

review_contents: It's a good game if you want a port of Smash Bros for Wii U with no online, other than that, stay away.

No Co-Op campaign. The only way you can play with friends is if you play the standard matches. Unless you play Nintendo games by yourself, you'll probably get bored quickly with this game. Very similar to MarioKart as far as replayability goes.

My eyes hurt.. My head hurts.. My fingers hurt.. I been drinking caffeine all day and play till my joycons died then grabbed another pair... It's been far to long since I've played perfection. Sure little things like menu navigation and messing with the spirits could be tweaked and improving load time per match as well even by a few seconds would make this 10/10 game Thay much better. I'm a collector.. I want everything unlocked I want to beat everything.. Everytime I think I'm getting close I find 10 more things to do.... Is there such a thing as to much content? Mario party is a 8/10 do to lack of content but I've had a blast playing it with several groups of friends... Smash I can be a hermit for all I care with 80+ hours of game play to keep me busy hell maybe more and will log more! I've been hyping myself up for months keeping myself from spoiling it and only watching what Nintendo wants us to and I must say... That game is 10x better then I thought... I don't regret it in fact I'm more then happy to drop the 25 on dlc because how much I'm enjoying it so far! Sure it's not for everyone but man is this game for me!

Update: after some time of playing this game and exspoling what it has to offer I still love it and just beat the spirt world with 30 hours in just that with 100% completion. I am oh so pleased and I love how the light fighters can deal Alot of damage very quick but they don't have the power to knock people out of the ring early. The heavy hitters have the power to deal Alot of damage and knock players out early but suffer from being slower and soaks up damage.. So depending on who you play as and how you play determines how well you do against an opponent.

Players that I loved and wanted to be my main because they used to be my main are no longer my favorite to play as and players I used to hate and would never touch are now my mains. So try them all out you might find one you really like and end up destroying everyone with!
After 1 hour of play, it is already boring. Waste of money

Opposite of what Mario Kart deluxe did for me. In MK deluxe, pretty much everything is unlocked. I had no motivation to play it. I like playing things to see new content and feel rewarded in a meaningful way. Titles do nothing for me; earning a 1st place trophy in itself means nothing to me. This is why it was such a relief when I first started Smash Ultimate to find only 2 characters available. Yes! This means I will need to earn the other characters and not be spoon fed (where's the fun in THAT?).

Speaking of unlocking, you can do that in adventure mode. As a newbie, I was really surprised how difficult it is! In order to progress, you need to defeat enemies, and each one is marked with stars indicating their difficulty level. IMO, there's a drastic difference between 1-star enemies (novice) and 2-stars (advance), which can feel like beating a difficult boss in other games. Thankfully, the campaign is structured in a way that makes higher difficulty enemies optional. It feels addictively challenging rather than frustrating.

That said, Smash feels much more approachable than other fighting games because it doesn't require you to remember complex button combos nor restrict moves to specific battle conditions. For example, in Pokken Tournament, you need to memorize at least 3 button presses for many moves and also need to know specific button timing and whether your fighting near/far.. I think Smash's approach is more strategic and doesn't punish you on reflex and memory, in contrast. That's what makes it fun to me.

The game is pretty overwhelming in terms of content. The lack of tutorial makes it intimidating at first, but if you take a moment to study the button mapping, you will realize that it's pretty simple and consistent across all characters. The trick is in understanding each character's specialties (e.g. only Kirby can learn opponent's skills by inhaling them). To me, this is a much lower learning curve but also stronger emphasis on strategy. If this is your preference, then definitely get this game. So far the only fighting game I can get into.
titles: Fun difficult and may be addicting

review_contents: The long and short of this is that it is amazing. As expected, fantastic multi-player, excellent visuals, and a wonderful list of characters (Isabel!). The DLC is promising as well. Best Smash yet!

As the headline states, the gameplay is amazing. The classic mode routes are great, the amount of options are finally here to meet our dreams from melee alongsidr a massive roster- but that's it.

The menus are garbage, tiered and layered with a clunky unfriendly user interface made for only playing a handful of ways. Maps before chars is more annoying then I forst thought it would be (minor complaint), and the classic mode handicap coupled with rng deaths makes me want to return my game sometimes (I dont like developers holding my hand at the first hint of a challenge- nintendo is the worst about this)

Online is worthless, enough said. There are no redeeming qualities. Spirits mode is just like a dozen mobile games, but with a great core gameplay.

The only reason to buy this game, multiplayer, is so clunky and annoying to play everyone literallu quit before the first hour of gameplay (something they all said was fun) because each time we wanted to switch something we had to completely restart our setup.

List of minor grievances-

Start match covers up charscter select locking in cpus
Maps before character
Having to save rules for every change
Not being able to easily change any part of the rules at character select
Unlock requirements (or lack thereof)
A lot of spirit matches just aren't fun and feel half baked
Main menu select looks to be directional with a center guide arrow, insteaf it is simply move in whatever direction the sevs want you to go, not necessarily where the next option is.
And more...

Ultimately, I can't recommend this game right now. It feels unfinished and is definitely unpolished in every aspect but one: the actual gameplay- sadly everything else interferes with that from a casual PoV and alot even from a more competitive I bet.
titles: Great gameplay, but nintendo lacks common sense

review_contents:
I've played Smash since Melee and while Ultimate is the best one of them all I feel like the 'patch it later' mentality has left the game not quite complete. In terms of Smash itself and the Spirits of Light they're fun and for the most part I've got little to no problem with it. Why the 3 stars? Well...

-My memory is fuzzy but I remember on at least Melee if you lost against a new challenger you could fight them again after the next Smash. Here it's being a 'door' in the Games & More section that isn't as straightforward as the initial encounters.
-New challengers AI varies from challenger to challenger. Some matches I've had end in 2 seconds and some are ridiculously easy. It's not consistent. I can expect earning new characters to be a challenge there are times that the game makes it more of a chore than actually fun. Considering that about 60+ characters need to be unlocked it can take a while.
-The ability to capture video is disabled and can only be done haphazardly on the replay mode. The replay tools are pretty bad to which if one wants to get a funny snippet of a 15 minute match (I appreciate the increase from 3 minutes) they have to wait at 1X until that point, capture, and then wait for the match to finish to properly process the film, otherwise it errors with a 0/0/0000 datestamp.
-The menus aren't as simple to navigate compared to previous games. In fact going far as outside of the Smash mode effectively logs everyone out, amiibos included (understandable), to which having to go back and reset my character and skin is old after the 30th time. Previous games, especially Melee, I remember keeping the stuff intact until a different game mode was played. I'm also baffled why character select is AFTER the stage select.
-There is not a way to prioritize music in the stages. In previous versions (not Melee) one could assign probabilities as to how often select songs will play. Here, if I'm understanding it correctly, one can pick the song they want every time they want to pick a stage. Otherwise stages will default to what's appropriate. On the plus side the music selection on the stages is per franchise rather than the stage/game itself though this means Nintendo stages will have 85 tracks to choose from without indication as to 'what game/franchise' it came from. To put it into an example. On the Sonic stages I know where Green Hill and Scrap Brain Zones are from but not Fist Bump and Rooftop Run.
-The World of Light single player campaign is pretty good, though I'm not sure the penalty for losing is, if any. Previous games took coins out.
titles: Fun as Smash goes but needs a bit of polish.

review_contents:
This game is my first and last experience with this particular game series, and for the life of me, I can't understand how it amassed such a strong following.

You have four moves, your ability to connect with them mean nothing when the stage shakes you off for a ring-out, and your opponents are allowed to triple and quadruple jump their way back to safety. Sometimes, you can't even see what's happening, because the view will zoom out while the screen fills up with flashing lights.

Take out the nostalgia that comes along with Simon Belmont or Mega Man, and you have an overrated, overpriced button-masher.

It should be called Super Mash Brothers, and playing it will make you want to Super Smash your controller or console.

EDIT: I stuck it out. Two months later, and after having learned that you just can't treat this game like a traditional fighter like Mortal Kombat, I've unlocked all characters, and finished the Adventure Mode.

The game is still ridiculously difficult at times---even when you know exactly what you're doing---but it was enjoyable to be taken through the worlds of Legend of Zelda and Castlevania, which are huge favorites of mine to this day. Adventure Mode will require about 40-50 hours of your time to finish, and before you do so, you must assemble a team of three to fight a gauntlet of every single one of the game's bosses before you make it to final battle. It was ridiculously hard, but I saw it through, and unlocked the 'true ending'.

It was one of the worst endings I've ever seen in a video game, let alone a game that demands this much of your time and patience.

So, even when I eventually started to enjoy Super Smash Brothers Ultimate, it remains a one-star review; a horrible overrated, overhyped conglomerate of nostalgia and flashing lights.

Horrible game. Will never play another one of these again, and the one that I have will be locked away for all eternity...I don't even care for the downloads for the Fight Pass that I so foolishly purchased.
titles: A fighter for toddlers and the mentally disabled

review_contents:
ALL 63 characters* from past Smash Brothers game are included in this game
+6 brand new characters
+5 new echo fighters,
+6 DLC characters** (not yet released).

-New characters include:

Inkling (Splatoon Series)
Ridley (Metroid)
King K. Rool (Donkey Kong)
Isabelle (Animal Crossing)
Incineroar (Pokemon)
Simon (Castlevania)

-New Echo Fighters. Echo fighters are essentially clones of original fighters with slightly change stats like different attack, defense, speed and special moves. Think Falco, Dark Pit and Lucina for example.

Daisy (Echo of Peach)
Richter (Simon)
Dark Samus (Samus)
Chrom (Roy)
Ken (Ryu)

You start off with original 8 characters from the very first Smash Bros game and have to unlock the others.

*63 if you count pokemon trainer and thier pokemon as one character; otherwise it's 65. No more choosing Lucario and imagining he's Mewtwo, one-time guest characters like Snake makes a return, and ice climbers are not excluded due to hardware limitations, DLC characters in Smash 4 like Ryu, Bayonetta are now part of main roster, etc.

** DLC includes:
Piranha Plant
Joker (Persona 5)
+4 unannounced fighters

DLC Come in character packs 1 fighter, 1 stage, and multiple music tracksOr you can get fighters (season) pass with 5 fighters, 5 stages and all music
If you purchase fighter pass you get rex mii costume for free
If you purchase the Smash Ultimate game near launch and register via MyNintendo (if you have physical version) you get Piranha Plant character for free. For downloaded version registration should be automatic. Piranha plant to release next year (2019)

===
Stages.

Unlike characters, not all stages return. There are 103 stages with 5 planned DLC stages.

Stages does not need to be unlocked

All stages now have a Battlefield form: Omega and Normal. Omega stages are similar to final destination stage with no moving platforms or random hazards.

===
Core changes/features.

-Graphics improved. details in clothing, facial expression/emotes and stages

-Some characters have a overall design change for example:
Link now in Breath of the Wild costume
Zelda no longer Twlight Princess form, now based off Link Between Worlds
Mario wears cappy from Mario Odyssey when doing taunts/moves
Fox now based off Star Fox Zero design

-Now can select female forms of characters like pokemon trainer and pikachu for example.

-Characters now displayed by number/when they appeared in the smash series

-13 New items: Banana Gun, Beastball, Black Hole, Bomber, Death's Scythe, Fake Smash Ball, Healing Field, Healing Sprout, Killing Edge, Rage Blaster, Ramblin' evil mushroom, Staff, and Super Launch Star.

-You select stage before character

-8 Player battles make a return

-Stage morph. Can select two stages at a time that transition at different set intervals

-You can turn off stage hazards

-UI changes for some characters next to damage meter for example: Clouds limit gauge, Inkling ink tank gauge, Villager's Pocketed item, Robin's durability counters

-Echo Fighters can either be displayed in their own character slots, or share their slot with the character they are based on, depending on user preference

-No more trophies, have spirits instead (more on this later). Over 1200 to collect

-Charge attacks are longer doing more damage the longer you hold

-Shield changes: Perfect shields are performed in reverse: instead of pressing the shield button several frames before an attack connects, players have to release the shield button when an attack connects on their shield instead.

-Damage meter now display tenth's damage. Example 20.5%

-Grab Cancels: If two players grab the same time; both characters take minimal damage and act as if grab released

-Characters can no longer run through other characters and instead push them backwards. This affects some characters like Fox with his slide kick attack and side special

-More space to come back from being blasted off to the sides, but edge sweet spots have decreased/recovery moves take longer to snap on ledges for most characters. Edge attacks has been buffed.

-Deal more damage in One-on-one fights with no items. Damage is multiplied by 1.2√ó

-Alternate costumes now shown on bottom character portrait

-Tracks in My Music are now organized by series rather than by stage.There are over 800 tracks per stage totaling over 28 hours

-You can create your own playlist and have the screen turned off in portable mode making your Switch a mp3 player/music player

-Taunts can now be cancelled, and comes out faster

-Continous dodges makes it less effective the more times you use it consecutively

-Characters that originally cannot swim or have a weakness to water (Charizard, Incineroar, Inkling, Sonic, etc) now take slow, constant damage while swimming.

-Sudden Death changes: Screen shrinks in overtime. If the screen has finished zooming in, Bob-ombs will start falling after a while

-Stamina battles can now be combined with stock.

-There are 59 Assist Trophies available in the game. 27 are brand new

-Some assist trophies can be KOed for points. The player who summon assist trophy can also KO there own assist trophy to prevent other players from gaining points

-Some Final Smash Changes:
No more temporary power ups/form changes like Wario Man, Fox/Falco/Wolf landmaster transformation, Flying Yoshi, Giga Bowswer, Giga Mac for example. Instead they have one hit KO moves/high damage moves like the other fighters
Some characters have different final smashes altogether like Link now has ancient arrow, Zelda has sealing triforce, Pit has lighting chariot as final smash.

For multi-character final smash: Fiora added to shulk final smash, Paula and Poo added to Ness Final Smash, Lucas has kumatora and Boney, Megaman has Protoman and Bass

Donkey Kong has rapid fire punches instead of the lame drum beats

-There is now chargeable final smash option. But no two final smash can be used simultaneously

-A lot of buff/nerfs changes for most, if not all characters

-A lot of Move changes. Example:
Link no longer has a hookshot (young link and toon link still does), has remote (manually detonate bombs)
Samus can charge her cannon in air
Zelda's Phantom knight is now chargeable: delayed hit or release.
Pokemon trainer has no penalty for not switching pokemon
Shulks Monato arts are now on text wheel around the character instead of multiple button presses
Rob has fuel gauge on spine for boost meter

-In game gold can be used to purchase Spirits, spirits upgrade and music tracks

-Game supports 11 languages.

-Can make teammates semi-transparent

-Palutena's guidance makes a return with some new voice clips/scenes for new characters and returning characters with cosmetic changes

-Codec also makes a return, but with no new voice recording for characters past Smash Bros Brawl
==

Spirits Mode.

Spirits are basically add on buff to characters in form of stickers or less known characters that didn't make it into the roster.

There are different classes: Novice, Advance, Ace, and Legend.

One primary spirit can be assigned at a time to one character

There are also support spirits that add on to the primary spirit depending on how many open slots they have
Primary spirits increase stats like HP, Speed, Attack etc.

Support spirits have different attributes like healing, fire boost item pickups, jump higher, etc

You have to fight spirits to obtain them in event matches.

Spirits Mode has event matches where matches can have different attributes/battle conditions like having the the floor be on fire, random spike balls fly across the screen, you're a mini fighter vs a large fighter (like when eat pick up mushroom but constant throughout match), enemy has a lot of armor but moves slower and deal higher damage, defeat enemy but constantly taking damage due to being poisoned, enemy constantly invisible, fog of war making it hard to see, reduced/increased gravity, only can use one move, etc.

Spirits can level up after battle or by feeding it snacks giving you more stat boosts. Some spirits have an enhanced or evolved form.

Spirits also can level up by having them train in gyms, or battle other spirit teams. The more stronger they are the better rewards you get.

For spirits you don't' readily use can send them off to collect treasure

You can also release spirits you don't want to get cores, which can be used to summon other spirits

===
Adventure Mode.

Story mode of the game dubbed World of Light

Grid based battle system similar to Mario Tennis Aces

Plot: All characters are turned into spirits except Kirby. Must release everyone from spirit form and save the world.

No in depth story just series of unique battles involving spirits.

More focused on fun game play scenarios than story

==
Other Modes:

Classic mode:
8 rounds, 1 mini game, and different bosses for each character.
You are able to select difficulty for challenge and better rewards

Tourament mode:
Basic King of the Hill bracket mode
Up to 32 players

-Smash Down mode:
After you play a character for a match they'll be unavailable for later matches. Having different characters to choose from each time

-Squad Strike
3v3 or 5v5 team elimination style match-up

-Training mode
Practice your moves. Grid based stage to help judge distance. Also displays launch distance trajectory

-Century Smash
Fight 100s of fighters that can be knocked out in one hit. Can be an endless smash mode if you're good enough

-Challenges
Complete certain challenges to unlock pieces of picture portrait

==
Multiplayer .

You can play local wireless or online.

No more 'For Glory' and 'For Fun' mode

Match making is now based on preferred rules, global smash power, Distance
Game will try it's best to match others with same preferred rules. But if you don't have preference match making is much faster

Global Smash Power (GSP) is amount of points experience you have or online rank. This can go up or down depending on wins/losses. You can set your GSP based on individual fighters. Game will auto disconnect you if you're griefing or constantly KO yourself off the cliff lowering your score. If your GSP is high enough, you can enter elite battles
Game will priorities matchups depending on where you are in the world for more stable connection.
You can play different mini games and certain modes while waiting for a matchup. There's also spectator mode available.

Smash Tags. If you defeat other players online, you get their smash tag. You do not lose yours or have to try to get it back if you lose. You can trade in smash tags for in-game gold

There's co-op online. 2 player teams against 2 player teams.

Battle arena. Setup online match making with friends/family

Smash World phone app. Can upload videos and watch them on the go.

Overall, best Smash Bros games to date. MUST BUY if you're a Smash Bros, Nintendo fan.

This installment of Smash, unlike previous entries is outright hostile towards any casual or new players. If you have a life or just want something to play at the end of a long day just to break from reality for a bit, this is not your game.

I didn't buy from Amazon, so I'll be getting my refund, courtesy of Gamestop.

Yet another fighting game to add to the large pile of competitive player heavy games I'll likely never pick up again.
It had a very nostalgic taste, kinda like chewing on batteries but I didnt actually hallucinate any fight scenes, maybe I did It wrong I'll order another and try again

I just don't get it. I had never played a Smash game before but always heard amazing things. This game came out to rave reviews. It made several top ten lists and was highly rated in the 'Top Games Of 2018' for a gaming podcast I listen to. This seemed like a slam dunk purchase, so I pulled the trigger. I regret it.

This game is an absolutely beautiful mess, but it *IS* a mess. There are a ton of playable characters, and they are all ridiculously unbalanced and locked at the beginning, meaning you have to pour in hours of your time to unlock them all ... so you can figure out which ones are unplayable. The single player campaign, prob the main reason I bought the game in the first place, is an exercise in frustration. Nothing makes any sense. Here, you're fighting this recognizable character, who is possessed (yes really) by this D-list character. Did you finally win? Awesome, you didn't unlock anything except some extra sprites on a few more confusing screens. Oh did you want to play as that character? Keep on button mashing. Even the menus are frustratingly convoluted. Want to play the single player? It's 3 menus deep, keep on clicking. No menu screen works the same way as the last screen you were just on (yes really). Just getting into a match is a challenge.

No tutorial. Click around the confusing menus and you can find some 'training' which still assumes you have played a smash game before. If you're trying to get started, watching a few hours of YouTube videos is basically required just to learn how to play.

But it's an amazing party game, right? Is it though? Is it a fighting game? Yes? No? Maybe but not really? You don't have health, but it's completely possible for someone to just hit you enough times that you die (and not by flying off the platform) ... so really you DO have health? Only it's hidden? Did your opponent just select one of the INVINCIBLE characters that are in this game? Whelp, have fun getting destroyed.

Playing the CPU? Oh did you try to use strategy and actually bring their damage meter up over 100% ? Have fun as the CPU unleashes it's super-secret finishing move which will one-shot you wherever you are one the screen. DEFEAT! Remember, if you throw that controller and break it, Nintendo wins when you have to replace it.

Everything about this game is random. The characters, who is playable and who is not, who is a spirit vs. who is playable, the mechanics, the dynamics, the menus, and -- most importantly -- the match results. People are going to tell you that there is strategy. Kids pump hours and hours into this believing that whatever they're doing matters and affects whether they win or lose. I think the dirty little secret is that it's all completely random. Mash some buttons! VICTORY! DEFEAT! See that was fun, right? RIGHT?!

The joke is on me since getting a refund on a video game is essentially impossible these days.

Surprisingly, you only have the veteran 8 fighters to start out with in this game, but after a lot of challenges to complete, you'll have over 70 fighters altogether, including all the fighters of all the earlier games! What a way to celebrate the original game's 20th anniversary next Spring! But it don't stop there, Ultimate contains lots of other amazing stuff, music, and challenges too numerous to mention! How can all that fit in just 1 tiny game card, even GREATLY bypassing the 3DS game?! If it's not already sold out by Christmas, in any year for now, and wanted to try it on a Switch system belonging to you or a friend or family member, by all means, dig in! The characters have been fine-tuned for more fair fights; too bad the Oscars never were claimed to be fair, even today, especially to numerous Looney Tunes shorts during their Golden Era! What's more, Kirby's got a LOT of copying to do, take it from me! Like the Wii U and 3DS games, Ultimate will soon have added characters via DLC, like a Piranha Plant still in his pipe! I'd love to try and kick my new brother-in-law's booty at this masterpiece, it's even accessible to Gamecube Controllers and adapters for the Wii U, which I'm best at! You never know who or what you'll face next, or unlock next, in Ultimate, the Super Smash Bros. game to end all Smash Bros. games!
titles: The Smash Bros. game to end all Smash Bros. games!

review_contents: Unbelievable game!!!

If you love the way the Smash Bros games play, then you'll probably like this. In fact, I'd recommend hardcore fans of the series stop reading this review right now because I'd rather not make anyone as upset as me right now.

I'm done with this crap! Controlling the characters was always a bit like trying to draw with a marker attached to a string, but it might actually be worse in this case. The developers of the Kirby games should just stop having any part in this series. It barely works for Kirby games and it doesn't work for this! I tried this because I like playing as certain characters, but it's time to face the fact that the gameplay just isn't for me... Maybe it never has been. Sorry this is coming off more like a blog rant than a review, but I had to let some steam off somehow. I deleted the install and I'm really glad I borrowed the game instead of buying it.

Repetitive lame story one of the worst Super Smash Brothers I've ever played. With how long it took to make this it should not have ended up this way. It looks like a three-year-old put it together. I'm glad I rented it rather than pre-ordering it, saved me 60 bucks. I would rather play super smash bros 64 or melee in switch graphics, had a better story in the 64 versionHopefully Luigi's Mansion is better

I grew up playing the original Super Smash Bros. on the Nintendo 64. I loved being able to play as a variety of characters across some well-known (and perhaps less well-known) Nintendo franchises. With each iteration of the series, I‚Äôve enjoyed seeing new characters representing new and classic games join the roster. However, even if I can understand cutting some characters as the series moved forward, it was still a disappointment when I couldn‚Äôt play as my favorites in subsequent entries in the franchise. This is why I was hyped up for the release of Super Smash Bros. Ultimate.

For the first time, I was able to play as a staggeringly large number of characters. The fact that (almost) everything from previous games made it into this one made it feel like this was a celebration of the history of video games and not just a party brawler. And while I didn‚Äôt bother with the DLC for the 3DS version of the series, I jumped right in and got the first DLC fighter pack when it was released. This speaks to how Super Smash Bros. Ultimate appeals to me in that I want the fullest experience of the game that already had a pretty full experience.

And while I appreciated the ‚ÄúWorld of Light‚Äù single-player campaign and the ‚ÄúSpirits‚Äù that can be used to enhance the player characters, the amount of unlocking I needed to do so I could play as my favorite (or some of the newer) characters felt a bit tedious at times. Plus, with so many characters to choose from, there is a bit of choice paralysis that has prevented me from completing most of the single-player story modes with these characters. Still, the game remains approachable for all skill levels, especially if you want to play by yourself.

A party brawler that‚Äôs Nintendo‚Äôs love letter to the history of gaming, I give Super Smash Bros. Ultimate 4.0 stars out of 5.
titles: A party brawler that‚Äôs Nintendo‚Äôs love letter to the history of gaming.

review_contents:
As others mentioned having all the characters and levels came at a cost. I would almost consider this game to be a for a collector than a gamer. You can say all of the characters and levels are playable but if you like playing the game, it leaves you wanting to dust off the Wii version.

The ‚Äúadventure‚Äù mode in this is single player only and just a normal battle with set conditions to alter the fight. These are repetitive and a harder one is simply more annoying than more challenging. Spirits are fun and bring nostalgia, but most do similar things. So, you lose interest quick.

Personally, I found starting out with all the levels to be a bit overwhelming. If I want a quick fight, I will not go through and look at all the stages to pick one. I will jump in one I know and since I‚Äôve had them all from the beginning, there isn‚Äôt much reason for me to try a new one unless I am looking for something different.

Characters unlock based on time played. At first I thought this was great because i didn‚Äôt want to play for hours trying to meet certain conditions to unlock everyone. After I have played for 9 hours and have everything unlocked, I miss the challenge of working to get a new player. Again, getting everyone so quickly never gave me the desire to play as someone new.

Smash is and always will be a COUCH fighting game with friends. The online leaves much to be desired and since you have to pay $20 to play Nintendo online, I cannot say it is worth it if you are buying that just for this game.

Although it will still be great having friends over and playing this, there is nothing in my opinion to make me want to turn it on when it is just me, which the other games had. 9 hours does not = $60 in my book. I would say this is for the completionists or die hard fans only.
titles: All characters/levels not worth losing all side games

review_contents: The last super smash I played was Melee on the GameCube, I had a wii but never used it after some wii bowling the first few months. Fast forward to getting the switch and this is has been my most anticipated game. It delivered on all fronts. I couldn‚Äôt believe the amount of stages available in the base game. All the best N64 and GameCube stages included. It plays flawlessly, albeit still getting used to playing with a pro controller. Even after we‚Äôll over a decade, I still feel like I‚Äôd be so much better using a GameCube controller, it‚Äôs funny. I will likely get the adapter just for this game. The box art is really cool too if you bought physical. Nintendo outdid themselves, I‚Äôll be playing this game for years.
titles: The smash to smash all smashes.

review_contents: i accidentally swalloed the game, and choked there should have been a warnin gon the front cover that when i bought itthe game that i could have chocked on it and there wasnt one i am entitled to finantial compinsation for this actions an i will be calling ninteno
THE BEST GAME EVER
titles: All you need to know it‚Äôs that this game is perfect

review_contents:
The online for this game is pretty terrible. You cant pick the rules you want (even if you want no items, too bad the game doesnt care what you want) It rewards people who disconnect by letting them keep their online score and the winner gets nothing (genius idea nintendo). There is a lot of lag.

They put little effort into expanding the online experience but dont give us much for single player in exchange. The "adventure mode" is nothing but a fancy giant flat map and you just fight battles one after the other with varying degrees of the same mods (this time the enemy cpu is metal,giant,fast,slow,etc). So they didnt want to give us a good online experience, or an offline experience, so what the hell did you want to give us??

The only redeeming thing this game has over the other games is purely the roster (all characters in the series + some new ones, tho now I'm thinking this was a gimmick to distract from the messiness of the rest of the game). And yes it does look very nice (tho were in 2019, good graphics is a given at this point so who cares)

Had high hopes with this game and yeah it has been fun for a little bit but once you play you realize the priorities of development were more for marketing and to boost sales (up front things to show off like brand new graphics and roster) rather than giving us a consistent, replay able experience to last for years.

Of course this is my opinion and you may disagree but this is my review, grain of salt, etc...
titles: Nintendo doesnt know what they want to do with this game

review_contents: $63 for 8 characters... sorry but I just want to battle with my favorite characters , not spend days of mindless battles unlocking them.

The multi-player aspect deserves six stars. The single player features are absolute trash: the game would have been better off without them.

The multi-player:
I've never had as much fun playing a video game as I have sitting around with my friends knocking the crap out of one another's characters. The game is so dynamic and fast paced. There is enough noise to mix ensure that even the best players can sometimes get tripped up, but skill is definitely rewarded.

The game can be overwhelming for newbies:
Part of what makes this game so great is also part of what makes it so daunting for newcomers. I am relatively new to smash myself, and, while I was happy to put in the hours needed to feel comfortable with the control scheme, it is not the sort of game that you can just pick up and play with proficiency in a half an hour. Being able to reliably get smashes and tilts when you want them takes time. And this has made it more difficult than it would otherwise be to get those of my friends who don't already play smash to join in. So, if you are the sort of person who doesn't already have friends who play smash, or if you're the sort of person that likes to introduce your friends to new things, you may have to persuade them to put in practice. But, as I said, part of what makes this game so great is also what makes it so daunting...the variety.

The variety!
Sakuri did an impressive job of figuring out how to build in a wide variety of game commands using the controls that are available in a modern controller. Tilt the joy stick and press the attack button, get one sort of attack, smash the joy stick to the side and press the attack button, get another sort of attack. Press your bumper to shield if you are stationary, or press your bumper and a direction to dodge in that direction. The sheer number of input commands you can enter means that there are A LOT of different ways you can play any given character. And the between-character variety is just staggering. Each character is unique (a few minor reskins notwithstanding), and the kind of play-style you will need to adopt depends heavily on who your character is, who your opponent's character is, and whether you tend to be an aggressive or defensive player, an arial or ground-based player, and so on. What this means is that there will always be something new to learn, new strategies to develop, and ever more nuanced combos to learn and develop. This is what convinces me that I can play this game for the next five years and stand no chance of getting bored with it.

Handicaps:
One shortcoming with this game is the handicap system. There are two ways you can do this. The first is by manually entering a fixed amount of damage that the better player starts with (you can also have the game automatically calculate it based on previous matches, but it doesn't seem to be very reliable IMO). While this works, there is a major drawback. The whole point of this game is to launch characters off the screen. How far a player gets launched depends upon how much damage they have. What this means is that there are certain combos that only work when other players have relatively little damage. These are important to learn because they are a way that you can get your opponent into the damage levels where you can actually launch them off screen and win. But, if you are consistently playing against players who are better than you, you cannot perform those combos and so cannot learn them. The alternative is to have the better player start out with zero damage, but then there is no way to try to compensate for skill differences, and that can be demoralizing for players who are new to the game. The other way to try to implement handicaps is through the use of the spirit system. Spirits let you modify your characters damage, defense, and other statistics. Some spirits are more powerful than others. So, you could try assigning stronger spirits to weaker players and weaker spirits to stronger players to try to balance things out. This gets complicated, however, because spirits level-up as they are used. So, unless you max out a bunch of spirits, which takes a long time, you won't have any way of figuring out, in general, which spirit works best for which player. A much easier mechanic would simply be to allow players to independently adjust how much damage or defense their character has. It would make the handicapping system a lot more natural.

Online play
The best way to play this game is with your friends, in a room, yelling and screaming and fighting together. But there will inevitably be times when you want to play a game and your friends are not around. Enter online play. It's a largely satisfactory substitute, but it has its frustrations. The main problem is lag. It is tragically common. Even when you are willing to invest in an ethernet cable and an adapter, not everyone else is. And people have different internet speeds. Sometimes this is because they don't want to pay for better bandwidth, other times it is because they cannot afford it (we all do our best with where we are at), and still other times this is because people live in rural areas where internet connectivity is far from ideal. What all of this means is that even if you are playing on a high-bandwidth internet connection, your opponent may not be, and the game can only play as fast as the slowest player. I think they could improve the lag problem by trying to measure the connection speeds of different players and trying to match them accordingly. At least that way if your opponent is slowing down the play, you are probably also slowing down the play by a proportional amount. While lag is a general issue with competitive online multiplayer and not one that is specific to smash, it can be very noticeable with smash because timing is of the essence.

Single player:
The campaign is just way, way, way too long. It goes on and on forever and then it just keeps going. It feels like what I imagine eating five pounds of bacon in one sitting would feel like. At first it's great, but then there are still 4.5 pounds of bacon left to eat. I do not know that I would mind the length of the campaign so much if the different matches had been more thoughtfully designed. This is not to deny that some of the matches were clever and interesting. I thought that the fight for The Boss's spirit seemed like a clever adaptation of the final fight from Metal Gear Solid 3, or as near as you could come given the elements available to the SSBU designers. And there was one fight where all the players start out at max damage so that it's a one-hit-kill scenario, the goal was to emulate an old west shoot out. But those sorts of matches were the exception, not the norm. Most of the combat scenarios feel like they were put in there just because. It's as though management came in and said to the developers, "We want four hundred fight scenarios. They don't have to be fun or interesting. Just start grinding them out as quickly as you can." So, one of the designers looks over at another and says, "Well, bombs are an item in the game. We could have a stage that's just nothing but bombs raining down everywhere all at once for the whole match." And that is when the other designer said, "Good idea, but there are different kinds of bombs. We should do a scenario like that for each kind of bomb." Ugh...why!? And other scenarios just feel like they were put in the game to frustrate players. One designer looks at the other: "Let's make the player fight a million Kirby's at the same time where they only use one kind of attack that doesn't do much damage but comes out quickly and interrupts whatever the player is doing."

It also would have been nice if the fights had been arranged so that the early combat scenarios in the campaign were engineered to try to teach you different skills that you need to play the game. E.g., they could have had a stage early on where shielding is really important, and labeled as such; and another where air dodging is crucial, and labeled as such. This would have helped new players build the skills that they need to be proficient at the game. And they could have made those matches optional for experienced smash players who would find such matches tedious.

Finally, the plot. Why have it? The plot to the single player is so unbelievably thin. They should have tried to tell an actual story or just had a map full of different fights.

Conclusion:
This game is worthy of your love. But it will take practice to get used to. And it's a game you are going to want to play with friends. If you don't like games that require a high buy-in cost in terms of practice time, or you just want to tool around on your own. SSBU is not for you. But if you want a truly unique fighting game with endless variety and a learning curve that never ends, then this is your cup of tea.

UPDATE: Less than a week after release, Nintendo and Bamco released a patch adjusting the matchmaker, so now Preferred Rules actually work as expected. In my several hours of play so far, looking for 1v1 No Items, I haven't been placed in a single FFA or 2v2 or Items On, and almost every match matched exactly my preferred settings.

So now the biggest flaw of this game is just about nonexistent.

ORIGINAL REVIEW

It's Smash Bros. Of course it's going to be good. But this game knocks it out of the park on so many fronts and only missteps in one right now that it's hard to give it anything less than 5 stars. I've played it like 20 hours in the past 2-3 days since release.

- This may be a point of division, but I LOVE THAT YOU ONLY START WITH 8 CHARACTERS. I love the constant flow of unlocking and growing your roster. Smash 3DS and Smash Wii U started with almost all characters unlocked, and it removed a lot of incentive to play singleplayer or to try out new characters. It made opening up the game the first time overwhelming and mad hard to choose whom to try out, and to this day I still have barely used some characters in that game. In Ultimate, starting with fewer characters means newcomers to the series don't get overwhelmed, there's incentive to try new characters as you unlock them, and there's a constant sense of growth. You unlock characters super fast too, with very clear and guaranteed unlock guidelines.

- Ridiculously well balanced cast. I've unlocked like 50 characters so far and thus far, none of them feel bad or unviable or absolutely broken above the rest of the cast. Every previous Smash game had this issue--maybe this one will too, but so far I'd been amazing being able to pick literally anyone and have a good time.

- Classic Mode is possibly the best it's ever been. Melee made some great leaps in making Classic Mode better. Then Brawl did more of the same, Smash 3DS did more of the same, and Smash Wii U was a bit all over the place. This Classic Mode is tailor-made for each character and the attention to detail mixes from impressive (Classic with Isabelle, for example, has you fighting against only the female cast) to downright hilarious (Wii Fit Trainer has you fighting against the...larger opponents in the game). There are also a bigger variety of boss battles than ever, and I haven't fought a single one yet that wasn't well-designed.

- World of Light is essentially themed Events Mode with an RPG system and malleable difficulty.

- The gameplay is so damn fun. The pacing is breakneck, but you always feel like you have the opportunity to get right back into the action. Characters fly around fast, but TIP: Follow the smoke trails because they're the best way to trace your character if you get hit hard! Melee will always have the most technical and hard gameplay in the series, but Ultimate has a very similar gameplay flow (favoring aggressive play with momentum, versus defensive and campy play) while being much easier for newcomers to pick up.

- Spirits are surprisingly addictive. When you recognize one from a game you've played and see how they hand-crafted that challenge, it's always damn satisfying.

- Presentation is absolutely superb. The music and visuals are so above-and-beyond, it's hard to not be super appreciative of just that.

- Overall, just so much content. 74 fighters, 103 stages, Battlefield and Omega Modes for every one, Stage Hazards toggle, saved custom rulesets, over 900 music tracks...this game could be $100 and still be worth it right now.

Only one misstep: The online. Preferred rulesets is a great idea, but right now there's not nearly as much priority on player orientation (1v1, 2v2, FFA) as there should be. I don't like wanting to go in for 1v1s and only get them 60% of the time. Fix that, and all of the new improvements they've made to the online will shine.

Doesn't hold me back from giving it an easy five stars though.

*Might contain tiny minor spoilers*

A new Super Smash Bros. game is an event that only happens once each console generation, and it never fails to be hype. Smash Bros. Ultimate aimed to deliver the ultimate Super Smash Bros. experience in terms of content and it definitely achieves that. For those not very familiar with Smash Bros. games, these are Nintendo‚Äôs flagship fighting game series in which characters from different Nintendo properties, and also third party guests, battle each other in an all-out brawl. The mechanics are different from most fighting games though, you are to launch opponents off the screen by building up their damage meter and then hit them hard so they go flying, while avoiding getting launched yourself. Up to 4 players could traditionally play at once in a Smash game but now even up to 8 players can do so at once. (It‚Äôs super messy and overwhelming to have so many people at once but the option is there if you want it).

Super Smash Bros. games tend to be very hype not only due to tight and fast paced gameplay mechanics but also because it unites fandoms and brings nostalgia from so many different franchises into one game. Ultimate seems to be built under the premise of pleasing as many people as possible that have enjoyed the best parts of all 4 previous Smash Bros. generations. One of the first things we learned about SSBU is that ‚ÄúEverybody is Here!‚Äù meaning every single playable character from the entire series is back, with no exceptions. With this and also the newcomers added, we are talking about 73+ playable characters and even a few more are coming via DLC‚Ä¶ so eventually we might be reaching close to 80 playable characters. This is an insanely high head count for this kind of game but they made it happen. Also most stages from past games made it back which is also very impressive, especially considering each stage can be altered to Final Destination or Battlefield versions, or even remove Stage Hazards which has been a long awaited feature.

This version also brings back Adventure Mode, but this is not the pseudo platformer quest that we had in Brawl. ‚ÄúWorld of Light‚Äù is more of a glorified Event Mode + Fighter Customization. In this mode you travel a large map and have to complete several event fights in order to capture ‚ÄúSpirits‚Äù which are stat boosters for your fighter with different effects that can be equipped on your fighter. This should help you move ahead in your quest and ultimately defeat the final boss. It is very different from Subspace Emissary, but if you ask me this is a lot better and more engaging gameplay-wise. For example there‚Äôs a fight based on the Pokemon Snorlax, in which King K. Rool will be conditioned not to move a lot.. much like a Snorlax. When you beat the match you will gain the Snorlax spirit, which will grant you resistance from being pushed by strong wind if equipped‚Ä¶ Something that will be very helpful in other fights ahead.

One recurring theme that you will find in several modes of this game is how different characters and franchises from all over the gaming industry are represented in this game even if there aren't actual assets made in this game to do so. For instance, play Classic Mode as Street Fighter's Ryu and it will accommodate all fights to be in Stamina mode, Battlefield form and the Smash characters will pose as classic Street Fighter opponents even with their respective background music. For instance, a green Donkey Kong will pose as SF‚Äôs Blanka and so on. The game is never explicit on how they are referencing things so part of the fun is figuring things out and connecting the dots yourself.
Overall SSBU feels much faster paced than SSB for WiiU and it definitely feels like most characters where purposely made faster and stronger, making the gameplay for dynamic than ever. Will this win over Melee purists? I can‚Äôt say but it probably has a higher chance to do so than any other Smash game. I just say this game feels so right and satisfying to play, especially with friends.

As far as complaints I may have about this game... There‚Äôs a few. I would have liked to see more side mini games which beside that one and only one side scrolling bonus game in Classic mode, there‚Äôs none to be found here. I also understand why trophies didn‚Äôt return, but I would have at least expected them to have text blurbs on the Spirits so we could learn more about their origins. There‚Äôs none of that. The online gameplay as it has been traditionally with Smash can get super laggy, although this also mostly depends on the connection quality of each participant, but this is definitely something that doesn‚Äôt get a free pass anymore now that Nintendo charges for online service. We need a better online system for Smash. Last but not least, while I‚Äôm happy with all the new characters that we got, I‚Äôm not too thrilled that only 3 completely new stages were added. Seems like a weird complain considering there are 100+ stages to choose from, but from a long time Smash Bros. fan I was hoping to see more new environments represented. Considering Smash Wii U was released in 2014, very few games from the past five years are being represented in this game, and that‚Äôs very unfortunate. Instead we have to see dated stages like Pictochat and Elektroplankton. (Not complaining they are there, I‚Äôm just saying it‚Äôs weird that those discontinued features as stages made it when more modern references didn‚Äôt.)

Phew! With all that said, this game is a must buy for your Nintendo Switch collection. It really isn‚Äôt a brainer. A lot of effort was put into this package and it is worth every peny.

Super Smash Brothers Ultimate really is the ultimate game of the series. Right away you have over 24 hrs of game music (before unlocking a little more), 103 stages & 76 fighters plus 6 DLC later (1 free if you register by 01-31-2019).

Skill: You're given experience for playing, even if you don't win. (So losing will level you up.) I'm very limited (novice, horrible vision, no precision) & yet I can manage to enjoy it with easy mode & equipping the right spirits. The Spirits mode is an amazing tactical strategy exploration adventure that builds up your skills as you go. You release spirits of other videogame characters & can equip them to add their ability to your stats to lower or neutralize negative effects of the current battle as well as to overpower your opponent. If you wanted then you can give yourself status effects to make a given battle harder.

Training: SSBU has several ways to teach you the game. There's a practice mode in which you can generate items or effects to practice on. Then during any match you can pause to see a listing of the smash moves. But the biggest teaching is the whole Spirits mode. You're started easier & as you progress you'll likely decide to use different fighters, will play a wide mixture of stages, use a huge number of status assisting spirits, & learn how to counter your challenges (such as speed decrease to help keeping control of yourself in a battle that will increase speed to uncontrollable levels, or wind resistance on a windy battle).

Art & graphics: The attention to detail is amazing. The designers made everything look amazing, including stuff normally off camera or only briefly seen in battle while your attention is elsewhere. They didn't have to make backgrounds & off camera areas look this good, but they chose to for the fans to be proud of the game we were given. More for non-human players (CPU vs CPU), during battles you can pause & reposition the camera (zoom, pan, tilt, even rotate for smartphone layout, plus add filters). This is just like in Super Mario Odyssey. Now you can take great pictures of the action. Sadly, video capture isn't available, probably due to the graphics & processing intensity already being quite a lot.

Content: With 76 fighters plus 5 coming, 103 stages plus more to come, already over 24 hrs of soundtracks that you can customize playlists & frequency of being selected for background music. The tracks in the play menu are mostly 90-120 seconds, cutting at the loop/repeat point since there's no need in having them stored on the game in longer looped versions. there's so much put into this game. Then the Amiibo mode lets you have a custom challenger to battle yourself or set against the CPU opponents. Of course you can set up a custom battle of CPU players to see who's better.

Overall it's such a wonderful game to play & watch, with a lot of options for customizing & plenty of challenges for all skills.

Check out the YouTube video from GameXplain about "10 secrets hidden off screen". [Search URL cfU5AdmhtWA to find it, since I'm not sure if I can post the link. - I'm not affiliated with GameXplain or asked to promote them. It's simply a good video I like, highlighting some examples of the attention to detail.]
titles: A game for beginners & fans, casual or serious, novice or skilled.

review_contents:
Have you played Nintendo games in the past 30 years? What if you could take your favorite characters from over 29 game universes and have them duke it out in a brawl for supremacy?

Super Smash Bros Ultimate for the Nintendo Switch brings over 74 (eventually 80) characters together in a great battle experience. In this game the main premise is that you play your character, trying to take down your opponents in a 2D-style fighting game.

There are a number of modes to play with multiple players (both online and couch) and single-player. For single-player mode, you can dive into the story mode, "World of Light", where you work to restore things as they were, unlocking additional fighters and obtaining "spirits". Spirits are effectively equipment for your fighters that affect attack/defense
power levels and confer other sorts of changes, such as immunity to level flip or reversed controls. Spirits are characters / items from other games, and are obtainable by winning a battle against some sort of representation of it. For example, one spirit is "Nia" from Xenoblade Chronicles 2 in which you fight a Mii Fighter dressed in a Nia costume paired with Incineroar representing Dromarch. Other sorts of spirit battles bring the "spirit" of
the character by changing the stage with conditions or pre-loading the opponent with certain power-ups.

In addition to "World of Light", there's also the "Spirit Board" where you can obtain spirits on a random board by battling and winning a timing game (shooting the puppet).

So far this game has a ton of content to keep you busy even in single player. The couch multiplayer also works great. One problem that seems to be worked on is the online multiplayer has an issue with slow players causing an entire battle to grind to a halt as the game requires exact synchronization. Unlike many FPS games where prediction/AI can be used to fill in gaps, this sort of game relies on frame-perfect synchronization.

An additional feature that helps change things up is the presence of online "events" in which certain spirits are
brought to the Spirit Board that normally wouldn't. Event spirits also give bonus rewards on completion, making obtaining ones you already have one of even more useful.

Coming down the pipeline are a total of 6 DLC characters, two of which have been revealed already. Pirahna Plant,
free to those who have the game registered by January 31st, and Joker from Persona 5.

Overall, I think this is a great game to add to your Nintendo Switch collection. It has a TON of things to discover, unlock, and use. It is a lot of fun to play alone and with friends, both online and off.
titles: Great addition to your Nintendo Switch collection

review_contents: Technically this should be the Best Smash game ever, because it has ever smash characters available for play. But I'm not too crazy about it. I wasn't even crazy about smash 4 for the wii u. Although I LOVED smash 4 for the 3ds. I think Melee had what most of the newer smash bros games have. It's a simple structure that all balances out perfectly. Melee had the arcade mode, challenges, great ways to unlock your characters, trophies. Smash Ultimate story mode was kind of lackluster to be honest, the world hub is basically just a drawn map you could travel from place to place but you have to fight the spirits to get through. It was a neat concept, but really spirits? why replace the trophies, they were amazing. I don't even care if you called them spirit trophies. I used to LOVE rotating the trophies in melee and looking at them for a while. All I can say is that Smash Ultimate is a heavily party fighting game. It has modes that can satisfy a lot of people. But the MEAT of all is the Spirit section of the game, and then you have online (online is always alright). All I'm saying is you can have ALL the characters in smash bros but when the main campaign is lackluster it really breaks the immersion. Whats going to happen is smash 6? are we going to get ALL the characters again plus more? Poor Sakurai, it's going to take him a bout 6-7 years to do another smash. I understand his vision with this spirit concepts, it makes us appreciate the facts that we need to have balance between light and darkness. If you have too much of one of the other. Your life will be controlled by it. I like that meaning, I LOVED the ending, but why don't i like the actual campaign. I felt it was repetitive. I'd give this game a 7.5/10. I love this game, and I really wanted to like it more, but it just feels like a better Smash 4 in my opinion.
titles: Feels like it's a Better Smash 4

review_contents: This is another top notch Nintendo game! Every single fighter from every Smash Bros. game is back! Smooth animation, great graphics - if you think of it, only Mario Kart 8 and Smash Bros. on Wii U have had 1080p graphics for Mario...so this is a real treat! A huge single player campaign that will take you 20-30 hours to complete. The online I tried on launch day was smooth without any lag. A must own for any video game fan!
titles: Wow - Hundreds of Hours of Fun!

review_contents:
This game feels soooo clean! The modes are great, the graphics are great! And now all that I want is super Mario galaxy for switch!

Gameplay: Singleplayer is very fun! And playing multiplayer is also a blast will all stages unlocked and there is so many characters that you challenge almost one every game!

Controls: the game also let's you customize controls for each name that you can select and it allows you to button map all the buttons. I like using Y for attack for extra comfort and binded both riggers on left shield and right grab. I recommend using the pro controller for the best experience
