Sound: The sound is very crisp and clean! And their is so many soundtracks that sound very good for every stage! I recommend bass boost for TV mode ;)

Graphics: you can enjoy 60 fps on this system handheld and docked! And HD 1080p for Crystal clear game play!
Also the effects are much improved and the experience feels perfect!

Content: the game unlocks all stages at the begining but you need to fight the charictors to unlock them. The boards are nicely remastered and improved also and there will be more dlc and updates in the future!

All in all I think this is my most fav game on the switch and I highly recommend that you buy it! This for me feels like a great title in the series and it may be one of the best!

This game cheats alot more then the previous games
any time a character is ready to be unlocked, the computer turns into a hellish cheating jerk with increased speed and strength that no human player can react fast enough, it ignores your attacks and presses on with its, it can even grab the smash ball in one hit, blocks with its shield very often. ITS VERY UNFAIR

classic mode has the option to purchase extra lives but costs gold coins but you no longer cant grind for cold coins fast and easy cause the game was patched

still no stage builder which i would prefer from brawl, not wii u. wii u's stage builder was a total mistake. any nice looking stage posted online is too perfect to be true, smash brawl's stage builder wasnt perfect either but at least it had blocks and stuff ready to be assembled into a stage.

Characters that NO ONE WANTED

Horrible redesigns like other m samus when it SHOULD BE Prime suit samus. FAIL NINTENDO.

Too many and recolored clones

the same lame stages from before

no new items

This game is fun at all levels. There are so many characters to unlock and play with. You can find your character, get good with them and play friends online. This is also a great party game since nearly every guy that plays video games seems to know this game. Haven't played Smash since Melee? No worries, you'll feel right at home with this game. Want to just play the single player mode? They have that too. I'm 30 years old. I've played this with my nephews who are 4 and with other friends that are 30. The same ones that played when we were 18. I highly recommend this game. It is a must have game for the switch.
titles: One of the best multiplayer fighting games ever released

review_contents: This is a great game with a ton of content. You really get your monies worth with characters and fun etc. I noticed that most 1 star reviews are from people who did not get the game or had trouble getting the codes to work. That does not actually say anything about the games content because those reviewers were not able to play the game in the first place. So take the low reviews with a grain of salt. I have played the game and I think it's beyond 5 stars.
titles: Most reviews are not about the game

review_contents: This is a joke. I've been a fan since 64. You would think in 2018, technical issues would not be a problem. Nope, these clowns made the buggiest, least responsive and unbalanced game to date. The story mode is also a lazy joke. The only saving grace is the sound track. You have 74 characters, only a handful are viable due to the horrible balancing. Most characters are absurdly weak (priority non-existent, low damage, bad recovery, and low knock back/killing potential).
titles: Horrific input lag and online lag

review_contents: Its smash ultimate. What else do i need to say.

I love that this version of Smash Bros doesn't just hand you all the characters like Brawl on the 3DS did. I wouldn't say I'm not an avid brawler, but I've played every Smash Bros since the N64 version. This one is the best. You get rewarded for playing the game, but the true challenges await those who are good or who get gud. Don't let these idiots rating 1 star deter you away. Smash is still the best brawler out there, expanding their repertoire of fighters into other franchises like Sony's exclusives. (Sorry Microsoft, you're left out again and you still are just the weakest of the console wars. But at least you got Madden.... LOL)

This game is definitely my favorite of the series, the controls are very responsive and satisfying, I love how Nintendo went with a more cartoony and cel shaded art style. The classic mode difficulty system is amazingly improved from the previous games, as it changes depending on how good you do. The battles you fight are also really cool because they depend on which characters you play as. But I wish they could add more unique bosses rather than just master hand and crazy hand for most players. The training trajectory lines are very vool, and the way you can choose what assist trophy or pok√©mon you summon is an awesome aspect. The final smash meter is really nice also, usually when I was playing in smash 4, my sister would always get the smash ball before I could, and it would end up being unfair. The final smash meter fixes that by giving everyone a fair chance to use a final smash. The way rule sets work is really cool now also. I hated having to change the rules from time to stock every time I booted up smash 4. The story mode wasn't really a story and it was only 1 player, but otherwise it was a really fun 20 hours spent of getting super overpowered spirits to destroy CPUs with. At the end, (SPOILER ALERT) You play as master hand against ALL 74 CHARACTERS!! This was probably the best event match in all of the entire adventure. I thought the end was a little anit-climactic for how long it took to get to it, but, ya know, it's not about the destination, it's about the journey. The entire thing was fun except for two spirits that I had to give up on fighting because they were too difficult. These spirits were Dr. Wily and Pauline. My sister had no problem with these ones and I saw that Dr. Wily makes it so the opposing fighter's final smash meter charges faster and Pauline, (I'm not 100% confident about this, but) Pauline's spirit heals you when your sheild takes a hit.

And the moment you've all been waiting for,

THE CHARACTERS!!

The characters are all super fun to play as (if you know how to) and unlocking them was really fun. I unlocked most of them through the story mode and that takes longer than if you just fight battles and get Challenger approaching battles, but IMO the story mode way is more fun.
titles: If your kid wants this game, get it. Don't hesitate.

review_contents: My 3 grandsons received this game because it allowed for more than one player. Two of them enjoy it - the third tried a few times and didn't like it. They get frustrated at the learning curve with added characters, but have managed. However, we got a surprise recently when two of them were playing for their allotted hour, then found one playing and one watching because he got knocked out of the tournament they were in. A few minutes later, found them both watching like it was a TV program. They both got knocked out of the tournament, but the game continued! Did not know this game did that. So, new rule... if you play, it can't be a tournament. Didn't pay that price so they could watch a boring cartoon.

Good:
+ Amazing attention to detail, I would say this is on par with red dead redemption 2 in terms of the details put into the game. Simply fascinating!
+ Great selection of characters. I especially like the Kirby and King Dedede. Every character feels well polished and unique, with their own voices/skillsets. Each character even has multiple costumes to choose from!!
+ Fun gameplay, whether you are playing serious with 1v1, or free for all and anything goes, there is something for everyone. I especially liked the free for all and team battles with ridiculous items that are fun to play very forgiving.
Bad:
- Bad online experience with lag every ~5 games. Though this is made up for with the great local/party play.
- Does not have a great tutorial. However, the controls are straightforward enough that after a few games you should get the idea.

I've always not been into fighting games such as this, but somehow this game just does it for me. I bought street fighter and soul calibur, and logged maybe 2 hours tops on those. Yet somehow, I already have 30 hours on smash bros.
titles: Amazing Fun for a First Timer!!

review_contents: If you're buying this to play online. DONT. Nintendo have done what the typically do and give a big middle finger to the online community. You can't queue just 1v1, you can "prefer" 1v1 but its still random between whoever you get matched up with what rule set you play with and I'm currently getting about 80% games as FFA matches with 4 people. Even though they launched their new "paid online service", the matches are still Peer-to-Peer with one person getting horrid lag.

This is a great game. If you love Smash you will love this. I played Smash4 online for literal years. It had it's flaws and even at the time I probably thought it needed improving. But I didn't know what bad was. I can not play the online mode for this game for more than a few minutes before it is just not worth my time anymore. Virtually no control over game modes, you can't switch characters in between games if you want to play with the same people (unless you move and somehow coordinate with those people to a completely different game mode that you can not invite people directly to or communicate with them unless you have some app on your phone), and even the limited amount of control you do have the game treats like a suggestions. Tell it you want to play teams with no items? You will still end up in about 45% 1v1 or free-for-all with items on or something. This game has so many great local modes and is seriously well designed and beautiful. Which is why it breaks my heart to say the online mode is so unplayable and frustrating that it will ruin your afternoon rather than be something fun. So if you only play local, this game is great. Maybe even worth the price of the game and all the eventual DLC. But if you want to play against real people online just skip this. It isn't worth it.
titles: Do not buy this if you wanted to play online.

review_contents:
Coming all the way from Super Smash Brothers for the Nintendo 64 and playing all the proceeding games after, Super Smash Brothers Ultimate (SSBU) is the best multiplayer fighting game for the Switch.

So many characters to choose from but I highly recommend using any controller based on the Gamecube buttons for better performance.

Note: to unlock the characters more efficiently, go to Classic mode and follow this map (see attached image).

Get yourself a copy and happy playing!
titles: Game of the year. Hands down.

review_contents: Like some, I believed Ultimate was a port with added features/characters but after playing it for 15hrs and now just over 100 smash battles (which is approximately how long it‚Äôll take to unlock the fighters if you just go smash mode and don‚Äôt unlock in the story) I see it is a new entry! The controls are tighter than the previous game, different animations, final smashes for some fighters and more stages to choose from‚Äîthis is the game to own for the Switch and guarantees hours and hours of fun scenarios. If you work a stressful job, got too much drama at home or getting over a rough spot this game will help to zap some stress. Wish they‚Äôd add Dante, Master Chief, Lara Croft and Batman!!
titles: A whole new entry into the Smash Bros world

review_contents: This game is a great successor to the last Super Smash Bros. game. It adds tons of new modes, characters, and collectibles and even has a story mode. Kind of. The game-play is great - still fast-paced and action packed. Lots of tense moments and moments of friendship killing. My favorite. The game keeps all of the character from the last game and more. Every single character that has ever made an appearance in Smash Bros. is in this game. Most characters are relatively balanced. The "story mode" is more of a spirit collection mode. Spirits are the new collectible. They're basically just characters turned into abilities. There's also the spirit board, a place where you attempt to defeat an opponent to gain a new spirit. The spirits are a cool addition. You can even use them in regular matches to make things completely unfair! There's also the FS Meter. It's a meter that charges up a little every time you get hit or hit someone. Once it's full you can use a smash attack. Overall, this game is extremely fun and innovates in many ways from it's predecessor.

I haven‚Äôt played smash since the first one but I was pretty excited about this one. Long story short it is incredibly difficult and not in a fun dark souls way and the campaign is the definition of repetitive. You will do the same battle over and over and over and over and over again. In addition, the game doesn‚Äôt do a good job in laying out the spirits system so that you could at least find some fun in that.

Having said that the battles are incredibly fun with beautiful graphics and music, I just start to get very bored very quickly and this game is better in very short bursts.

I haven't had any troubles at all with the online feature

I'm sure if I played this game in the past or its variants, that it would be enjoyable. But, if this is your first time playing a game like this, it's a hot mess. Stuff is flying everywhere. Characters and maps are moving everywhere. The movements are all over the place, then you die. Save your money and play the classics like Street Fighter, Doom, etc.
I bought this game and wow! It is fantastic. It truely is the ULTIMATE game.

I got this for my son and he loves it but I honestly don‚Äôt see the appeal. I can understand why a kid would like it since they like anything shiny, with bells and whistles, but the gameplay IMO is weak. The characters are unresponsive and the screen feels chaotic.
I‚Äôd take an old street fighter game over this any day.
Anyway, I have to play since my sometimes since my son needs someone to play with but I feel like it‚Äôs torture.
And, honestly, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs good for kids. It seems to make encourage shortening attention spans. Wish I never bought it.

This video game great! The graphics are full of detail, and each level will take you a while to fully complete. I like how it gradually gives you tips on how to play the game instead of giving the list of instructions all at once. It has an option for an additional player to control mario's hat, which allows for 2 player option. Would recommend.
titles: A lot of fun to play and watch

review_contents:
Ok, people are giving low stars for the wrong reasons.
1 star because you thought you were getting physical copy and instead got a digital copy. When you change your option to standard+ultimate fighter DLC the standard changes to nintendo switch digital code automatically because you can't buy the physical copy that has the DLC option. The DLC is digital content. You have to go back and choose standard which will them give you the nintendo switch option again which is the physical copy.
Another gave 2 stars because they didn't like the game. That sounds like a problem with the game content which is a personal preference not a problem with the provider of this product. You just lowered their overall star rating because you like traditional fighting games over this.
Unless there is a real issue concerning the service of this product provider please consider only issuing good ratings if you plan to offer your opinions.
Thank you!

I havent played Smash since gamecube, so this game is brand new for me.

Everything about this game is excellent imo, 10 outta 10, but the online battle is frustratingly laggy....

I even spent 30 bucks on the recommended nintendo LAN adapter (being a brand loyalist) to make it play smoothly & it is doing nothing of the sort.

I just got kicked out of an online 1v1 (which made me type this review) RIGHT when it started due to lag & then they warn me that Ill be banned if I dont play with a better connection..... Huh?

But I have great wifi & your LAN adapter..... What gives, Nintendo? My Splatoon 2 runs super smooth, and Ive been playing that BEFORE I purchased the LAN. [Which I purchased specifically for SmashU in order to alleviate the lag problems]

Also online matchmaking is pretty frustrating too, id rather wait in the waiting room for 2 minutes to get my preferred battles, then get placed in a battle setting I dont want. [Or as least give me the option to choose whether I want to play a 4v or continue to wait for my preferred 1v1]

A patch update is coming out next week so maybe things will get better, the game has been out for less than a week so I understand its still fresh; but still, online play needs to run like butter in order to Smash FA REAL or else whats the point of playing?

[[[ Ill give Smash Ultimate an honest 4 stars for now; that 1 missing star is for the frustrating online experience. If/when they fix it, then this game will easily be a pure 5, infinite fun masterpiece.)))

God bless you all and Smash Responsibly!
God is Gr8 (my Smash Tag)

PS: But I will say this, in defense of the game; when the connection is running SMOOTHLY, trust me, the battles are GLORIOUS! It feels like youre watching an action packed Anime, so clean yet so BRUTAL! XD. I can literally watch the same replay of a fight for HOURS & it only gets better each view. Pick this game up, its a trip.

This is probably the most "Nintendo-ey" game I have ever played. It is dripping with playable easter-eggs. Nintendo took a basket of easter-eggs, smashed them, and scrambled them into an omelette. The classic maps with classic music is so freakin' cool with this oddly violent gameplay happening. It has such a chaos-happy-crazy contrast that only Smash can generate. The roster is gigantic and I hope they keep it going with perhaps 1 or 2 more DLC packs after this one. If I had my way, I would have TMNT in their SNES Turtles in Time game style. I would have Double Dragon and Contra characters. That would take this game into like 6 or 7 stars. If you are into fighting games, you have to try this.

Although I have not played all aspects of SSBU, I will have to say that I have enjoyed very much what I have played so far. Visually, this is the most stunning SSB yet, with great textures and images of each character and, specifically the stages (I enjoyed the updated older stages as well). The Spirit aspect is interesting and the way to get newer characters is more simplified than some of the earlier SSB (although similar to the last SSB for Wii U and 3DS). Admittedly, I would have liked a simple trophy section as the other games, but this is a small nitpick.

The game is pretty fun but I've lost almost complete interest in it after 2 weeks. I was hoping to put in some hours playing online but the peer 2 peer connection is a joke. Sometimes you get lucky and there is zero lag, most of the time there is a noticeable lag and from time to time you get TONS of lag with 5 in game seconds taking as much as a minute in real world time. It's a real shame since i feel like online play is what will keep people coming back, if anyone one is curious my ping ranges between 14 - 26 ms depending on the time of day.

Online is Terrible. Matchmaking is a dumb hodgepodge random garbage. If you have a lousy match you are forced to stay and watch the remaining monkeys spank each other's bananas. Not to mention the mind numbing lag. If you leave then you get an online ban for a couple hours. Really, Nintendo?

Rest of the game is entertaining, but feels stale quickly.

Game is fun solo, but only a little bit. You play classic mode and it's really repetitive, world of light is hot trash and the online is just well, it's Nintendo so it's really laggy, and bad. I couldn't hit anyone in half the games i played, Literally going to attack someone the attack hits, but they take no percentage damage and immediately attack back, cancelling whatever animation you were doing prior to them hitting you, and you get outplayed by internet latency. The frame rate drop was unbearable when one player had a bad connection and you need to wait for them to catch up, which thinking about it makes more sense that they are probably lag switching to periodically stutter the game to win.

Get it for a party couch game, don't get it for the online "experience" or whatever they wanna call it.

As someone who has never played a smash game, up until this game was teased... this game is complete garbage.

Just kidding it's the best smash game I've ever played, yes, better then... the one we don't talk about... "melee" MELEEEEEEEE AAAAAAAHHHHHH. This review is the same one I've given on metacritic

When I play this game it's as fun as any smash will get, 70+ characters, 103 stages, and a lot of content with classic mode and adventure mode.

This game is as hype as it will get, Joker as D:C, piranha plant, everything. Our daddy Sakurai poured his heart and soul into this game, literally, I was half expecting him to be a spirit. I've played hundreds of hours of brawl and Wii u, each his feels like you hit, like for example if you up B someone as Luigi your heart RACES as you see it zoom as the spike noise plays

BUT, with all of this said... Online is a MESS, battle arenas are... well, for some reason you can't change rules unless you DELETE it, and if you're hosting your stage seems to never get picked, that's not even mentioning the fact that game play sometimes turns from maximum smash mode to "1 sec I need to load". Meaning the game pauses for up to 10 seconds. Random matches are a mess, everything is a mess, it's preferred rules instead of just rules, and while I'm on the topic of online... you have to PAY for online, you have to pay for a peer to peer non dedicated server mess of a service with little to no redeeming features while Nintendo is all like "HEY!! LOOK!!! OUR OLD GAMES!!!! YOU KNOW THE ONES YOU CAN EMULATE FOR FREE EASIER THEN PAYING US" now it WOULD make sense if you were paying for dedicated servers for smash where you DON'T PAUSE every five seconds and STILL have input lag, but it's not like that.

As someone who doesn't play online other then with friends in an arena it doesn't bring down my score as much as expected, but still, if you're buying smash for a pure online experience... well... you might be REALLY mad when you realise you just shelled out 60 dollars to have to pay 20 more dollars for literally nothing.

When it comes down to it, Sakurai probably has no say in what online can be, other then preferred rules and the stupid arenas, but hey, it's not as bad as I was expecting.
This is a honest 4/5 for me, but if the online was fixed it would be 5/5.

I did find a review from 2015 that stated my suspicions: this is not for kids, this is for competitive tournament gaming. Try getting my kid play on level 1. Good luck! I hear the gamers like it.
Pro: my kid can practice dealing with loss and frustration
titles: A Competitive Game not for Kids - teaches GRIT

review_contents:
If you want this game for online play, I recommend that you absolutely do not bother. There is not a single redeeming quality about online play whatsoever. My personal biggest complaint is that you can‚Äôt even change characters for a rematch. The GSP system is good in theory but its entirely too flawed and makes things less fun. I‚Äôm bored/annoyed playing this game after like 15 minutes every time I try to.

HOWEVER, if you want this game for local co-op, it‚Äôs perfect and I highly recommend it. If you‚Äôre like me and don‚Äôt have friends around that like to play games, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

This game is fun and I love playing all the smash bro‚Äôs games but a couple cons...

1.They don‚Äôt teach you how to play the game. That may sound strange since playing smash bro‚Äôs is pretty simple, but this is a new system and different controller so it would‚Äôve helped to explain how to do certain things

2.this game is way too expensive, actually most Nintendo switch games are lol

3.the story mode is weak. Nintendo seemed to put no thought or effort into it. No good cutscenes, a stupid map, and random ‚Äúspirits‚Äù.

4. You only start off with about 6 characters üòë
titles: Great game but has a couple of stupid problems

review_contents: Great game but the the most annoying aspect are some of the ridiculous challenges on the adventure mode that isn't good for those who lead a busy life because certain challenges will cause you to want to toss the switch out the window and run it over with a truck. I would have preferred if they had most of the characters already unlocked like the older games.
titles: Stupidly hard challenges in the adventure mode

review_contents: I had this game that I bought here in Amazon delivered to my nephew in Japan, but a friend gave me this Super Smash Bros ultimate as present for Christmas. I‚Äôm not a fan of fighting games, so I never thought I would like this one. This one have adventure mode, which unlocks the fighter as you go progress in the game. It‚Äôs very addicting so be careful when you buy this for your child. Make sure they only play this after doing their homework, house chores or when they‚Äôre doing very well in school.
titles: I survived the lonely holidays because of this game

review_contents: Pros: Hours of fun and lots of unlockables, every fighter plays different even if some look alike, tons of content to keep you playing for a long time without getting bored, music is a joy to listen too, adventure mode is addictive and graphics look amazing! If you want to unlock characters faster just play either classic mode or spirit mode on easy and new challengers appear often. (Make sure to beat them to unlock) Cons: Some fights feel almost impossible to beat on adventure mode, A few fighters seem out of place and don‚Äôt belong in the game (example: Wii fit trainer, seriously?) The user interface can be confusing to use at times and there really isn‚Äôt much of a story to tell other than the intro. Lastly, online needs some work but is playable. Other than that this is still a great game.

I bought Smash from GameStop. But this is the most beautiful video game aside from Mario Odyssey I‚Äôve ever played. So clean, gorgeous colors and graphics. An absolute must-have for avid players over the past 20 years and brand new players. Everyone will have a blast playing this with friends and family. I don‚Äôt know if this will be the last of the series, but this one is gonna last for a very long time! Happy Smashing everyone!

My favorite game on the switch! Great for groups, parties, friends who play together, friends who play far away, and with random people online. Great for casual fun, or for practicing and becoming amazing with Ridley!
Game I recommend to people most on the switch.

Being a Wolf fan and main, I'm ecstatic that Wolf is finally back in Smash Bros. and to celebrate, I bought a Switch just to play Smash Bros Ultimate xD The game has over 70 playable characters and more will be announced as a DLC. There will also be updates to the game where you will see buffs and nerfs on the characters to "balance" the gameplay. Speaking of gameplay, while playing Wolf I noticed that there is some lag when I execute a smash attack. There have been talks online that lag is common. I don't know if that is part of the mechanics or if its actual lag but I got used to it pretty quickly. Also, if you have a GameCube controller, dust off that old controller and buy a controller adapter because you can use it on the Switch now. In fact, if you don't have a GameCube controller, you can still buy official controllers brand new! Nintendo started remanufacturing the same controllers and you still need the adapter to use it on the Switch. This shows that these controllers is a must for any Smash game. If you have played Smash Bros. in the past, you don't want to miss this one!
This the best game ever

The name of the game is Ultimate, and the game sticks with that theme for the whole game! The multiplayer is as great as ever (excluding the online matchmaking). Tight controls and easy-to-learn hard-to-master gameplay is great for long-time fans and extremely accessible for new ones! And where "Ultimate" really comes in the game is that EVERYONE IS HERE! Old fighters and a bunch of highly requested characters are here, and 6 dlc characters on the way, 2 of them being Phiranha Plant and Joker from Persona 5! Including all those characters, there's over 100 stages you can play on! And most of them are awesome stages! Now onto the singleplayer. World of Light is underwhelming for some, but awesome for others, and I'm with the ladder. If you don't like World of Light, no need to fear, Games and More are here! Games and more include Classic Mode, Multiman Smash, Training, Mii, and (i can't remember and I'm too lazy too...). There's a crap ton of content for every type of player! I've fallen in love with this game and I think this is the best game in the switch by far. 5 stars!!! üéáüéáüéáüéáüéá
titles: Amazing game for Veterans and Newcomers!

review_contents: The game is great, but I preordered the game because it said it'd be guaranteed by 11am the day it released. Well I stayed hom waiting for it and the UPS guy didn't drop it off till 4pm. I would've been better off pre ordering it at a store and going to picm it up. I gave amazon a shot for preordering, this will probably be the last time I do that.

When i checked online about the arrival of an important package; it said it was delivered directly at 12:39pm on Sunday.
It was later in the evening when I check and there was no package there. I then looked on line and it said to check with neighbors and double check my address and wait 36 hours. WELL IT WAS DELIVERED ON MONDAY, You caused me a great deal of worry, and extra work, GET YOU % TOGETHER AND TELL IT LIKE IT IS.

This is the best fighting game I have ever played. The gameplay is so silky smooth and the game looks amazing. There is so much content that it will take hundreds of hours to see everything. I am normally not a fan of fighting games, but this game has made me a fan.

I‚Äôve been a fan of this franchise since the very first installment on the Nintendo 64. To me, this game is peak Super Smash Bros. (some might call it the ULTIMATE experience). I truly do hope to pick up my other Switch games sometime soon, but until Sakurai and his team stop releasing new DLC fighters every few months, that might be pretty difficult!
titles: My other games are feeling neglected.

review_contents: Imagine this you preordered the game, you receive it, it's completely packaged, so you wrap it and place it under the tree. Christmas morning your 8 year old opens it and gets so excited cause it's what he wanted. Only to open it and there being no game. Nothing. Not even a booklet. I didn't order the digital one because I have 2 boys with their own switch so this way they can each play it. I'm super irritated right now. Amazing was nice enough to do an instant refund but I could repurchase and wait until Thursday or get the digital and download immediately but only one switch will have it. Great!

The best game on the Nintendo switch, even with a zelda game and mario game already released. Would start to play and could not put down for hours on end. true masterpiece of a game. Everyone should rush out and get this! Love this game in so many way, had to stop playing it just long enough to write this review, The steel case Is awesome and the roster of the game is truly astonishing perfectly blending old and new character from many different games. The amount of modes and customization
titles: The best game on the Nintendo switch!

review_contents:
THE HYPE IS REAL
I haven't dedicatedly played Nintendo games since the GameCube, and this feels JUST like Melee! the graphics are insane. The number of laughs and "Woah"'s I have said are limitless. It is too much fun. There are innumerable settings, maps, and characters. The level of greatness in this game is equal to BREATH OF THE WILD! I can already tell it's going to be one of those games that will be spoken about for years.
titles: Own a Switch??? BUY THIS GAME!

review_contents: The amount of content this version of smash has is crazy.. You will log hundreds of hours in game and still have Alot to do. From what I've seen its gonna be a hit!
titles: This game will win every reward known to man.

review_contents: There is so much content packed into this game and all of it is extremely polished and enjoyable. With 74 characters in the base game, 103 stages and a very enjoyable adventure mode this truly is the Ultimate version of Smash.

I'm an old school Street Fighter player, and this game is garbage in comparison. It's cool to see all the game characters, but it's basically just a chaotic button mashing hope-for-the-best-fest for the kiddies. Don't get this if you're serious about fighting games.

I bought it from store, not from here. Yes, Mario is in there and there 2 ways to unlock the characters!! Its in many ways to unlock it such as Home-Run contest, I unlocked Luncina. I unlocked mostly in Smash or Spirits Adventure. I used to play old Super Smash bros which are different how you unlock characters.. but now there are about 74 characters in there similar to Marvel vs Capcom 2. I was unexpected Belmont to be in it which is great!! You can practice it in Games&More to go in train in there. I think you can unlock more characters in Classic mode too. I think its amazing but one negative is it needs to work on internet with out lags! Sweet!!!

Haven't gotten the game yet but why is it 9.4 on IGN, smh should be 9.7 at least...
anywho would update review when I get the game later tonight !! for now ill play lifelight on repeat!!

Update: Okay Amazon delivered it way earlier than I thought so, left school to get the game, and omg cover is amazing, haven't played it yet cause I have to go back to school but awesome cover! will update once i start playing.

This game is incredible. I got this game on Jan. 2nd, and I have been playing it non-stop. I mean I have unlocked all the characters and it just makes it so much more fun. I adore playing as Solid Snake and seeing him shoot rockets, throw grenades and crawl all over the stage. Plus the game has a great mode that keeps you fighting with handicaps. It isn't easy at all, but it is very enjoyable. If you don't have this game, and you have a switch, go out and get it. I promise you wont be disappointed.

full disclosure: I have never played any smash games before this. from what I have played of this game so far, it seems really great and well-thought-out. the graphics are amazing, and while the fighting and combos are hard to learn at first, they get easier as you go on. one thing that i'm not a huge fan of is that when you start the game, you only have the original characters from the first smash. this isn't awful, but it is a tad annoying that you have to go around and beat all the 70+ fighters to unlock them. i did know this was a feature of the game before I got it and I still think the game is great. I would recommend this game to any newcomers to smash.

It‚Äôs good, but the natural switch controllers are so bad, can‚Äôt even begin to explain how many times I couldn‚Äôt get the second jump! It‚Äôs driving me nuts so I‚Äôm ordering some GC controllers, this game seriously needs it.
titles: Need better controllers like GameCube to truly enjoy.

review_contents:
Best smash game of all time.

Join my smash Bros esports league (group) on #MeWe dot com . We will be holding tournaments, and giving away prizes. (Not for professionals).
#smashbros #Nintendo #switch

Search ‚Äúsmash Bros mewe League‚Äù in the mewe group directory.
titles: Join Smash Bros Tournament League on MeWe (.com)

review_contents: This is by far the best game I've played on the Switch. Awesome graphics and huge selection of playable characters. I loved the first one on the Nintendo Wii Console years ago and didn't think they'd ever top that. But they did! I definitely recommend this game 5/5

This game is a must have if you own a switch and have played a super smash bros. game in the past. The roster is the best you‚Äôll find in any game, period. The stage list, the characters, and the music is more robust than ever. The fanservice in this game is impeccable. This game is really fun when playing with others. The modes will keep you busy for hours. It‚Äôs almost flawless except for one thing: the online. I hope Nintendo fixes the online experience with future updates and patches. That is the only thing holding back this already great game. Highly recommend!
titles: The best smash game with one flaw holding it back from being near perfect

review_contents:
Let me start off by saying this is a great game I love that Sakurai put all smash characters and stages in the Game. But what about the other modes such as ,all star mode , Home run constest , Stage builder and even, Target Smash. Those were the Modes that I was really looking forward to playing when this game came out. I know the Nintendo Switch online service sucks as crap and Nintendo doesn‚Äôt need anymore money until they fix it but the least they could do was fix the modes that‚Äôs all I‚Äôm saying .

(P.S) Sakurai when the next Nintendo console comes out and Super Smash Bros 6 comes to the next gen Nintendo system please put Waluigi in the game me and many others would be very appreciative.
titles: Super Smash Bros Ultimate is great but  it‚Äôs lacking some features

review_contents: Online is the worst lag for any game far and away in 2018, literally lags worse than games from 2001 on xbox live to the point of most games will drop to below 1fps, especially if you get an item game when your queing for no items, awesome game outside online, but absolute trash if your looking to play online definitely take that into consideration.
titles: Online is horrifically bad with the lag, 80% of the games you can barely even play with the fps

review_contents: its a great game even though i dont have it yet looooooooool ya yeeeeet

Great party game. Amazing that it supports up to 8 players.

There are lots of strategy involved and it's a game where you can get better and better at with practice.
titles: Fun party game; lots of strategy involved; brings back good memories from N64

review_contents: Okay. am a big fan of Splatoon, Zelda, and Mario Cart. the concept of all the characters in one place was interesting. my point is simple. 1. ui design is failed. really hard to find right path 2. gameplay. it is so distracting. I believe this is not a good game at all to me. :(
But we all know it is gonna be 5 stars
titles: Now sure why we can review before the game comes out.

review_contents:
The level of detail in this game is unbelievable! From the 70+ characters, 100s of stages, 1000+ songs, stages that change as you battle , multiple game modes etc this game was made with love and an insane attention to detail !
This game is like a virtual toy box with so many colorful and amazing characters !
A must buy for switch owners!
My granddaughter got a new game console and this game was on her birthday list. She really enjoys playing it with her friends online during the quarantine.

My very lucky son got 2 of these for Christmas. I returned mine and let the grandparents take the glory. They know he has been a Super Smash Bros gamers for years. He loves the game play and characters. Great family game as well. Graphics are great! They did well as usual.

I bought this game because it looked good and people recommend it but... I quickly found out that it can be very hard to win and you have to work hard to get other characters this game can be very hard and frustrating , but with practice I think it would be fun!

Wonderful game, should be in everyone‚Äôs switch library. Good alone, or with friends. Also the music is amazing (don‚Äôt ignore the my music section- you‚Äôll miss out on music that you‚Äôd never hear). I‚Äôm hearing Nintendo might update the game with more content (characters, stage builder?!... and more m), if so, it makes this already amazing deal even better. Highly recommended.

Terrible game, the spirit board is one of the most unbalanced and blatantly cheap things I've seen in video games in a long time. They have this massive roster and 95% of it is unavailable at the start, terrible crappy game that tries to manipulate you into playing it more with pointless unlockables because it knows its garbage made by amateur 5 year olds. So happy I didn't spend a dime on this garbage fire.

This game is total garbage. I had high expectations with all the hype that was surrounding it. I can‚Äôt figure out why anyone would ever think this game was good. If there is a story mode or co op option I couldn‚Äôt figure it out. Total waste of money. Shame on me for not renting the game first. This isn‚Äôt the first time I‚Äôve been bitten by a switch game.

I really enjoyed this game the more generations of gaming you have been through the more you will appreciate the taste and flashbacks of various games. I must say this is a game you have to grind about 20 hours before you can get all your characters or go on YouTube for fast character unlocks and cut the time by more than half of that. Very pleased with this one Go Nintendo!!!

I‚Äôve been playing my friends copy of this while waiting for mine and it‚Äôs super fun. I really like starting with like 8-9 characters and having to unlock the rest. The adventure mode is also interesting and will give you something to do solo.

The game is horribly unbalanced. With the new knockback physics they did not accommodate many characters accordingly. Many have bad recoveries and when fighting other characters with the meta as it is now many also have high knockback moves with no lag between commands.

A character should either be fast, powerful, or have viable projectiles, and a good recovery but for the love of God not all four
My son got this a gift and he loves it!

It‚Äôs Smash Brothers. At this point if you‚Äôre reading a review for for it you‚Äôve actually probably already bought it. If you haven‚Äôt bought it just go ahead and do it. After 75 plus hours played I can tell you it may just be the best one yet.

I would totally recommend this game. Can smash get any better? With joker and a FRICKIN plant in it as DlC, the sky is the limit! Great gameplay and smooth visuals. 60 frames! 78 characters! And all those third parties! Smash 5 is the new Melee. I completely love this game and the characters were unlocked in just 2 weeks. If you hate smash after this new installment, what is wrong with you? The new story mode is incredible. Spirits add a nice touch. This is the series's finest moment, all packed in with a heap of action and flashy looks. Ultimate.

I was playing this game a lot for about 3 weeks and was busy, just came back and am playing again, every single match I've played (maybe 10 or so) since I came back have all been unbearably laggy. It is 100% unplayable. And if I self destruct to end the game the warn me I'll be banned. Not sure what happened in the last 2-3 weeks that make it so much worse but my download speed is over 100mps and ping is 12 so I'm not sure what else I can do.

The best Smash Bros in the series hand down. And I would even say it's the best bang for your buck on the switch. This is a must have game of the generation and will stay relevant for many years to come! :)
Cool and all but didnt get to play on release even after being told my package got upgraded to arrive here same day release. Would have been nice to play over the weekend but guess ill have to wait.

The game is fun if you play local but online is impossible to play competitively. There is so much input lag and sometimes buttons won't even register (tried this with gamecube and 2 joycons, one that came with the switch and one set brand new)

I would pick zero stars but it won‚Äôt let me. There was no cartridge in the case. Apparently this is happening a lot with Nintendo and they are taking no responsibility for it. So I basically paid $60 for an empty case.

As 2018 wrapped up as a weird year full of great games and disappointments. We got one last big game before the end of 2019 year and that comes with Nintendo‚Äôs Super Smash Ultimate. Where everyone joins the battlefield as Nintendo characters and guest characters duke it out. I was always a causal smash fan since I was a child. Playing Melee and 64 playing the Wii U version at a friends house. I picked up the latest smash game without hesitation owning a switch and it being the biggest game Nintendo released this year. Probably the biggest game of 2018. Is smash a smash? Or is it more of a crash? Let‚Äôs find out.

Pros:
Graphics, what was first thought a port of Smash 4 from the Wii U. Turns out it was a full sequel with various graphical improvements, smooth frame-rate and it looks great whether in handheld mode or big screen mode. While it's not the prettiest game in the world graphical speaking it still utilizes the power of the switch perfectly.

Gameplay, I don‚Äôt like fighting games they‚Äôre not a genre I got into. That being said Smash 5 has fun and addicting gameplay that you can sink hours to. As someone who is rather indifferent to fighting games this is high praise. If I can describe it. It‚Äôs an easy to learn hard to master. Whether causal or looking to be competitive Smash is definitely the game to play.

Unlocks, a thing that was common in the past returns in its full glory in Smash 5. As someone who remembers unlocking stuff before it became DLC and sold smash utilizes unlocking it‚Äôs amazing roster of 76 Characters in the Smash Bros. Ultimate Roster (74 if you count Pokemon Trainer as one character): 69 different unique fighters, 7 Echo Fighters. It has a Season Pass that will include 5 more fighters, with Joker from Persona 5 being the first character after that was revealed I bought the Fighter Pass. Even without the pass you still get a lot of content in the base game it must be praised that it‚Äôs all earned through playing the game. I remember when fighting games back in the PS2 used to do this all the time and it just vanished replaced by monetization. I cannot praise this enough.

Multiplayer, whether it‚Äôs online which we will get to later or local smash is a fun multiplayer game. While everything is fun with friend Smash invokes a child like wonder that few games can get out of me while I did grow up with the series with melee most games sequels lose that magic that made them special but not smash ultimate truly a timeless game series for everyone to enjoy both old and new.

Music, only mention music when it grabs my attention and Smash‚Äôs orchestral battle theme does just that. Plus various tracks and remixes from other Nintendo games. We get one hell of a soundtrack and score to accompany the game.

Cons:
Online, more of a Nintendo problem than a smash one but still bad nonetheless is the Online structure for the switch is dreadful. Sure it come a long way from the wii days but it‚Äôs still not good. Also nintendo is now charging for online while they‚Äôre the cheapest option in the market they‚Äôre still the most awful. Matchmaking is sluggish, netcode is sloppy, and it just a hassle it‚Äôs easier to trackdown your friends in real life and put them in one room than play online. Which I prefer the local over online but still this doesn‚Äôt excuse the poor online given the fact that Nintendo can make successful online live service games like Splatoon 2.

Meta, Bayonetta on launch day is more the enough said. But to elaborate if you play this game competitively than they‚Äôre only a certain viable fighters. Most will play this casually so it‚Äôs not a big deal but the meta changes are all subjected to change and it can either more the most balanced smash to date or the most broken. Only time will tell and for now the metas this ain‚Äôt it chief.

In conclusion, Smash Bros Ultimate closed 2018 in a bang. Putting it well into my top 5 games of 2018. It‚Äôs one of those games that make you have to buy a Switch. I‚Äôve bought the Fighter Pass I‚Äôm excited for the Persona 5 DLC as I am a fan of Persona 5. Whether alone or with friends Smash Bros Ultimate is fun no matter. 5. Smash Bros Ultimate not only one of the best games of 2018 it‚Äôs one of the best in the Switch‚Äôs library an absolute must for anyone who owns a Nintendo Switch to play.

Its Smash, I'm not sure what to say that everyone isn't already aware of. Best fighter ever (minus some of the issues online due to Nintendo living in the stone age and still using P2P connections...). I bought it for couch coop/parties and it's the best one yet. Super happy with this game other than the online issues, but I didnt take off a star due to the fantastic amount of single player content and the fact that it's basically the best game ever to get drunk and play with friends in person. Pro tip: once everyone is too drunk to play well, we like to set all the CPU's to random on level 9 3 stock and bet cash on which one will win ;)

If you‚Äôre reading this then you‚Äôre probably a parent not sure what this game is about. You‚Äôre probably also looking to see if your kid will like it. I‚Äôll save you some trouble and just encourage you to get it. There are so many characters and lots to do. It‚Äôs an instant fighting classic.
